My friend proved it was delivered two days prior but not before the front desk had made her feel like it wasn't their problem and it was just too bad. We did end up getting a $50 room credit for the inconvenience. I wonder if we hadn't of known about the hamper being delivered whether we would have got it at all? Overall, if you want to be treated as a Z-grade celebrity on your holiday, then stay here for sure. If you can get past that, then it does have a certain tinseltown buzz about it and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TDC19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. It is an old hotel and is probably in need of some more TLC. The hotel had a very musty smell. The rooms were comfortable, no complaints there. Our room was overlooking the Theatre with views of the Hollywood sign. It was large and spacious and strangely had 2 showers in the bathroom. The staff were okay. On check-out, we were quite overcharged on the mini bar for items we did not consume and we didn't discover this until we had left. Not impressed. Not sure whether its value for money as work paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: deniseduong
Reviews.Content: The bed was nice, weird shower, workers were pretty good. Loud air unit. But overall is was an okay experience. For the price I would have chosen a better hotel. Beautiful building, great pool, out dated gym, employees were hit and miss. Would I stay here again? no.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here. 1 star fleabag tenderloin type hotel at 5 star prices.”
Reviews.Author: SueC398
Reviews.Content: Reflective of the prostitutes hanging around at night, worn out, filthy, and greedy for your money. A cross between the "Bates Motel" & "The Snake Pit." Room 506 overlooks a rooftop full of air conditioners and not much else. $4 charge to brew 1 cup of coffee in your room. The decor is more ignorant of style than minimalist. From the dark lobby & hallways to the huge creepy over-sized male head-shot photo (covered in greasy fingerprints) looking down at the beds. We suspected room 506 was once a true crime scene. My cousin guessed someone was murdered in front of her bed and someone had their throat cut in front of mine since the (beyond) filthy carpet was patched in two places with squares of now frayed and filthy carpet pieces. Top sheets on the bed are NOT supplied. Housekeeping explained I was to use the comforter cover as a top sheet however, the comforter is bulky and hot. I prefer sleeping under a sheet. When requested, housekeeping did supply 2 additional top sheets for ME to put on the beds. Don't expect turndown service when traveling in Mexico. Oh wait.... The bathroom was the most bizarre and dated I have ever seen. Hopefully you do not have a slip & fall in the bathroom. No handrails anywhere and if you fell, no one could ever get the door open to help. I believe the tiny toilet was taken from a demolished kindergarten to fit into the tiny bathroom. Because the toilets were designed for small children, the surrounding cement walls and floor were splashed with what appeared to be urine. If sitting on the toilet & someone tries to open the bathroom door, the door will hit you in the thigh just above the knee. Tub and shower are very dated and poorly designed. First 1/2 of the tub/shower is enclosed in permanent glass leaving the 2nd 1/2 open. This causes a flood on the floor when showering. At least it cleans the floor in front of the sink. The bottoms of my cleanly washed house shoes were filthy brown after the first day and I considered just leaving them in the trash rather than returning home with them. ACK!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, shame about the shower”
Reviews.Author: suzie d
Reviews.Content: the staff were friendly and helpful, and the room was fine and clean though alittle small, however the bathroom had no shelf space to put anything and the shower was awful just dripped out so had to have bath everyday! No upgrade or drinks even though on honeymoon which would of been a nice gesture. a good hotel if you want to party all night, but not for us as we wanted to see the sights so wanted full night sleep so could be out and about during the day, which wasnt possible due to pool party/nightclub noise.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Simon C
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived each and every member of staff we met at the hotel made us feel very welcome and special. Due to it being our honeymoon we had kindly been upgraded to a pool cabana room in advance. We were given free drinks from the exceptionally professional guy on reception, just because we'd said we'd had a long drive. The iconic hotel really lived up to expectations, from the lobby through to the pool it's just breath taking. After enjoying the complementary drinks at the pool bar we returned to our room to find a bottle of bubbly, red wine and a cheese board. This set up an amazing two days up which we thoroughly enjoyed. Location is amazing, right next to the Chinese Theatre and just a short drive to places like Universal Studios and The Griffin Observatory. We would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to stay in LA and enjoy a bit of it's glamour.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarbReid
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel full of character and ambience. In a fantastic location. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Only had room service food but it was excellent, and once again room service were lovely. Room wasn't swanky, but roomy and very clean. I left a significant amount of jewellery in the safe and it was handed in intact to security. I would be very happy to recommend this hotel, and very happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Yes to the Best of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: travelbestalways
Reviews.Content: Ambiance of the hotel makes the guest feel like "STAR", if you have passion to spend to enjoy the star status, appreciate luxury, comfort ... This is the best hotel with Excellent service in the area, country. Valet service and staff is excellent with a beautiful lobby. Staff, management, ownership appears to be caring for all conveniences of the guest, Thank You everyone for the efforts. Excellent High Speed Internet both wired and wireless all over the hotel. Guest services, Front desk staff is excellent to help with any needs. Every staff member is well informed, just need to get in touch with someone, call the Front desk or security to get connected to have the best experience and the stay to come back. Convenience and all the services are highly appreciable. Whenever in the area I stay here and is always better experience than the previous. I recommend highly to all my friends, associates and others who read here. I don't want to keep writing too much good as I'm not part of management or ownership but wanted to share positive about this heritage, we are proud of. Color black, furniture, paintings, design, layout is the great symbol of great heritage. Yes some people have negative but did they try to think, why ? and did they even try to contact someone from the hotel staff. You got to try it, give someone chance to help you and will know Yes its the best. Sure if you want to complain without talking to anyone what to say... It all makes a difference, how to enjoy star status, luxury, comfort, beauty, elegance ...

Reviews.Title: “Staff SO rude unless u r famous or flashing cash around”
Reviews.Author: Anna P
Reviews.Content: Room decent and pool lovely, but get down early as the sun beds get reserved v early. The staff are very rude here and just did not care about us at all. Some people, ie rich and or famous, are allowed to reserve beds, others r not or are even asked to move to make room for others! Not acceptable at all. In a v busy area. We stayed here for 3 nights then went to the petit ermitage on sunset for 4 nights after. About the same price but so so so much better at the ermitage! Staff welcoming, plenty of room and just so much better in very way! I would only stay at the Roosevelt if u want to be made to feel unwelcome!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but could be really great.”
Reviews.Author: RoaringBear
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on business many times and my recent visit is generally typical of my visits here. This is a hotel with a bit of charm and magic. Home to the first ever Oscars, the foyer on the ground floor is truly spectacular. If you are keen on art deco, then this is the place for you. The staff are generally pleasant enough apart from poolside where it's all abut too cool. The pool is a destination for beautiful people who can't smile! The bedrooms are nicely appointed and have Kiehls in the bathroom. I generally go for rooms on the street side as I've found that at the back you get a lot of noise from refuse collection at about 5am. The associated restaurants are 25 Degrees, a good place to meet and get classic American food. The main restaurant is expensive and not very good. It was good, but had changed to a gastro pub type restaurant on my last visit and was a disaster. This I hope was a one off as I intend to stay here again. Could be a great place if the service round the pool picked up and the restaurant sorted itself out.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Pdq29
Reviews.Content: From the restaurant 25 to our rooms, everything was a positive experience. The beds are comfortable, room service was fast and friendly. The staff are warm and helpful. Lots of action, especially around the pool. Location is superb. Many celebrities spotted here. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, terrible service at hotel bar”
Reviews.Author: jmarie1022
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel because I was planning a bachelorette party at the Spare Room bar within the hotel. (See below - I do NOT recommend the bar!) I didn't want to drive home afterwards and also wanted a space where I could hang out with people from the party after we were done at the bars. I booked the studio king suite and it was very nice. The photos on the website don't really do it justice but it was spacious. There was a room separator in the middle of the space and the living room area was very comfortable for 13 people to come back to in order to have some dessert and hang out. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was quite large as well with a separate shower and tub. Only complaint about the bathroom was that there were a number of black scuffs on the floor, presumably from people's shoes. It wasn't exactly dirty, but at a glance it looked that way. This didn't come as a surprise but worth noting - we did get some street noise but I live in a city and that didn't bother me. This hotel is in the heart of Hollywood. I could see Grauman's Chinese Theater from my room. More bothersome than the noise was that it was very bright - but that was easily remedied with the blackout shades. I did not hear any noise from the neighboring rooms. On the other hand, I had a TERRIBLE experience at the Spare Room bar. I will save the details for a separate review, but it's enough just to say that considering I was a guest of the hotel AND I had a made advance reservations for a table of 14 who were guaranteeing a certain amount of drinks to purchase, I would have expected better service. I would recommend the hotel for the room if you're going to explore Hollywood and want to stay somewhere in the middle of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Sad old hotel with patch up work”
Reviews.Author: AbbeyDav
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to my stay here but was sadly let down. When my private car drove in as soon as I was stepping out the porter was throwing my luggage on the trolley. The driver did make a comment about this & the porter just said'yeah' & ignored both of us. When I went to check in I was told my room was not ready even though my travel let the hotel know I was coming from a long 16hr flight. I was assured my room would be ready the lobby was busy also with a interstate tour group demanding their rooms. When I got to my room it was smelly, tired and the cleaniness was so bad that after I went to local store just a couple doors down so I could purchase some cleaning products so I could clean my room. Check out was worse than check in. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterwanabes
Reviews.Content: Yes, obviously paying for the "brand name" at this Iconic Hollywood Hotel. Hotel has been the link between the old and new Hollywood dating back to the 1920's. The hotel has undergone recent renovation within the last several years under Thompson Hotels. My first impression walking into the hotel from the bustling, touristy madness outside was pretentious. Greeted by hotel clerk on check-in had that superficial feel. Hotel inside has that Spanish-Moroccan decor with tiles/furniture and the grand chandelier.....very well decorated. So over all more Cons than Pros for this place. Pros: -in the heart of Hollywood, right across from Chinese and Kodak theatre. -Game room, where you can rent free games/bowel on 2 lanes with assortment of cocktails and beer, very cool. Cons: -Price: Paid premium price for a small room and tiny bathroom!! -No Free Wifi. -Breakfast vouchers: continental breakfast only.....we ended paying for our own breakfast. -Loud: Heard the echos of Teddy's the nightclub below at night along with various sounds coming through the walls at night. So overall I don't think we would ever stay here again. More for the younger crowd looking for the party scene but again way overpriced for what you pay.....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Simonea7
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the negative reviews on here we contacted the hotel in advance of our stay and requested a high room with a view. They came back to us really quickly and confirmed that we would have a suitable room. Our room was amazing overlooking the Hollywood sign and graumans theatre on one side and a view of LA from the other. Everyone was lovely and it was really nice when we checked in that they knew of our requests and had such great service. The price was also reasonable as we found a special on their one bedroom suites. The hotel itself is beautiful, we are used to staying in 5 star hotels and it was nice that the hotel had such a rich history and doesn't look like every other hotel. Bathroom was small but all was clean and the suite was a good size. Pool and bars all beautiful, thank you for such a lovely stay and we will be returning soon. Concierge was very helpful and informative, nothing was too hard for any of the staff and the 25degrees does the best hamburgers ever.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: lesleyLeominster
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to staying in this hotel as we were on a three way hotel stay over America and this turned out to be the worst hotel that we stayed in, the room was supposed to be on a high floor it was the third floor, superior well what a joke, the room was so dark and dismal, dirty carpet, painted floor tiles horrible grey, could do with a make over badly, we were overlooking the air conditioning ducts what a lovely view!! Air conditioning well sounded like the motor was going wrong terrible noise, downstairs not much better what a dark hotel, shame it is not painted in lighter colours would look alot smarter then, will definitely not be going back there, didn't find the staff that helpful either. Could also do with chucking out the pillows and buying some new ones or add extras in cupboard.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and genuinely cool without being "scene-y"”
Reviews.Author: Karla B
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights for a work trip. This place is an ideal location to explore Hollywood. You literally walk out of the lobby and onto the Walk of Fame. My room was bigger than other LA hotels I've stayed at and very comfortable. All the amenities you'd expect from a luxury place. The pool and library bar were both full of my kind of people. i'll stay here next time im in town for work.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and underdelivered”
Reviews.Author: Travis H
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel for a four day business trip and while the public facing areas are good, lobby, bar, valet, etc, the rooms in the older part of the property are "dingy" at best. I was on the 10th floor and the carpets were stained, the paint poorly applied and overall felt rundown. Hotel infrasturcutre such as wake-up calls, front desk, maid service, seemed scattered and disoriented. My room rate was $349 per day and clearly did not merit that amount of money. The Renaissance down the street is a better hotel. Will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Glamour!!!!”
Reviews.Author: famezzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 5 days on our honeymoon trip! When we arrived, they told us that our reservation was canceled (propably our agent mistake) but they gave us a room as they should. Εventually, with our booking evrything was ok. Because of our honeymoon they upgrade us free from a king supirior to a studio king! We had request a quiet room in high floors and they gave us a studio king in 9th floor. The room was really nice! Huge with a big living room area, a king sized bed, three big windows, a nice bathroom, and amenities of a luxury hotel. The only thing we didn't find in the room was slippers and we didn't ask for it. Their service is great. Everything we asked, we have it within 5-10 minutes. Yes it is a very busy hotel, but because we asked a quiet room, we had our privacy! We tryied 25 Degrees restaurant .Their cocktails and burgers are great. We also order a breakfast in room and it was fabulous. Three of the days we were there, there was a Massive 3D X-Men Projection(not a movie but a dvd promotion) on the wall of the hotel where our room was(they told us we were possible to change room if we wanted, but we didn't because the screening was in normal hours).The screening was impressive. The hotel itself is very glamorous! The historic lobby is really nice! We visited pool bar for a drink and it was very nice! It has a party feeling! Don't stay at campanas if you want quiet, ask for a quiet room as we did! Generally our staying was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed!”
Reviews.Author: hayleyvitoria
Reviews.Content: On arrival seemed nice, but dark! We were there celebrating the last stage of our 25th wedding anniversary holiday. Room booked was a superior king with city view. Room given was on the 3rd floor, with the view of the airconditioning ducts (perhaps bad luck) room was average size, quality of fitting and finishes was poor, considering the apparent renovations. Bathroom was very small with a grey painted floor. The carpet was stained, ripped and dirty. The overall look was I assumed to be retro-modern!! Just did not hit the mark. ~Very disappointed. The housekeeping was good, front desk were not over helpful, just did enough. Best part 25degree bar.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Roosevelt= Hollywood At Its Best!”
Reviews.Author: amyjemesouviens
Reviews.Content: Charm, elegance, glamour, history, magical, memorable, incomparable, exquisite, captivating, alluring, and enchanting are just SOME of the words that come to mind to BEGIN to describe this FINE hotel in Hollywood. There IS no other place to be if you are in Hollywood. It has EVERYTHING from the complete scene to serenity too in full comfort! Walking in, you feel transported to the years of Marilyn Monroe. You can FEEL her presence still there if you are open to that. The enormous lobby with the Hollywood lounge areas and little private spots everywhere were incredible to find! Just walking and walking around the place kept showing more discoveries. I know I did not even begin to see it all, but that means there is more for me when I go back. I will return. Even the reception area is beautiful. It smells so fresh and wonderful. Staff is super friendly and I like how they dress. The automatic doors to the pool area made us feel like the superstar that we all are. Oh, and don't even get me started on the pool area! What a magical place to be at night! Little white lights, happy fires dancing in the fire pits, pool lights in the exquisitely artistic pool, people enjoying drinks from the Tropicana bar and lively music, poolside rooms lit up with people in and out of them, I felt like this was the only place to be in Hollywood. But then again on another night the club inside (Teddy's) was that spot! 25 Degrees, the restaurant, had the BEST food! Let me recommend the tomato soup and grilled cheese! It is a giant sandwich! Oh, and the french fries! Large amount and they are seasoned with thyme. Amazing taste! Get a malt, too! So so so good!! The gym was perfect too! With plenty of cardio equipment and weights, it was a wonderful way to start the day. The stairs, the doors, the walls, the paintings, the furniture, all were exceptionally decorated, and we felt like we were on a movie set of old Hollywood. I cannot explain better the feeling of being in the Hollywood Roosevelt. What else? Well, in the room, the beds were like clouds in Hollywood. Heaven in Hollywood. So comfortable! So glamorous! So magical! I miss it already and I just got home yesterday.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and hip, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Outofdodge_10
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying I've never stayed overnight at the hotel, although they had renovations. But the clubs are fun if you can get in. I prefer the pool area for private parties. It's a little far east if you're staying there and plan to walk down The Sunset Strip. But if you have a car or don't mind a cab, it's a great place. But you may want to look at other reviews for room recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “The good ol' days are gone here!”
Reviews.Author: AlisaDan
Reviews.Content: The hotel felt very sad - darkness everywhere! The housekeeping in the hallways and public areas was very poor and unkempt. The bathroom was extremely small - although lovely toiletry products by C.O. Bigelow were offered. The staff never extended themselves in any outstanding manner, although not rude as reported elsewhere. The only highlight was the pool area and bar -just a fun atmosphere that was great for people watching in L.A. Maybe nice for a one or two night stay just to cover the "Hollywood" area without having to move the car around.

Reviews.Title: “best scene in LA”
Reviews.Author: mahleen
Reviews.Content: very nice to hangout especially by the pool. there's actually a nightlife by the pool. great location an fabulous amenities. very chic. it's the place to see and be seen. if you want to be in the center of everything in hollywood, this is the place

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: Pukekho
Reviews.Content: Great location as close to Beverly Hills and 3rd Ave. The Spare Room Bar is amazing. Two retro bowling alleys inside a very chic bar. Great cocktail list and cosy vibe. Slightly inattentive bowling concierge who spent all his time texting on his phone rather than paying attention to writing down scores (you pay $100 for an hour, so not cheap) BUT, it was still a fabulous evening. The first room I checked into was a shoe box, so I upgraded for $50 and got a room 3 times the size. Both rooms were very tired and furniture very worn BUT the bed was very comfortable. There was a plumbing malfunction one day, with no hot water so I washed in the bathroom basin with cold water. No apologies or allowances were made with the bill. Also check your bill thoroughly. I was initially charges $150 a night instead of the $50 advised. BEWARE, this is not a place to come and relax or hide away from the seething masses outside the door photographing the stars on the sidewalk. This is the local pick up joint. There are girls wandering around the hotel, inside and out in high heels and bikinis. They even check into the hotel in high heels and bikinis. The pool parties start at 11am and keep going with very loud music. So if you are looking to feel like you are in a gangsta video the pool area will be just the ticket. If you want to bring the kids for a swim, or come on a romantic weekend break, think again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gabriel m
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small. Bathroom is tiny! The staff is not friendly or helpful. We could not get any sleep b/c the hotel was so loud. For the money we paid, we got ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting update with a cool vibe”
Reviews.Author: LakesiderToronto
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt offers a hip update on an old Hollywood classic hotel and it draws a young crowd to it's pool and lobby bar. The original lobby has been converted to an informal lounge that becomes has an interesting house-party feel at night. The location, right across the road from the new Tussaud's Museum and Grauman's Chinese Theatre is great for spending a day or two in the heart of old Hollywood. Skip the hotel's coffee shop for breakfast and head over two blocks to the original location of Mel's Diner. The guest rooms and hallways are decorated with candid celebrity photos, many with descriptive notes from the photographers. Amenities in the bathrooms are definitely upscale with the Kiehl's brand on the shelves. The re-located front desk is situated a few steps down from the entrance so it's awkward if you're hauling heavy suitcases or if you require assistance with stairs. If you're looking for a quiet sanctuary this isn't the hotel for you but if you're good with an active, young vibe - the Roosevelt is right on target.

Reviews.Title: “Average room but great Hollywood location”
Reviews.Author: siienka
Reviews.Content: Best words to describe this hotel "Old Hollywood class". Beautiful lobby and original design. Rooms are too small, need upgrading & don't compliment the building. However for it's location, it's smack bang in the middle of Hollywood! And walking distance to IHOP! Loved the bathroom though! Liked the old Hollywood feel of it & also the Kiehls toiletries! Fab! If you're looking for a late bite & a drink, check out '25 Degrees' in the lobby. Great place to hang out when the rest of Hollywood is asleep. The pool looked lovely but didn't have enough time to enjoy it. It also wasn't quite warm enough. One night here is plenty. No nightlife in Hollywood. If visiting LA again, would probably stay in Santa Monica next time. Hollywood is enough as a day-trip.

Reviews.Title: “Piece of history”
Reviews.Author: belkaye
Reviews.Content: I really wanted this place to be more than what it was. It was so disappointing for the price. I know it is Hollywood, but the rooms were so small we could barely fit our suitcase next to the bed. The room was also very dark and the taps in the bathroom leaked and dripped all night. The nightclub guaranteed no sleep for the non-partiers. We cut our stay short.

Reviews.Title: “Great old time Hollywood hotel.”
Reviews.Author: oc_visitr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay here about 5 times a.year. we have tried other hotels in the area but for us when we want a Hollywood experience the Roosevelt is the place. The large main lobby is very relaxing and the evening pool parties are open to tenants, you never now who you will see here! Located mid point on Hollywood blvd most clubs / theaters are either a short walk or cab ride away .. the great service throughout keeps us coming back over.and over again. We also enjoy the malts and onion rings at 25 degrees. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “class”
Reviews.Author: moortoby
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt on a short trip to L.A. with some pals. Amazing welcome and service throughout our stay, loved the cabana/pool, room was a nice size, clean and functional. The Hotel has real character and style. I definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Cat00John
Reviews.Content: We visited the Roosevelt hotel on the 25th of August until the 30th, with my boyfriend, we've never travelled to LA before, but we enjoyed ourselves so much we can't wait to come back. After reading trip adviser and reading some of the bad reviews we were a bit worried about what to expect, but we absolutely loved it! As soon as you walk out of the hotel your on the hollywood walk of fame and everything that you need is within walking distance. Everyone was really helpful and polite and it made our stay the best. A lady at reception called Millie helped us when we arrived and also changed our check out time til later as we had a late flight. She gave us information on what to do and where to go and if we needed any help then they were there. Our room was lovely and clean, we couldn't say anything bad about our room except every time we had a shower it leaked all over the floor and it was constantly wet. The pool was clean with staff changing the sun beds and giving out clean towels. The service around the pool was slow but not too bad overall. When going out of Hollywood the service outside the hotel called taxi's for us, Sean helped us in particular and we even used the hotel car service which was lovely. It was driven by a man called Gary who we absolutely loved!! He pointed out places and things to do along our journey, chatted and laughed with us and we really enjoyed his company. We used him on the way back to the hotel too, he got there as quick as he could and took us safely, we couldn't fault him at all. We tried out the 25 degrees bar that people recommended. We enjoyed the waffles with strawberries and bananas in particular for breakfast which were amazing, and the burgers were lovely too. However we thought the prices were quite expensive as the portion sizes were quite small. We recommend that you visit universal studios as it was amazing to see where movies and TV shows were filmed, and definitely go on the studio tour it doesn't cost anything and its definitely worth going. Its one metro stop from Hollywood and a shuttle service for free takes you to the studio. You will need a lot of money to go out to America! But every second was totally worth it. You need about 1-2 weeks to get everything done. We didn't want to leave and we can't wait to come back, we would choose the Roosevelt again.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL I'VE EVER BEEN TO!!!”
Reviews.Author: TripChecker_14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the lowest in the class of luxury hotels, and especially lowest level of customer satisfaction. Here is a list of what you can expect from this hotel: 1. Dirty rooms with hair pieces from previous guests. 2. If you ask for extra towels, shampoo, conditioner, or ask to have your room cleaned., etc. expect that you will not receive the service for a minimum of 4 hours even after calling the front desk continuously. They do not care about their guests, I know this from personal experience and other guests who have stayed here before. 3. There are other guests who smoke weed in their rooms at this hotel, if you call the front desk to report about this, trust me they don't do anything about it. Don't think that just because you have a non-smoking room that you won't have to deal with the smoke from the room next to you. 4. Two managers to watch out for, Julius and Don [--]. If you have to deal with these two people, expect nothing out of it, and I mean not even an apology for any issues caused by the hotel. The only manager who is kind and very polite is named Kareem who comped our room for the inconvenience. 5. Beware, if you complain about your stay at this hotel, they will refuse service to you for future stays. As it is their right to do so. HOWEVER, If you complain numerous times about a situation they ignored to rectify, they will threaten to have you arrested for trespassing the next time you come to their hotel. If you ask them why, they will tell you they don't have to explain why. 6. I have personally called corporate Thompson Hotels to explain to them the situation that occurred. All they did was relay the message to the GM at Roosevelt whom did nothing but reiterate the same message I heard when I first complained about my stay. "Do not come to this hotel, go somewhere else" - Don [--]. Trust me, that is verbatim, not to mention he also raised his voice on me after I told him I would make sure not recommend this hotel to anyone and that I would write a review about my stay and experience with them. After saying this, Don [--] threatened to have my comments on review websites to be removed and to have a reply review about me personally!!! Can you believe how the hotel's general manager talks to a customer. Like I said, I have NEVER been to a hotel that treat their customers in such a manner. I personally don't write reviews about any hotels, good or bad. BUT this hotel and my experience with them needed to be posted. As you can see, I am beyond frustrated with the ways this hotel has treated me. I would hate for anyone else to go through the same issues that I have gone through. Save your money, this hotel is way over priced too. If you are in this area and want to experience your stay at a real luxury hotel, try the "W Hollywood" , "Renaissance Hollywood Hotel & Spa" or "The Rebury". I have personally stayed at all three and I can't explain how amazing their services and level of class has been. Hope this helps ;)

Reviews.Title: “Like Being Surrounded by Family”
Reviews.Author: Verity2118
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel for a mix of business and pleasure and could not have been more impressed with the nostalgia, luxury and service I received during my visit. Every member of the Roosevelt staff from the moment I checked in was friendly, accommodating and professional, creating a family like atmosphere in a lovely and historic setting. The Public Kitchen and Bar in the hotel served outrageous food with a creative flair (not to mention knowledgeable and friendly servers) and I would highly recommend it to anyone who is in the area. The beautiful rooms, the pool area, the whole experience made my trip that much more pleasurable and I am looking forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS !!!”
Reviews.Author: Queenniki
Reviews.Content: If only the walls of this hotel could talk the stories it would tell would be amazing for all the history behind this place makes it truly rare and beautiful. The staff were GREAT and made my stay here a truly exceptional one. The ambiance of the library bar beautiful. A special thanks to Sean & Jordan for all their help it was truly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Angie C
Reviews.Content: Friend & i stayed for 3 nights the rooms are not flashy but it doesnt matter... the hotel it self the history & the ppl that come to it made it a very nice place to be!!! So much is happening everynight you dont have to leave the hotel to have fun!!!! Paris Hilton was at one of the parties one night photographers everywhere it was very interesting :)

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel and good service”
Reviews.Author: P-D-Norway
Reviews.Content: A lot of "celebrities" have parties at this hotel, nice pool with pool parties in the weekends. Rooms ok, was upgraded for free! Very good service at Roosevelt hotel and I regret that I didn't stay there the whole time instead of traveling to loews santa Monica hotel who gave us a very poor service experience! Much better value than loews also.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt is Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: dice55
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Roosevelt is a true Hollywood experience. Right in the heart of Hollywood, pool is nice food is good. Lot's of action outside the Roosevelt. They also offer free internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and pokey”
Reviews.Author: jandlhixxy
Reviews.Content: stayed here oscar weekend hoping to see some of the glitz and glamour.big mistake.half of the reception area closed off and got constantly lost only to have burly sercurity men tell us we weren't allowed here or there.even when elevator doors opened on a floor they were filming on we were told off.spent most of the time by the pool where there was filming but the staff were great and so where the celebs there,even though we had no idea who they were.room was very small and my shins were badly bruise from constantly banging into the bed,fair enough the chap who showed us to our room did warn us.would help if staff knew a bit about the hotel and its history some didn't know the oscars had been held here in the past.this is hollywood and most guest stay here for that reason.we'd been told you get the best burgers in LA sorry they were not.had to wait to get a seat as did a few others to get an average burger,even staff said they weren't the best.the best are at island restaurants yummy now thats what i call a burger.also problems,big problems with extras charges that we didn't know about,should have read the small print.they asked for a credit card which we didn't have so had to use debit card.were told the money would come out for each day we were there and back in when we left as long as we didn't spend anthing.it took 10 days to go back into our account.not good. very average hotel and not worth anything like the price they charge.wont be back.

Reviews.Title: “not a great hotel, but not bad either”
Reviews.Author: VK_4_9
Reviews.Content: Positives: - Good location - right on the Boulevard and we were able to see the Hollywood sign from our room (Note LA is a big place, so it is hard to find a "central" hotel) - Friendly staff - Great gym - Great hotel restaurants/bar - we ate at two of the hotel restaurants and the food was very good. The warm hazelnut choc tart at Public Kitchen was AMAZING. Negatives: - Poor lighting in the room - I think this is apart of the hotel design, but i am not a fan of dark rooms. Because the room was dark, i felt like it was not clean - Clean bathroom, but tiny! Vanity only has a basin and no bench space! - Very loud air-conditioning system - had to turn it off when we were in the room which meant the nights were warm. - The fact that we had to pay for internet. I knew this was going to be the case but still not good. Note free internet is available from Starbucks, McDonalds and The Coffee Bean which are close by. - VERY slow elevators Overall - not a great hotel, but not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “"Could not have had a better time"”
Reviews.Author: Justin46543
Reviews.Content: Went out to LA from NJ for the sole purpose of having a great time, and we were not dissapointed. The hotel was in a perfect location, rooms were beautiful, service was excellent, and the overall trip experience was something to remember. The pool and parties that went along with it were a perfect way to spend an afternoon as well. I would also like to thank and recommend the service provided by employee Adolfo Lopez, without him and the rest of the front desk staff this trip would have been missing something.

Reviews.Title: “Love the staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Claudia M
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to go back! The hotel is beautiful and the staff is even better. Everyone was so helpful, friendly and warm, hard to find these days. The room was a little small but we had so much to do it didn't matter a whole lot. We ate at 25 Degrees, we ate way too much but it was totally worth it! The food was delicious! Overall a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Swank hotel with the feel of old Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Kostaki77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a prime location within walking distance of everything you need to see in Hollywood. The room was sufficient and had what we needed. The staff was friendly and their restaurant, 25 Degrees, was awesome. Being from Chicago, we're critical about our food because we have the best restaurants around. But the burgers at 25 degrees were phenomenal. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and bad lighting in bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Vbiles
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt was everything we were expecting in the ambiance and decor, the rooms ( we stayed in two doubles room) we smaller then we were expecting and we struggled with all of our luggage, the lighting in the bathroom was also not good with an orange light above the mirror which was hard to work with. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful with any request or recommendations that we asked for. I probably would not stay here again as it was very touristy, and you still need to take a taxi or car everywhere as public transport is not the best.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING CAN NOT WAIT TO GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: suzanne054
Reviews.Content: I stayed here of 10 nights at the end of July it is right in the centre of Hollywood, you walk out of the hotel onto the Hollywood walk of fame and the Kodak theatre is a 2 minute walk across the road. Hollywood blvd is busy from about 9am till midnight people were every were and also there will be a lot of tour guides trying to get you to go see celebrity homes which can get a bit annoying after a while but there is a lot to do from the wax museum to the museum of props used in movies it will keep you busy for a few days. Taxi’s were pretty cheap to get around in and there is a train station across the road (5 min walk) and its only $2. The hotel staff where brilliant from the bell boys to the check in staff. When we first checked in we were given a small room, for 10 nights it was too small so we went down stairs to reception and they gave me and my friend a bigger room straight away with no extra charge and had the bell boys move all are suitcases for us. The room was really nice (in the main tower) and the maid service was excellent, few stains on the carpet and the wardrobe smelt of feet but it is an old building (only complaint i have about the hotel). There is also a live TV channel that shows you Hollywood blvd . Rooms come with coffee making machine, fridge/mini bar and iron and ironing board which came in handy. When i was staying there is was $15 for 24hours of internet but if you just want to look at something for a few minutes there is free wifi at Mcdonalds which is 5 minutes up the road and i didn’t even buy anything to use it. I didn’t rent a car while i was in the USA but the parking prices were very high at the hotel, there is a multi storey car park next to the hotel i don’t know if that was any cheaper. I ordered room service while I was there food was nice, came quickly and the portions were very generous. I also ate at 25 degree’s the burgers were amazing and its open 24/7. The night life in the hotel is really good very busy at the weekends and few days in the week . The pool area is really nice, in the week I would get there before 11am or you won’t get a sun bed and at the weekend the locals go to the pool so you would have to be there by 9am to get a sun bed it gets full pretty quick also towels are provided. The staff by the pool where great, service was brilliant bit slower at the weekend but that was just because it was busier. The food around the pool was nice too and every think is brought to you and there is also free drinking water at the bar. Check out was quick and easy cannot wait to go back next year for another 10 days. Defiantly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another Hotel that could do better”
Reviews.Author: shound1030
Reviews.Content: Ok we all know Hollywood is a bit grotty We had a pool view room ,small but ok,the worn out old cowskin on the floor made for several trip overs. The hallways and walkways should be a lot cleaner. Repairs and maintenance man please...the toilet seat in the mens toilet of the main bar lounge has been broken since my last stay six mths ago....unacceptable. Also the Pool bar we were told was open until 2am...it closed at 12 the night we were there,ok if we wanted to sleep but it was our last night and we wanted a drink. Thomson hotels ,your video on hotel tv is slick,I suggest you take a closer look at the reality. Sorry to seem curmudgeonly but US HOTELS are slipping compared in australasia.

Reviews.Title: “Overhyped, in need of Facelift with poor service”
Reviews.Author: bonte1
Reviews.Content: Thompson Hotels is one of our favorite Hotel Groups and we had heard great things about the Roosevelt prior to our stay. It's location make it the place to stay for Hollywood Bowl events. At check in, the lobby was vibrant and lively as expected in a Thompson Hotel. It was all downhill after that. Going to our room we noticed soiled carpet throughout the hotel. Wall hangings and hall decorations were torn stained and broken; the look of an overused and overpartied hotel in need of a facelift. Our room was run down and dirty with banged up furniture and paint peeling on the bathroom floor. The dirty duvet on the bed was used to cover an even filthier comforter. It took 2+ hours and 3 phone calls for Housekeeping to bring a clean comforter. It was impossible to use the pool as it appears they let anyone off the street use the pool which makes it unavailable to people staying in the hotel. The bar scene at night was lively as expected but the $17 Martinis seemed over the top for a run down hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: vegascelebphotog
Reviews.Content: I felt ignored. Bad start. My room looked over a trash dumpster. I asked to move, and first person did not respond to my. She wanted more $ to move me to a non trash dumpster view room. I found someone to move me and he said wait in room, bell man will come get you to go to new room and exchange keys. Is at unpacked for 40 mins then just went down to the new room myself and found a staff person to let me in. Over an hour later my keys arrived after calling front desk 4 times. Then went to the tropicana bar restaurant by the pool....horrible service. Was ignored, then waitress actually forgot my order. My friends who joined me....she forgot about their drinks too. When foo finally arrived was cold and low quality. After all of this they denied to extend my checkout for an additional hour today. All of that overshadows the nice room, cleanliness and coolness of the hotel. Nice place, but next time I'll go back to the Mondrian where I typically stay.....great friendly staff, great customer service and rooms are just as nice if not better.

Reviews.Title: “An exciting novelty!”
Reviews.Author: -Chanelle-F
Reviews.Content: I stayed hear as a treat for my birthday while on holiday in the States. A friend and I really picked it because of the novelty factor - and it paid off, I saw Nicky Hilton within 10mins (apparently the valet is the place to celebrity spot). Was quite impressed by the hotel - our room had 2 double beds and was fairly big. The walk-in dressing area / wardrobe was awesome. The bathroom was strange..... very odd lighting made it feel dirty even though it looked clean. Overall though, the room was clean and tidy, with great beds, pillows, etc. Fell in love with the Khiels products they use in the bathroom. Definitely a place to be seen - even at odd hours in the burger bar. Good location on Hollywood Blvd, so easy sightseeing, but I really thought that the area was seedy. Would stay there again, but not for more than a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms in need of Renovation”
Reviews.Author: DCNJ11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fine location if you want to be a the center of tourist attractions. The Lounge/Bar area is lively. Unfortunately, the rooms are tired with worn carpet and small bathrooms. I would not choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Sister's Weekend - Love the Hollywood Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: AuntieMame1985
Reviews.Content: We love the Roosevelt! Actually this was our second visit and wow it has gotten busier over the years with all the TV hype. We did a long weekend trip to LA and could think of no better place to stay that was close to all the action and conveniently on a metro line for a little sightseeing. Its LA and like NYC you can enjoy the nightlife at the hotel, especially when you have room key that gets you into the places!

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant staff!”
Reviews.Author: jcd17
Reviews.Content: I was just using my cellphone near the elevator of my floor and a staff came up and asked what I was doing. He said that they saw me at the security camera and was bothered. What the hell was that? Can't you use your phone outside your room? In the first place, you need a key to use the elevator, so nobody could just get off on any floor. Duh! I will not stay there again! Ever! Great location though...But there are other hotels nearby so skip this one.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: tmaz122
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my cousin for her b-day weekend and were both were somewhat dissapointed with the the hotel, after what we've both heard from friends and after reading such great reviews. What's Bad: Small rooms, very old and not updated, slow elevators, no top sheet on the bed- the comforter gets washed as a sheet and ours was quite dirty upon arrival, however it was promptly changed by room service. If you're a light sleeper and like A/C you won't get to sleep easily as it goes on and off pretty loudly all night long. The shower has like half a door so the entire bathroom floor was a lake by the time you were done. Parking was $33/per day. 25 degrees burgers were just ok, felt like I could get just as good as a burger at five guys or In & Out. Internet was $15 to use in your room. What's Good: Location to tourist attractions,The pool had a great scene, good food, good drinks and very attentive staff. The valet always had our car ready for us when we called to let them know we would need it. The Gym, nice size and variety of machines and weights. Overall it was just OK, you can definitely get more bang for your buck elsewhere in LA.

Reviews.Title: “we will be back”
Reviews.Author: 2SPICY25
Reviews.Content: must better experience than my last.I will def be returning

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: DRsMama
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel right smack in the middle of the Hollywood tourism circle with high class amenities and old school Hollywood decor you have come to the right place. The rooms are ok, nothing special and the bathrooms are a little crammed but all in all it is a great spot to walk right out the doors and hit the most crowded part of Hollywood without driving all over the place. Everything is easy to get to from this hotel and restaurants are a stones throw away. Parking is convenient at $33 a day and their service is top notch. You feel like a celebrity entering the lot when it is off limits to the public during one of their high class parties. The 25 degree restaurant was awesome for happy hour and the library bar had unbelievable cocktails ($16 each) with the mixologist Matt at the helm...worth a taste! The hotel met our standards as we feel like we saw the heart of Hollywood from our room. The pool is also one of the more popular and it was fun spending a few hours in the sun lounging where the stars go to party!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely expensive for a VERY small room - great location though”
Reviews.Author: GenGens1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for two nights as a luxury interlude to our trip around the States and overall we were quite disappointed. The room was incredibly overpriced as it could barely fit a double bed. Although people have mentioned the noise, while this was evident it was to be expected for the hotel's brilliant location on the walk of fame. It's within metres of many attractions such as Graumann's chinese theatre, Madame Tussaud's, the Kodak theatre and a great view of the hollywood sign. We booked a taxi with the hotel to get to the airport but when the day came to leave it didn't turn up and it turned out they'd filled in the wrong time on the taxi booking! Really poor service. The hotel's burger restaurant is fantastic though with really great burgers and milkshakes at a not too ridiculous price. We were disappointed with LA in general as transport is near non-existent. Probably the best part of our trip was a prebooked star tour where we took a bus round celebrity houses, visited rodeo drive and toured a movie studio - definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “An Expensive Mistake”
Reviews.Author: Joanie_Balonie
Reviews.Content: The stay at this hotel was one of my birthday presents last year. I told my husband I wanted to stay in haunted hotels in Southern California. Supposedly the Roosevelt Hotel is one of the “most haunted hotels in Hollywood”. In our research, we read there was a mirror on display in the lobby---the one that used to hang in Marilyn Monroe’s room. When we asked the front desk where the mirror was, they rolled their eyes and said it was put away in storage. One good thing about this place is its location…you’re right in the middle of all of the touristy action of Hollywood. The Roosevelt was originally decorated in a Spanish Style but unfortunately it was remodeled in 2005 and looks as though they stripped most of the old grandeur one would expect to see. You can see in the hallways they carpeted over saltillo tiles. Our first suite was decorated in a modern style—it reminded me of a 1980’s bachelor pad. It had two bathrooms a living room with wooden ‘screen’ hanging from the ceiling separating it from the bedroom. The walls are paper-thin. The night we stayed there happened to be the same night of the premiere and parties for “Gulliver’s Travels”. The young folks in the room next to us were up ALL night talking, leaving the room—slamming the door, returning and continued talking. I understand the Hotel has no control of what their guests do in their rooms, but perhaps when they were remodeling, they could have installed thicker drywall. The next morning we told the front desk about our noisy neighbors, they gave us a blank look and begrudgingly gave us a new room. The second suite we were given was decorated in the same dismal fashion as the first one; but it had only one bathroom and quieter ‘neighbors’. We were happy to leave this expensive mistake and move on to our next haunted hotel; the Hotel Del Coronado—which is a FANTASTIC place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: Dhaka_Dweller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room through Expedia and stayed at the Roosevelt for 4 nights in July 2011. First of all, you can't beat the location. It is on Hollywood Blvd across from Madam Tussaud's/Grauman's Chinese Theater/Kodak Theater. The subway is a 2 minute walk (and then it was one stop to Universal), the Hollywood and Highland shopping area is two short blocks away and there is a public bus stop right in front of the hotel (for Santa Monica and Venice beaches, the Beverly Center/Grove shopping malls etc). There were two designer shoe warehouses (one on Hollywood, one down Orange Drive on Sunset) and I spent hours there. There is also a CVS right across the road. The elegant glazed tiles on the lobby floor and stairs spoke of another era and there are lovely indoor fountains. The rooms could use a bit of renovation (but the furniture and furnishings were definitely not tired) and the bathroom was very small, but everything was clean and comfortable and we loved the minimalist black/white/chrome look. The pool and Tropicana bar were amazing, if a bit crowded. This is a very 'happening' hotel and the common areas were noisy over the weekend. But we heard not a peep from our room. The front desk staff was very efficient and accommodating (especially Jeanie/Jenny?) and the concierge was very knowledgeable but housekeeping kept forgetting to leave toiletries/bathmat. However, calls to the front desk remedied the matter instantly. We also didn't get a turn-down service or chocolates, but it wasn’t worth complaining about. After check-out, though, there was a bit of miscommunication with the valet guys, and we had to wait almost 30 minutes for our Emirates chauffeur-drive car and it turned out that the car was waiting all along in the parking lot for us (and the chauffeur had informed the valet). All in all, a great trip. We will be back next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience at Hollywood Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotraveler42
Reviews.Content: I went back to the Hollywood Roosevelt and was really pleasantly surprised. The bellman remembered and welcomed me from my last visit - which was very nice. I have stayed here before and this visit was SO much better. The key is to not get a room by the pool. The rooms in the tower are so much better. The rooms are huge, and well appointed. Wonderful beds, great views and a beautiful living room area. What a huge difference from the rooms by the pool. I went to Second City Hollywood about 5 blocks away and there was a great show on Saturday night with has a surprise guest star every saturday. The ticket was only $10 and it was fantastic (Like SNL live but funnnier! One of the best Mexican restaurants in LA is also near by Loteria Grill - and the food is really great and reasonable. Have fun and enjoy the weather.

Reviews.Title: “Room was poor & noise was extensive”
Reviews.Author: astroprof33
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to say that our recent visit to the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel was mostly a disaster! We stayed the night of July 23, 2011. My wife and I went to LA to see Cirque du Soleil at the Kodak and had been looking forward to this overnight trip from Santa Barbara for some time. Upon entering your entrance, we noticed – for the first time – that parking was $33 per night. That is OK, we have paid more in other cities BUT I could NOT find your cost on your website. Actually, the same with the WiFi. Thought it would be free and it was not BUT the cost was NOT listed on your website. Felt cheated already!! The entire day, lunch, Cirque du Soleil, and dinner was great. However, the room was not!! We checked in a little after 3 PM as directed and told the desk that we didn't care where (what floor) but did request quiet. She made no mention of the items we requested via our e-mail reservation on YOUR form. We assumed they would be in the room. Upon entering the room we immediately noticed the condition of the carpet. It was all rippled and appeared very 'tired'. We put our overnight cases on the bench (which was badly stained) and found we did not have two chairs to sit in. There was one desk chair but no others. Therefore, unless you 'camp' on the bed, there was no place to relax in the room!! The AC fan was like standing close to a jet engine … VERY loud. We turned it off since it was very nice outside. We opened the windows and all was pleasant. There items we ordered via your reservation site were NOT in the room. As we prepared to go to Cirque du Soleil, I noticed the room safe was inoperable. Apparently, someone put in a code to lock it and left the door open. Therefore, we did not know the code to put the bolt in so we could use it. After getting back around 11:30 PM, we showered and went to bed. Your clubs were in full gear and the bass sound was thumping VERY loudly in the room. We closed the windows and still not only heard the bass to music but felt it also. We finally had to resort to that loud fan and AC thereby clogging up our breathing and still not drowning out the noise. Could we have called and complained? Sure. That would upset us further not to mention your staff and in our estimation should not be necessary if you are doing your job. You did not.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed”
Reviews.Author: SDtoLA0408
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night whie I was in LA and didn't love it. The rooms are very outdated, and though I love character, they could really make this place great with a nice renovation. Bathroom is TINY. Julius? at the Front Desk was awesome, but the rest of the service was below par. We walked out to valet and stood there for 10 minutes before any of the 5 attendants even looked at us. There were no cars around and they were not busy. The bars are fun and I would definitely go back to Spare Room or Tropicana next time I'm in Hollywood, but I just wouldn't stay at the hotel again. Its basically a Holiday Inn with brown walls and cool bars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: MareBear012
Reviews.Content: I was on vacation for my birthday and wanted to be where the action is in Hollywood- The Hotel Roosevelt was the best!!! Clean room, comfortable and right in the heart of Hollywood- The staff was excellent and helpful expecially Michael at the front desk- I mentioned tohim I was visiting there because of a special birthday- after I came back to my room from some sightseeing, I found he had sent me two tray of miniature cupcakes with a lovely note wishing me happy birthday. Talk about a class act... I will definetely return to the Hotel Roosevelt

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: robsaint
Reviews.Content: Great location right in the center of Hollywood BLVD where all the action is. Close to the subway which takes you to Universal Studio. Hard Rock Cafe near by. Room had plenty of space for the 4 of us bathroom was a little dated. Clean room adequate for what we wanted. We were given incorrect info from the staff about a day tour which soured the day, wasted 4 hours. Don't bother taking a full day tour, just do the 2 hour hollywood homes. Take the subway and bus to Santa monica and Venice beach, if you have small Children don't travel after 8pm as the type of people on the transport changes. Avoid the CD sellers on the blvd. The room was a bit expensive for what we got in comparison to other cities. WIFI is not free but there were 2 PCs you could use most of the time 1 did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Holywood.”
Reviews.Author: OakuraSue1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends in June, We chose this Hotel for location in Hollywood as it was close to Universal City and on a good shopping street. And the walk of fame. Right across from the Kodak Theatre as well. Nice rooms and very clean smallish bathrooms but not in there long anyway. Beds very comfortable and rooms nice and quiet as well. Neat pool bar area and a hang out for hip ish people which was entertaining. Staff were excellant helping us with our touristy needs and were very friendly I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel . We travelled for over a month and found the americans so nice and friendly where ever we went and the quality of the hotels and service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TheReliant1000
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a classic Hollywood style hotel recently renovated and the main lounge itself is worth a visit. The location is very good near a subway station you can use to quickly get to LAX, Universal Studios or anywhere in town. Even better, you just have to cross the street to visit the chinese teather before the mass of tourists get there what usually happens by 10:30am. Note that Hollywood High School (Marilyn Monroe attended it) is just a ten minutes walk. The staff is allright, concierce is a sharp guy, but the ladies at the front desk could be more helpful with little effort ... when I asked some information about extending my stay the only answer I got was a finger pointing to a telephone. Anyway, that's LA. No complains about the accomodation and I will probably be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Couldn't have asked for anything more!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carlislebj
Reviews.Content: Apologies for taking so long to write this review!!! Booked the hotel as part of Honeymoon at the end of a 3 week honeymoon trip in the US. After booking the room online, i sent an email to the GM (without my Wifes knowledge) to advise that this was our honeymoon and L.A was the last stop before heading back to Australia. After having stayed in some great Hotels in San Fran, NYC, Washington and Las Vegas we were pretty contempt with having a relaxing time in L.A (been there before a few times) Do some shopping, brows the streets around West Hollywood, Venice beach etc.. Anyways, so i sent the email (Don Jacinto) asking if there was a chance i could upgrade the room and or charges involved, perhaps some sort of arrival bottle etc (as i did for most hotels on the trip) When we arrived we were greeted with a massive smile and a big welcome. it was pretty packed at check in, but the friendly staff and porters made time fly. So when we gave our names, we were asked to hold on for a moment and the gentleman went out the back and he returned with another gentleman named Albert, who stated he would be showing us to our room. This was fantastic! When we got to the room, it had been upgraded and was right on Hollywood Bvld, and we could see right down H'wood Bvld to the Chinese theater etc and even could see the Hollywood sign! Albert advised us if we require any help, contact him or the front desk directly and they will do their best to help with whatever we needed. Albert also said, whatever we needed included bookings into Hard to get to restaurants, clubs, bars anything! Not longer than 30minutes later we had a knock on the door and there was a bottle of champers and a great little fruit platter!! We Dived into it and thought, THIS IS LIVING!! We had a GREAT stay at the Roosevelt! 25Degrees bar down stairs was great. Awesome Burgers and awesome staff!! Upon my return i sent Don an email saying what an amazing stay we had, and i even got a nice email back! It was fantastic from the initial email all the way through the stay and the final email back from Don thanking us for choosing the Roosevelt. Thankyou!

Reviews.Title: “Check out the Hollywood Roosevelt -- even if you don't check in”
Reviews.Author: JohnSierraCa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are Los Angeles natives and won a stay at this historic, renovated hotel in a club raffle. Boring? No way! We decided to pretend we were tourists, and we were. We ogled the Elvis, Johnny Depp ("Pirates"), Marilyn and Darth impersonators who, catty-corner from the hotel, stroll and pose near the handprints and autographs of real-life stars immortalized in cement outside Grauman's Chinese Theater, which is still the site of film premiers. The Hollywood Roosevelt is a star itself from the 1920s, having hosted the first Academy Awards in 1929. The Roosevelt's restored period elegance is obvious in a walk through the lobby, complete with gurgling fountain and interior balconies that overlook a polished tile floor. Maybe Valentino didn't tango here but the ghosts of Marilyn Monroe and her sometime costar and good friend, Montgomery Cliff, reputedly haunt the floors. Step outdoors to the pool and the style is glitzy 1950s Vegas cool. No Frank, Dino or Sammy, but martinis punctuated with olives seem as popular as margaritas. Today's cool is evident in the lines of twenty-something fashionistas that form early on weekends to enter the ground floor nightclub. Hungry? Just steps away, dig into the huge, juicy burgers at 25 Degrees, a coffee shop. Bring your appetite, and your wallet. The burgers start at $8 -- but they're messy, filling and worth it. Head to the main dining room off the lobby when you're ready for candlelight, wine and a gourmet quality meal -- we recommend the lamb. When we retired to our room, we appreciated the less-is-more silver and black furnishings, desktop bar and comfortable bed. The sheets were turned down for us, and, to my wife's delight, a pair of dark chocolate squares wrapped in foil beckoned on the end table. Whether you're a real tourist or a local, check out the Hollywood Roosevelt. But it's even more fun if you're checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun, lots of atmosphere, big LA 'scene' going on!”
Reviews.Author: LondonOaf
Reviews.Content: This is a bustling hotel, which is a fun and affordable place with a real LA 'scene' going on. Every night there was a party where the beautiful people turned up in drones, but the good thing is that I never got disturbed. Rooms are lovely and v.comfortable. They stock kiehls amenities which are luxurious and they are clever to put a night light in the bathroom as to not wake you at night, I liked that! The hotel had a rock n roll feel to it and a sense of history that is often missed in LA. Really great stay but not for young families. Prepare for posing by the (beautiful) pool. Only annoyance was lack of free wi fi.

Reviews.Title: “Cigar smell through room a/c was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Roshy10
Reviews.Content: Would have been 4 stars - impressive hotel, clean & modern rooms with nice LA inspired art decor. AWESOME burger joint - best US burgers to have while watching the game. But.. 1st night - toilet blocked - but that was fixed straight away.. and in early morning me & gf wake up to strong & disgusting cigar smell coming through a/c vents. surprised as we were told at check in that it is a non-smoking hotel. we both look down on smokers & were quite pissed off. Credit to hotel staff - got both issues fixed straight away - especially the maintenance guy who came in with deodorizer to get rid of cigar smell. next morning, got room changed & were happy with that. Still, got to do a better job with enforcing non-smoking policy of others in their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Noisy and Small”
Reviews.Author: London1506
Reviews.Content: We were shoved into some room at the corner > over-looking the sign which meant that our room space was cut dramatically. To make things worse, our room had been converted from one big room into two seperate ones. There was a door leading to the room next to us (which was locked) but we could hear absolutely EVERYTHING they were saying, and couldn't get to sleep until the early hours of the next day. Not to mention the wave of spring breakers who checked in on the last night shouting and drinking next door. The hotel needs some serious upgrades, rooms and hallways are incredibly dark (even by Hollister standards). It astounds me that in the 20th century anyone/ or indeed a supposedly high calibre hotel would use BAR SOAP, and indeed bar soap left over from before. They did not change the soap at all throughout our stay of over a week... hygeine standards = 0. Also, our sheets were not changed at all, even at the Marriott fresh sheets appear every 3 days! Water also has a strange chlorine smell. If you insist on staying here, do not stay in the corner rooms, which are right by the lift. Ask for a room change immediately or suffer the horrendous consequences! This doesn't deserve its 4 starts, I suspect the extra star comes from there amenities rather than actual room quality. It's fine if you're in a suite paying thousands of dollars. But in those average rooms, stay away! Only good thing I can say is that the location is superb, although there are other hotels in the area too (right across the street in fact). And from our hotel window we could see the hollywood sign and the Rio premiere

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay.”
Reviews.Author: kenverone
Reviews.Content: Wery nice location, rooms were nice enought. Looked a bit old though, with new paint just splashed on everything. Tiles, doors and so on. Annoying that you have to valet every single time you are going in and out, and sometimes getting the car back took up to 10minutes. But other than this it was cool enought.

Reviews.Title: “Cabana rooms are great”
Reviews.Author: ed_conwayCornvilleAZ
Reviews.Content: In for 4 days on business. Booked the newly renovated Cabana Room around the pool. Room was great. They opened a new Restaurant called Public recenlty and the food was very good. Breakfast each morning at 25 Degrees was excellent, good food and served very quickly. Room Service was also very efficient and delivered very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Hollywood experience”
Reviews.Author: AustralianBusTrav
Reviews.Content: For anyone coming to the USA to experience Hollywood, this is the place to stay. Make sure you book ahead and go the Beachers Madhouse which is an amazing show in the hotel. The hotel rooms are kept in good order, but are not what you would call 5 star. The reason to stay here is not the rooms though, you stay here for the experience. I would happily stay here again if I returned to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience and I will never stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: JauntingJK1
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were traveling to LA for business and I came across the Hollywood Roosevelt on Orbitz. They were running a special rate so I went on the Roosevelt's website to check out the amenities and rooms. They appeared very stylish, so I felt confident in booking a room. When we actually arrived at the hotel, The Roosevelt could not find our reservation even though we had already prepaid with Orbitz. It took a good hour to work everything out. The staff was friendly but it didn't help our frustration. They offered us a room "upgrade" and two free drink tickets and we were led to the newly updated cabana rooms that they had just finished for last week's Grammys at the Kodak Theater. The room was nice but it smelled like fresh paint and the windows had a covering on them not allowing us to see out. It made me feel too closed in. We requested to be moved immediately and they then led us to another room that faced the pool. After setting our luggage down and relaxing for a bit, we noticed we could hear the conversation of the people in the room next to us. It wasn't even like they were talking loudly, just having a normal conversation. It was very awkward. We had to call the front desk again and request to be moved. Again, they were extremely kind but it was such a hassle on our end. Not only were the people talking in the other room, but some random rowdy people were in the hallway. I felt extremely irritated at this point. The bellman came to the room a second time and he listened as we pointed out the conversations we could hear from the next room. We had a connecting room so he pointed out that might be the reason we could hear so well in the other room. He apologized several times and helped us move our things to yet another cabana room. Finally, this room had no problems and we settled in for the night. We found out the rooms they had moved us to were extremely expensive per night. I would never willingly pay that much money to stay there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: glen1985
Reviews.Content: Stayed st Hollywood Roosevelt 6th-9th June for 3 nights after spending 4 nights in Vegas. Checked in asked for pool view room and was told it was 200plus tax a night extra for that. No thanks, so checked into 4th floor main building first room out of elevator on left hand side room 410, nice enough room, just basic, comfy beds, tiny bathroom. You could do the toilet brush your teeth and shower all at the same time. View from room was probably the worst I have ever seen, just looking at a mountain of air duct vents nothing else, it's a good job we literally showered and slept in these rooms only, as we was out for the 3 days sightseeing. Defo go to universal well worth the money. Anyway hotel was good enough for our family. Didn't use the pool or loungers although they looked nice and cozy. We eat breakfast twice in 25 degrees bar attatched to hotel. Would recommend here especially the waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time, the staff made our trip”
Reviews.Author: Mikmo33
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel to us, and she was right!!! We could not have had a better time during our stay at the Roosevelt. The rooms, amenities, restaurants, bars, and pool scene were exactly what we were looking for. However, the one aspect of the Hotel Roosevelt that made the biggest and most lasting impression on us was the Staff. On many occasions during our short time at the hotel, the staff went out of there way to ensure we had the most enjoyable experience possible. One gentleman in particular was Albert Sousa, the ambassador of guest relations. I can't begin to describe how helpful Albert was, and the lasting impression he made on us. Although the hotel pool party was extremely crowded and bustling, he made us feel as if we were the only people at the pool. He continuously went out of his way to ensure that we had a memorable time in Los Angeles. The following day he personally aided us in extending our stay at The Roosevelt, and also offered advice on exciting attractions to visit near the hotel. If we return to LA anytime soon, we will be staying there again thanks to Albert. I also want to mention that the nightlife was wonderful within the hotel itself, and I highly recommend the grilled cheese. Lastly I'd like to thank our waitresses at the pool and Spare Room for making our experience that much better, Annie, Heather, Jessica Olsen, and Alice Fox. You gals are amazing!!!! Overall, I'd highly recommend staying here and would return in a heartbeat!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, small room”
Reviews.Author: HraPormestari
Reviews.Content: Room - One word: tiny. When in LA you don't expect getting a room, which would be small even in NY. In the standard room there's barely enough room for two suitcases to be open. Otherwise the room was quite nice, not too long ago renovated, and especially the bathroom was cozy - although the lighting was lousy. The best thing in our room was the view to Grauman's Chinese Theatre. We weren't distracted by Hollywood Blvd traffic, but the sound isolation between rooms was poor: in the morning our neighbor woke us up with her coughing. Also we were surprised that there was a coffee maker in the room - but the coffee wasn't included in the room price. Premises & service - The historical lobby and other premises are truly magnificent. The downside of an old hotel is that there's too few elevators and they are extremely slow. Not once did we get an elevator without waiting. The staff is very attentive although the service in a big hotel like Roosevelt can never be very individual. Restaurants - 25 Degrees is a must. Their burgers are enough to keep you running around LA for all day. Parking - $30 for valet parking, and there's no self-service parking. You get to the parking lot from N Orange Dr. Location - The best you can get from Hollywood. The subway station nearby is convenient, although subway in LA isn't that wide. Downtown can be reached easily by subway, though. Conclusion - Tries to cherish for its historical roots, but at least when staying in one of the standard rooms the experience is just mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely not worth the money- LOUD, small and unimaginative room.”
Reviews.Author: lisadg
Reviews.Content: I called ahead to request a quiet room as I had concerns prior to arriving. The manager assured me he would find me a room on a high quiet floor. When I checked in after hours of driving, I was given a room at the end of a hallwall wedged between a service door and a private function room with an ONGOING COCKTAIL PARTY. I could hear the party chatter and the constant slamming of the service door. When I called front desk I was told "we're at capacity, we can't help you please wait in the room and a manager will call you". After calling down to front desk several more times over the next 30 minutes, no one returned my call and I was told "we're very busy now". Finally I carried all my luggage downstairs and the manager on duty was helpful and found me another room. The room was standard with a tiny window. There was dust everywhere. The other hotels in the area were booked, so I decided to stay. The whole process took an hour and I was late for my dinner meeting.
