The manager was nice enough to give me a $100 food and beverage credit. Overnight I heard every word from next door neighbor and constant door slamming. I am a VERY FREQUENT traveler. This is the worst hotel I have stayed in over the past TEN YEARS.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel steeped in history, most of it hidden in the basement”
Reviews.Author: LouPovey
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here with my father on a Round the World Trip. This was the last hotel/location before heading back to the UK and we were both really excited to be staying in one of the most historically reknowned hotels in Hollywood. We arrived late on a Saturday night (busiest night of the week) and the male receptionist was more interested in the so called 'talent' than in helping late arrivals. We had booked a twin room for four nights. However when we arrived we were told that there were NO twin rooms available meaning my father and I would have to share a double bed for one night. The following nights they promised to move us. Tired and with no where to go, we had to go with this option. Then came the issue with the 'refundable' charge on the room in case of incidentals. In most, or all of our hotels on this two month trip, the charge was for approx £200 per hotel room, per stay. However, the receptionist stated we would be charged the full amount of the stay. Handing over our credit card (which was clear may i add!) they stated they could not charge the full amount as it had been rejected. Trying to explain to the receptionist that we would pay in full at the start of the trip with a £200 or there abouts charge on the card, was the hardest thing. He didnt quite understand what i meant and again was more interested in looking at the young girls walking through reception than getting us to a room. I mean if someone offers to pay in full at the start of a stay at a hotel, surely this would be ideal. At now, 12.30pm, extremely tired after a flight from New Zealand we were facing a night....in a doorway! Frustrated and annoyed the receptionst finally put this through but not without making me feel like i'd robbed the place. After a night sharing a room and bed with my dad, we made our way to reception to ask to be moved, only to be told to 'come back at 3pm'. Breaking our day trip short and returning at 3pm, we were given new keys to a room and told a concierge would transfer our luggage to the new room. After an hour wasted, watching the car park below (even though we were promised a view of Hollywood Strip and the Chinese Theatre, at this point id given up arguing and just wanted a room!), i went back to reception to ask where our bags were, only to discover they had lost them!!!!!! Seriously?!?! another hour wasted and our bags arrived after looking like they had been pulled through a hedge backwards. On our departure, we did try to explain our 'experience' to the new female receptionist only to be told they werent interested. I felt the most uncomfortable ive ever felt in this hotel, like they didnt want me staying there and that they couldnt be bothered to help. Might be steeped in history but the hotel is a big NO NO!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bleh”
Reviews.Author: EMILYRODNY
Reviews.Content: Rooms, were very small with a drawing of a moustache on Debbie Harry's face in my room made me angry. The Shower door was so dumb and trendy that my bathroom got soaked. Not to mention the terrible lighting in there. No Free coffee in the room ($4 a keurig!) and $30 to park per night. My friend and I felt like real tourist when hanging out at the pool and lobby which are Hollywood hot spots. Everyone hanging out there knows each other and are not like people in NY AT ALL! Also, Couldnt even get into the super boushy boushy (think I spelt that right) becuase it was so "super cool and exclusive". Although I love LA Weather, shopping and the ideas of Hollywood - Im a NY girl thru and thru. Its a great spot to stay if your doing the Hollywood tourist thin being across from the Chinsese theatre & on the walk of fame. You could stay at a better cheaper hotel right outside of We-Ho and just drive like everyone else in LA does an expirience real LA traffic and get the real feel of things. Which is exactly what Im going to do when I go back this year to see family and hit the Pacific coast h`way

Reviews.Title: “Timeless Hollywood Treasure at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: 2Eddies
Reviews.Content: After staying at this nostastalgic property for many years, it's so wonderful to see it lit up beautifully and buzzing with action when we arrived. After many years of remodeling, the property is still very charming - understated elegance. We arrived at 10:45 p.m. The valet was extremely busy, but very attentive. Easy check-in at the front desk. Our deluxe room on the 11th floor was a perfrect fit. It had a nice view and was off the beaten path from all the sounds of nightlife excitment. Our room was immaculate. Room service is available 24 hours - yeay! Had breakfast delivered to our room. It was delivered promptly, and they were willing and able to fulfill our special requests. Impressive. The pool is so refreshing, and you can't help but to think of how many celebrities have swam there from days past. We can't say enough about the staff! Every staff member we encountered went above and beyond to make sure that our every need was met. With so many choices to stay in LA - The Roosevelt has never dissapointed us, and of course we will be back. :)

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Fee's & Loud Music ruined this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mav0762
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel and was shocked when they said they needed a deposit of 112 dollars per night to hold until we checked out. This added up to 450 dollars total. Niether me or my girlfriend just had an extra 450 dollars laying around and we were not told about this when we booked. We were able to argue with the very rude girl at the front counter down to hold just 200 but it still took a huge chunk of our spending money. They kept assuring us that "it's just a hold and we'll get it back."......thats all good but in the meantime, we then had a limited budget for a entire vacation. They are used to catering to ONLY the wealthy, and pretty much stick their noses up at the middle class. After we settled that, I then asked where we needed to park because we had a rental car. They said it would cost 30 dollars PER NIGHT to park, even though we were paying guests. 4 nights, thats 120 bucks total just for parking. After losing 200 in the first hour we were there we were not about to lose another 120 right off the bat so we found a cheaper ramp that we needed to walk a few blocks to. After all of the stress from the hidden fee's we just wanted to go to sleep. Little did we know that the hotel lobby is constantly having private parties and events with bands and dj's blasting music. This went on every night we were there until 2 in the morning. The hotel is so old so you can hear the music very clearly from your room and it made it impossible to get a good nights sleep. After the price of the hotel and all of the fee's, a good nights sleep should have been guaranteed! The room was clean but it was no bigger than a walk in-closet. And I almost forgot to mention the bright spot lights that are aimed directly in the guests room windows. They need to make sure people see there hotel from the street even if that means annoying there paying customers with giant, bright spot lights shining through the window at night. I will never stay here again, and I recommend the anyone thinking of staying here go somewhere else. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Attentive!”
Reviews.Author: Kriepster
Reviews.Content: I have graced many fabulous hotels throughout the world so impeccable quality, particularly in terms of customer service, is something I'm accustomed to when I visit a hotel. The Roosevelt exceeded my expectations in every way, specifically because of their Guest Relations Ambassador, Albert Sousa! He was attentive to every need I had, although seemingly extremely engaged with other guests. I am by no means an important individual, but let me tell you I easily felt as though I was becuase of the thoughtfullness of his willingness to go above and beyond for me! His uniquely keen charm and wittiness outshined every other aspect of my stay! Yes, the rooms are superb, the pool is lively and the rest of the staff are accomodating as well, but the reason I will return to the Roosevelt is hands down because of the your Guest Relations Ambassador! Kudos to the Roosevelt on explicit and superior *CUSTOMER* relations!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely food, awful staff”
Reviews.Author: xxxbubblyblondexxx
Reviews.Content: Stayed her in April 2011 and couldn't have been more disappointed. The hotel itself is actually lovely, nice pool, restaurants and very clean. However, the rooms were unbelievably small. Although we booked a twin room they initally placed us in a double, meaning we would have to share a rather small double bed. After a lot of complaining with the manager they eventually agreed to move us to a twin room. It wasn't much better. There may have been two beds but they were so close it may aswell have been one. The room was bare with no character and if you want to watch any tv it all has to be paid for, even news channels etc The bathroom was like a closet with no room to move. The Library bar was extremely pricey at around $20 per drink where they create a cocktail to your taste, especially when you can go to the normal bar and have champagne cocktails for $12. The newly opened restaurant was actually the nicest thing about the hotel. A little pricey but the food is delicious so worth the price and the staff were really helpful. Which makes a change from the other staff in the hotel who were quite frankly rude and unhelpful. 25 degrees is also a nice cafe type place to eat in the hotel. It's very reasonably priced and the portions are enormous and the staff here were lovely. In fact all the waiters and waitresses were lovely in the hotel, it was the bar staff and general staff who were incredibly rude and it's a shame they are spoiling the reviews for the rest of the staff. The valet staff were much better and can call a taxi to arrive in seconds. However, every time we got a taxi from the hotel we were ripped off by the drivers, one took a very scenic route to universal studios making the price double than the journey home. On another occasion the driver dropped us off 2 miles from the restaurant we asked! Can't blame the hotel for that but the drivers obviously expect rich guests and take advantage. The hotel is in a great location, right on the walk of fame and next to the kodak theatre. As it's such a big place no hotel will be perfect for every place you want to visit, but this hotel is certainly pretty close. Overall I was quite disappointed with the hotel. Having travelled here straight from the Bellagio in Vegas it was quite a demotion. It seems to be living off it's famous past time and quite frankly has lost its appeal.

Reviews.Title: “HOLLYWOOD AT ITS BEST”
Reviews.Author: effieandyannis
Reviews.Content: If you want to explore Hollywood and wanna do it in style then the Roosevelt is the place to stay. A very historic - beautifully restored hotel, with overall comfortable rooms, great service and really good food, both at the tropicana bar by the swimming pool as well as at the 25 degrees dinner. The hotel is very glamorous and one might come across - the occasional celebrity having a drink or even swim at the hotel's pool. There is a downside to all the celebrities visiting the hotel - and that of course is that at times, they can be a loud....but hey this is Hollywood! Overall a great hotel, with beautiful rooms with minimalistic tendencies, great food (in very good prices), at the most central location of Hollywood you could have wished.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Rooms, Terrible Service, Terrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: ATLJetSetter
Reviews.Content: I'm not really sure how this Hotel got lumped in with the 4 stars in Hollywood but it is far from it. From the rooms, beds and service this is more like a 2 star property. It may have been 4 stars in it's hayday but now there are much better options out there. Our room was terrible - very small with one of the worst beds I have ever slept on in my life. The room was so small and oddly laid out that manuevering around was tough and you were lucky to open drawers without hitting another piece of furniture. On top of that; our "queen" room looked to be more of a double bed (we tried to verify but could not find a mattress tag). The bathroom had some stupid half door on the shower that did not seal properly at the bottom and got water all over the floor. The toilet was so close to the sink that when you sat down your face was hanging over the sink. When we asked the front desk (which is now down in a basement room as the lavish original lobby has been converted to a bar and restaurant... go figure) if we could switch hoping that maybe we just had a lemon they told us it would be $50 A NIGHT to switch to the same room! We ended up just leaving a night early of our prepaid stay and used hotel points somewhere else. Everyone we encountered except for the bartenders at Public were rude and could care less. The valets were just as bad - we were pressed for time to get to dinner one night so we called down 25 min before we left to make sure the car was ready. It was not and it took them an additional 10 minutes to pull it around once we got down there! This was a recurring theme with the valets throughout our stay - 4 of them standing around while you wait 20 minutes for your car. On top of the bad service it was $30 a day for parking! I will never stay here and again and would suggest you look elsewhere. The touristy location is about all this hotel has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “HRH: The "iconic" Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TalkingTravel
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel is essentially a landmark of Hollywood in its own right, however its renowned more so for its historical attributes than its standing as a comfortable, modernistic establishment. Much of what has been said about the Roosevelt is indeed true. It is dark, and does have a dreary vibe to it, however this adds to the character of the hotel. The modern and simplistic furnishings and decor (or minimalistic, as Thompson refers to it) not only complement the hotel's character, but adds to it. It's location is second to none, lying at the very heart of Hollywood Blvd, where all of the action lies. It's facilities, namely the pool area, mostly live up to the unprecedented standards and experienced by many, and further add to its appeal. The Roosevelt positions itself as a modern, vibrant establishment, however it is let down significantly by a few key points, most of which are exclusive to my particular case. I'd looked into many Hollywood accommodation options prior to making my reservation, and picked the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel based on the above aspects. My booking was via an external agent, and originally a superior king room was reserved for me, with a complimentary upgrade upon checkin. I was required to cancel this reservation and book again, but this time without the complimentary upgrade. I contacted the hotel directly in order to request a high floor, exactly as I had done with my original reservation, and was informed that a note was attached to my reservation requesting so, and that they had also added a note requesting the complimentary upgrade. On arrival, I was allocated a superior king room on the fifth floor, overlooking a rooftop. Although it was always understood that my requests were requests, and not guaranteed, it remained a considerable disappointment for me, however being so jet lagged and lethargic after such a long, sleepless night, I decided not to pursue it. Further, I decided to sleep with earplugs in, due to the erratic and disturbingly loud sound of the air conditioning system, and was able to sleep for a matter of hours until my neighbours arrived back to their room at 1:30am. I could literally hear every word of their conversation, as though they were conversing in my presence, regardless of the fact that I had earplugs in! They were not shouting, screaming, laughing or yelling; it was a conversation that I could hear as clear as day. This was yet another disappointment. The bathrooms, although uniquely decorated, are quite small, and would be to few people's taste. It is for these reasons that I will not choose to stay at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel again in future. Without its appeal and historical existence, in addition to the friendly staff, this establishment would have suffered the same fate as so many of its counterparts before it, and simply have been a forgotten memory. I didn't have too many expectations in regards to this hotel; it's just a shame that of the few I would have appreciated, I received very little in return. It is worth noting that I am currently undergoing my stay at the moment, writing this review concurrent with my one week stay.

Reviews.Title: “historic hotel with lots of history but lacking”
Reviews.Author: aussie255068
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel outside but we were not happy with our room . We booked a superior room which you could not swing a cat in . Rang front desk to enquire whether this was our right room and were told this was the superior room . Out of the three hotels we stayed in on our trip this was the smallest and the second dearest . Apart from this it it was central to all the great sights hollywood had to offer.Hotel lobby was good because it still had that old hollwood charm but room was just to retro gothic , sorry not what we expected . I will say staff here were very helpful .

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Traveler154990
Reviews.Content: Because of the wide spread lay out, it's impossible to be 'centrally located' in LA. This hotel puts you in the heart of Hollywood and a short distance to Universal City, Studio City and Beverly Hills/ Rodeo Drive. It's easy to scoot onto the 101 from this hotel... but once you're there it can take up to 1 1/2 hours in heavy traffic to get to the Pacific. Regardless, the Roosevelt offers very comfortable beds, pillows and comforters. The bathrooms are basic. We didn't have any shelving to put our toiletries; the towels are a good size and not scratchy; shower hot, but pressure weak. The sound of voices drifted up into our rooms (and into our sleep!) from Hollywood Blvd 7 floors below us and also from a room above or below at 3 or 4 am. The pool is lovely. The hotel itself is a must see if you're interested in history... or believe in ghosts! The parking is extra and is valet service only (enter around the back of hotel if you are driving). Between the extra 7% Occupancy Tax and Parking ($25?), this room will be at least $70 more than the stated rate. (this does not include the tourism fee and valet tipping). I would stay here again.. and even stay on the Blvd side where we had a view of Grauman Chinese Theatre, the walk of fame, the hollywood sign, etc. It was convenient to walk out to the sights and restaurants. Shopping should be done at The Grove, 3rd St Promenade in Santa Monica or down towards Newport Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Library Bar - the best bar in the world”
Reviews.Author: SoreLegs
Reviews.Content: I love this place - if not for the only reason being Matt & the Library Bar. Matt is the worlds best barman/mixologist. Matt has taken a dreary bar (the Library Bar) with low turnover and turned it into a must go destination on LA. I kid you not - stay here for the nightlife, the roomy rooms and the experience. A little over priced, but it is Hollywood & it is the Roosevelt - but given the current exchange rate for Australians going to the US - find room in your budget for this place. Room service is great space - the service is great - the concierge has given me some cracker recommendations that are not touristy - make sure you tip there. Final note is this place is known for its nightlife - particular Fri & Sat nights - the car park on a Saturday has some amazing pimped up vehicles. A Phantom Rolls in Matte black with 24 inch rims. Just is amazing what they do to a classically regal car - and Americanise it... only in LA... Final Final Note - make sure you go see Matt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: dizzymisslizzie
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent three nights at the Hollywood Roosevelt recently and had a great experience. Our room had two queen beds (extremely comfortable, btw), a large bathroom with separate shower and tub, and an amazing view of Hollywood Blvd, the Chinese Theater, and the Hollywood sign. The service we encountered was top notch -- the staff for the front desk, valet, housekeeping, and room service were all so nice and helpful. They really make you feel like VIP guests. The valets in particular really went above and beyond with great dining recommendations, fun small talk, and fast service. There were multiple events going on during our stay but the valets kept things running smoothly. As for food, we ate at 25 Degrees and had room service for breakfast. Both were great in terms of food quality, tastiness, and service. The only possible thing I could complain about is the price. But between the location (right in the center of the action) and the service, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Birthday to Me!”
Reviews.Author: kristifielding
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt from May 4 through May 8 for my birthday. After previously living in LA, I knew I wanted to stay at the Roosevelt because it is such a beautiful historic hotel...from the tiled floors, to the "secret" lounge The Spare Room, the Tropicana Bar...and the fact that it was in the middle of Hollywood was a plus. You can take the rail to downtown or easily get to West Hollywood via cab or car. The hotel was never noisy, even when there was a huge private event on the Saturday night of our stay... I couldn't hear anything from my room. I couldn't have asked for a better stay, everything was wonderful and if I should return to LA, I will be staying at the Roosevelt!

Reviews.Title: “Great location makes are for the 'standard' rooms”
Reviews.Author: SarahandIanHampshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hollywood for a couple of nights and didn't realise how central the hotel was until we got there. Right opposite the Chinese Theatre on the Walk of Fame. Very hip and trendy hotel and great for celebrity spotting. Rooms were ok - standard hotel room. Carpet seemed a bit grubby but comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch and very fun”
Reviews.Author: thatagirl2
Reviews.Content: My sixteen-year-old son and I stayed a week over spring break at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel. The hotel is gorgeous (old-Hollywood glamour), especially the pool lined with palm trees, and the staff was extremely friendly and gracious. The Hollywood Roosevelt is a "hot spot" of L.A. which was a lot of fun. The location of the hotel enabled us to easily explore Sunset Blvd., Melrose, Hollywood Blvd. , Griffin Park and the Arc Light Cinema. And after all our travels we appreciated the large comfortable and quiet room. The Hollywood Roosevelt goes on my short list of gorgeous, hip, and special hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Takes you back to old Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: JennLoves2Travel5
Reviews.Content: We had a FANTASTIC time at the Roosevelt. The staff were friendly and very helpful! The room was beautiful, you cant get a better location. 25 Degrees the 25 hour restaurant makes the best Hamburger Ive ever had! Great place to go to spot celebs.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, maybe too trendy?”
Reviews.Author: WanderingPair_com
Reviews.Content: The location is great; however we were in one of the low cost rooms, and we could tell. Be aware that you are paying for location and fame, not luxury. But if you are rich or famous I am sure you would have a very different experience, after all this is Hollywood. The lobby and public areas are grand, historic and beautiful. The staff is nice and efficient, even to us peons. If you want to feel like part of the Hollywood scene, this is a great place to be. The room left a lot to be desired considering we were expecting a high end hotel. There was hair on the bathroom floor. There was a window in the bathroom with no shade or way to cover it; and though there was not a building directly next door there were plenty of places from which someone could see in. The shower had no pressure and leaked onto the floor. The layout of the room was awkward and included a door with a keyed lock that we had no control over. Perhaps it led to an adjoining room but we had no way to lock it from our side and the was a half inch gap under the door so any noise would quickly carry, taking away any allusion of privacy. The paint job was crappy, the carpet had lots of burn marks, and everything was worn out. The room was basically just run down. For our more in-depth review just google: "wanderingpair Roosevelt Hotel"

Reviews.Title: “STILL MY FAVORITE HOTEL in LA (or Anywhere)...the Roosevelt continues to Evolve & Impress”
Reviews.Author: camerono
Reviews.Content: Here's why: It's the Gorgeous Property itself, it's the Diverse Venues the hotel offers (impressive individually...but unbeatable all in 1 location), it's the Exceptional Staff & Service, it's the People you meet there, and it's the Amazing & Fun Experiences I have every time I stay. And all of this continues to evolve & improve over time. After 10 years on the road, I'm convinced that you will not find a cooler, more fun, better managed, better staffed, more diverse, and ultimately better value hotel. I travel a lot (over 150 days per year) and am lucky to stay at high-end hotels everywhere I go. I'm extremely picky about the hotels I select and have very high expectations. I've stayed at all of the higher-end/trendy hotels in LA (both W Hotels, the SLS, the Four Seasons, the Fairmont, Chateau Marmont, the Viceroy, the Standard, the Beverly Hilton, etc, etc.)...the Roosevelt continues to be the best and the only place I ever want to stay. The property itself is gorgeous (a historic hotel with the elegance of old Hollywood....but beautifully upgraded with a modern/hip style). There are many different rooms and suites so you can always find something that fits the occasion. The location is also great...right in the middle of Hollywood but central to everything else you'd want to do in LA (except the beach which is about 30 mins away). The venues at the Roosevelt are all Sure Bets...you can't go wrong with any of them. There's the Tropicana lounge out by the pool (a fun time catching some sun during the day or after dark when it turns into a hip outdoor lounge under the stars), the Library Bar (a unique place for special drinks), the Lobby Lounge (beautiful area with painted ceilings and a fountain...nice plush couches for sitting with your date or friends/colleagues), Teddy's (intimate venue and one of the hot nightlife spots in Hollywood), 25 Degrees (a gourmet burger bar with the best burgers in LA...and open 24 hours a day). Public (a new high-end restaurant with excellent food) just opened. The Spare Room (exclusive modern-day gaming lounge & bar..includes 2 bowling lanes) and Beacher's Madhouse (amazingly fun & unique experience...unlike anything you've ever seen....you'll want to go back for more) also just opened. The staff is friendly and truly exceptional...they go above & beyond to provide outstanding service. They also do a great job balancing a professional/respectful approach while making you feel comfortable & welcome. The hotel has many celebrity, VIP, and demanding guests...and the team at the Roosevelt has a great knack for making/keeping their customers happy. Not that everything can be 100% perfect 100% of the time, but when it's not they care and quickly make it right. I've been extremely impressed by all the teams at the hotel including Reservations, In-Room Dinning, Housekeeping, Front Desk, Bell & Front Drive Staff. Ingrid (who runs the Front Office), and Mark (who runs the Bell Staff & Front Drive) are on top of their game and some of the best in the hospitality industry. The clientele at the Roosevelt is upscale...many fun & beautiful people. Lots of celebrity encounters (you never know who you're going to bump into there or who you'll end up having a drink with out by the pool). I've introduced and referred many people to the Roosevelt and all of them have become frequent guests. Its not easy being the best...but the Roosevelt continues to be and is the only place I want to stay in LA. Give it a shot if you haven't been...you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel and Best Service”
Reviews.Author: beqbeq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt in December 2010 and loved every minute of it. Cannot recommend it highly enough. The staff are exceptional (the best I have ever encountered) and the location is perfect particularly if you're there to see all that LA is famous for! I loved it so much that I am staying there again with 2 friends in October for Halloween this year. It was also a really exciting hotel to stay at because while we were there tv shows were having their wrap parties and across the road the theatre was hosting premieres. Tip: If you are travelling to LA definitely hire a car. You can see so much if you have a car :). Shopping in LA is also amazing - The Beverly Centre and The Grove are my personal favourites!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost didn't want to leave the hotel becasue it was so fun”
Reviews.Author: Romacn
Reviews.Content: Angelina Jolie strutted past us and we had to order another drink in order to keep our minds sane from her beauty. We headed to the pool which was like entering a Hollywood movie set. I brought my 64 year old mother and still felt cool surrounded by all the beautiful people. The rooms were wonderful, clean, and they felt like a get away from all that was happening down stairs. David Arquette has a night club on the lobby floor. I wont spoil the details, but let me tell you it is worth every penny, and he was so nice to us... good dancer too. Thank you Roosevelt!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dylmac
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is the hottest hotel going, the pool scene during the day was scorching and Beechers Madhouse at night lived up to it's name. The staff is amazing, the manager Jez made sure were comfortable at all times. If you want the true la experience, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lainee_L
Reviews.Content: I had read the previous reviews for this hotel before we booked it. Our choice was between this one and the Renaissance, a couple of blocks away. In comparison the reviews for the Roosevelt weren't great so I was pleasantly surprised at how good the hotel was when we actually got there. The renovated rooms/decor in the hotel made it look really stylish and iconic. It is perfectly situated on the Hollywood walk of fame with lots of shops, sights and restaurants nearby. A lot of the info about LA suggests public transport is not a good idea but we did public transport in LA and the hotel is very near to the subway line and there are plently of bus stops very close to the hotel which go to lots of main sights. The concierge were very helpful. The room was very reasonably sized. There is also free internet access in the hotel lobby. The only slight negatives about our stay were that the walls were sometimes a little thin and we could hear people on the other side (but they could probably hear us), and we'd asked for a feather-free room because of severe asthma allergies, which wasn't honoured.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here”
Reviews.Author: AKD_99
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped foot in this hotel we loved it. The staff (especially Maria on front desk) were great, and very friendly. Our room had a view of Hollywood Boulevard and had everything we needed for our city break. We could walk to the subway, hop onto the tourist bus and we had lots of restaurant choices close-by, so we didn't need to go too far after spending a whole day out sightseeing. There are two computers in the lobby to use for free - but there is a bit of a line-up to use them.

Reviews.Title: “If you're staying 1 night in Hollywood, this is the place”
Reviews.Author: soniabags
Reviews.Content: Great location for taking in the sights of Hollywood blvd. You can walk to many shops and restaurants and walk all of the walk of fame in one day. You will however, have to drive to Sunset Strip and you are miles away from Beverly Hills. My boyfriend and I stayed 2 nights and paid $260 for a Sun/Mon. Valet parking is $30. We stayed in a cabana balcony which has a poolside view. I liked the room, it almost felt like I was in a cabana because when you open the sliding door you can hear the vibrant music from the pool and tropicana bar. The only dissapointment was there was no coffee in my room. The bathroom was a little small with very little counterspace and dark lighting. The hotel is known for having a few ghosts. In our room one night, the radio turned on by itself, twice. Don't know if there was a loose wire or if it was a ghost playing with us. Had breakfast at 25 degrees, the food was good, we both had omelettes at $12.00 per meal. I was dissapointed in the service, the waiter looked like he needed sleep and a shower. He wasn't friendly nor did he come around to offer more refills. I recommend staying here, the hotel was clean, the staff was courteous and it's in a great location where all the action is.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: toinfinity
Reviews.Content: we had a short but enjoyable stay. great possition, great room, Love LA & Love the Roosevelt though not the cheapest hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: KylieandAaron
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hollywood Roosevelt and were sent to our room. It seems as though our travel agent mucked up our room as when we got there we had the tiniest room with views of a pool. But it was right in the corner and it was tiny and cold. The rooms were renovated but it felt like a shoebox. I phoned reception and was upgraded to a suite which is what we thought we had booked. She was very nice and understanding. We were upgraded free of charge and stayed there for 4 nights. The room was an older style but much much nicer in terms of space and views. We had views of the Hollywood Boulevard, the Holllywood sign and we had a nice big lounge room/dining room and a big bedroom. The bathroom was old but it did it's job. The valet staff were all very nice, service in general was great at the hotel. Would I stay there again. Absolutely although I would probably only stay in the suite as the room only was too small for me. We didn't bother getting room service as everything seemed overpriced. We were in themiddle of Hollywood anyway so went out instead..

Reviews.Title: “"Mr Hodges" the Roach”
Reviews.Author: BrickerHouston
Reviews.Content: Arriving to the hotel (valet is 28.00) everyone was extremely friendly the check-in was also easy and quick. My husband and I were very excited to see the room they put us in especially because the lobby is very nice. That excitement quickly ended opening our room’s door. The room badly needed to be refurbished, old carpet, base boards scratched, the bathroom was small and I found a pubic hair on the toilet. It was such a disappointment my husband and I decided to go downstairs to one of their restaurants just to leave the room and ask if we could be moved to another room. Again, the staff was very friendly and gave us a different room with an upgrade. This is where the fun started, we moved our stuff to the better/larger room with the better view. Same thing, the room needed to be refurbished and the bathroom was the same size as the smaller room. Entering the room we noticed the room had fruit in it welcoming a "Mr. Hodges" and we looked to our left and spotted a roach on the wall. We call down to the friendly staff and to send someone up to collect the fruit because who wants the fruit when you see a roach nearby. The person that picked up the fruit didn't get rid of the roach they were sending someone else up for that which took too long so my husband got rid of the roach himself. When the guy finally arrived he had a can of Raid with him, I'm glad my husband threw the roach out the window then have our room sprayed with Raid. I guess the small bathrooms are to be expected with such an old hotel but they can spend the money to update the room or just not charge as much. Oh, and if you get a drink at there pool (where all the hot chicks go hang out and I'm a women) the drinks are 20 dollars each. On the upside the location is touristy yes but something is always going on. While we were staying there Bravo had a big event where stars came too, Penelope Cruz received her star accompied by Johnny Depp and they were filming a scene for a movie on the street. You can't beat the location if you like being where everything happens. -Almost forgot it was the noisest hotel I've ever stayed at, ever ! If your a light sleeper this is not a hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “No Ammenities”
Reviews.Author: dogkatperson
Reviews.Content: I think the days of the "cushy" hotel are gone. I don't mean to pound on the Roosevelt in particular, but they seem to be following the trend of many hotels these days that offer not much and call it "cool" or "minimalistic" to save on creature comforts. The location is great and generally the hotel is beautiful but the rooms, not long ago converted to contemporary design, seem to be worse for wear at this point. Also, nothing about our room was particularly comfortable. Added to that, no extra towels, blankets, pillows, zero robes. It almost seemed like someone had robbed the place. Good location, great pool, pretty good staff. Not comfortable. Bad shower. Horrible bathroom with wobbly shelves & towel hooks. Fun if you're an excited tourist. Not if you're looking for a comfy getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1181
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is why I choose it, its great. Unfortunately that’s where my good points end. I paid more to be around the pool, huge mistake. The first room I was given had a very small window, which was completely frosted and you couldn’t see out of it. Once I opened it, I realized why, the room was directly on the side street next to the hotel. I went into the bathroom, the sink clogged and there were dead bugs on the floor. I went to the front desk and asked to be moved. They moved me to a room that was directly across from the back of the outside bar. Apparently something there was a large alcohol spill and the entire hallway was wet and there was a large dryer on the ground trying to dry up the mess. The entire hallway spelled like old beer. It was completely nauseating to stand in front of our door. I asked to be moved again and they told me that was the last room left in my category and I would have to pay for an upgrade. It was completely shocking to me that they would even let guests go into either room given the circumstances and you would think they would have put me into a different room without having to pay. I was only there one night so decided not to ruin the time I had by arguing with people who don’t know anything about customer service. Instead, I’ll try to let everyone know to not pay extra for a room by the pool and also that if you do happen to have an issue, you can either pay to make it go away or you’ll regret not staying somewhere else and wasting $287/night on a room. The room also had extremely poor lighting, to the point where you can't put makeup on or read anything. You're forced to go into the bathroom which felt like a prison cell, the entire thing is dirty concrete (showers, sink, etc). I stayed almost a year ago but while about to plan my upcoming trip to LA for this summer, I was reminded of this stay and where not to book a room this year.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAY”
Reviews.Author: sunless_n_seattle
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel. Tower Rooms newly updated, Bars are best on the Blvd, Recpt desk very helpful, valets fast, location perfect. AND great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelcath_11
Reviews.Content: Needed somewhere to stay within the Hollywood location. This hotel was perfectly placed for any tourist activities. Staff at Check in desk were great! Checked us in early as we had arrived from a 14 hour flight. Didn't hear any noise from the bar or street.

Reviews.Title: “HOLLYWOOD HERE WE COME”
Reviews.Author: aaamccorm
Reviews.Content: This is such a great hotel, you can breath, eat and sleep hollywood and glamour! Listening to the legends and stories about some of the most famous people i Hollywood makes you feel like a superstar. The service is very helpful and full of life and the location is perfect, sure its an old hotel, but wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Hotel Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberlybrown03
Reviews.Content: This was a first time trip for me and my sister in L.A. We went because it was Spring Break here and like to get out and try new things. Let me just start by saying there is NOTHING wrong with this hotel. I was very skeptical because of the reviews (and when I stay at 4plus stars I expect just that) well in comparison to the other hotels I have stayed at, this one was on the same great level! The customer service was amazing! As soon as we got their, we were greeted kindly, any questions we asked they were answered, literally anything we needed they were on top of it. At one point I had ordered room service and the gentleman told me it may take about 15 minuets because they were a little busy which I didn't have a problem with. He was there in 5 minuets with hot good food. I tipped him extra just for that, and he was so very nice! The location is perfect for touring, walking around. Its within walking of the metro station. And the Beverly Center is a quick cab ride, I mean this is a really great spot. The rooms are nice and comfortable, well lit (I saw a couple comments about how it is dark in the hotel??? I didn't have an issue), beds are comfortable, we had a view of the pool. The only thing that I agree with is that the bathrooms are small, but if you don't plan on spending your vacation in the restroom this isn't a big deal. There is too much to get out and see. The hotel history is awesome and the 25 Degrees restaurant has the best grilled cheese and tomato soup I have ever had. One of my favorite vacations. The last day we were there we even accidentally walked onto a film set trying to catch our shuttle and the hotel and directors were very apologetic. We actually found it comical. So overall this was an awesome experience. I would definitely stay here again, hands down!!! Oh and a little tip, we paid only $129 a night through the official Universal Studios website. Great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for Business and had FUN”
Reviews.Author: poohkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5-day work trip. My colleagues and I have never stayed here so we took a leap of faith when booking our trip to LA. I arrived on a Sunday evening and it took about 20 mins from the airport in a cab to get to the hotel. Upon arrival, I was upgraded to a junior suite. I was really impressed by the decor and how boutique the hotel was. I headed up to my room and was really pleased with the space - 2 closets, a king bed, couch/lounge area and a nice sized bathroom. The hotel location is great if you're looking for the Hollywood experience. it's central to the Chinese theater, Kodak theater and the walk of fame. You literally walk out your door and are in the middle of iconic Hollywood. The restaurants at the hotel are great. 25 degrees has good breakfast options and Public Kitchen was reasonably priced, amazing food. Highly recommended. Plus, you'll definitely see a celeb or two. The Pool bar was a hot spot and is surrounded by cabana hotel rooms. So if you're looking for a quiet night, do not get a room there. The Spare Room is the new bar that just opened on the 2nd floor. Feels very exclusive and has a 30's Speakeasy feel. 2 bowling alley lanes and lots of board games to play with while you enjoy amazing cocktails. Some of my coworkers did complain that their rooms were not ideal. They did try to get upgraded but even then, there were issues with room size. The hotel is a hot spot so be fair warned that there is a lot of activity that goes late into the night. The hotel staff was responsive to all of our requests and were responsive to any security issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Amazing History, Okay Hotel, Watch the Fine Print!”
Reviews.Author: sefutlaw
Reviews.Content: So as all reviews say, the key perks of this hotel are the convenience for tourist points of interest and the history. They have tried to make the rooms feel very chic and stylish, but the bathrooms are VERY small and it seemed a bit dingy to me. The main gripe I had was that they expected me to put down a $200 deposit for incidentals for a one-night stay! Mind you, these are incidentals that I hadn't charged! I wasn't planning to spend a penny on incidentals, and this information was not on ANY of my booking documents. This happened to me at the other hotel I stayed at in California as well, although I have never had it happen elsewhere. I for one resent being charged undisclosed fees for services I haven't used. Sorry if other guests stiff the hotel, but you have no reason to take that much money for a one night stay without clearly disclosing that in advance. I'd recommend this hotel to a friend for its convenience, but I would definitely point out the downsides and let them know there may be better options depending on what they want from a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, BUT lacks basic amenities”
Reviews.Author: valdigstad
Reviews.Content: Its a grand old hotel, great location for walking Hollywood Blvd. The main lobby is gorgeous. While the rooms have been redone in super contemporary the bathroom was ancient. The bathroom literally had 3 concrete walls (cracked and ugly) and cheap tile around a tiny tub, a tiny sink, no vanity space, no washcloths, no shampoo, actually the worst I've ever stayed in. For a $200 + a night hotel, plus $30 parking, plus the unfriendly check in, $10 charge for internet, and $3.50 for inroom coffee, would not recommend it. But do tour the lobby !

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in LA”
Reviews.Author: missmalabar
Reviews.Content: We have been staying there while on business trip in December 2010, and the only thing I need to say: if I have to go back to LA, I wont stay anywhere else ! It's just like in a dream: rooms, pool, bar, people... perfect !!! Of course... a little expensive... and some guests are a little bit arrogant .... but it's part of the game ! Have fun in LA and enjoy Hollywood Roosevelt

Reviews.Title: “Awful. Awful. Awful.”
Reviews.Author: Garoovygyrl
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've ever written a review like this but I've appreciated the warnings others have given me on this site so here it goes... My business colleague and I chose this place based on positive things we had heard and the great location. When we arrived, there was an odd odor (think kitty litter) in the check-in area and one of our rooms was not ready. When the rooms were finally ready, we were told we had to carry our luggage up a flight of stairs to our rooms. No elevator. No ramp. No one to help with the bags. What a first impression. When we got to our room, the front desk person said we were in the "upgraded rooms" by the pool. The rooms were clean but fit for someone who was there to party as the first view was large bottles of alcohol and condoms on the snack platter. Since we were there for business, we did not think this room was the best fit for us. We then left the room to have lunch by the pool. The staff was so aloof and unhelpful but we stuck it out anyway and remorsefully ate among the men ogling the topless women around the pool. This was around 1pm on a Weds. We left and went to a business meeting and returned 4 hours late to request a change of room since the music playing from the pool was so loud. The reservations person on the phone was very kind and helpful but the rooms we were put in were dark, stains on the carpet, red lights in the bathroom and you could hear the street noise as if the windows were open. It was far worse than the first room. So my colleague and I decided to leave the hotel altogether. The front desk felt a little bad that we were canceling our reservation but the parking guys insisted we pay $36 for the 45 minutes we had parked at the hotel the entire day. Shocked by the request, we handed them our credit card and said what a horrible way to treat unhappy guests at your hotel. Then the parking guys told us that their credit card machine was broken and we had to go get cash, pay the $36 and then we would get the car. We could not believe it! We refused and after a lot of back and forth, they finally let us go without paying the parking. We could not wait to get out of there!! We went to the Beverly Hills Hilton and felt like we were in heaven there after our time at the deplorable Roosevelt. On our way out, there was a couple in the elevator who told us they had changed rooms twice but were still unhappy. Oh we could relate!! This hotel is best for people who want to party and don't mind really bad customer service or carrying their luggage up a flight of stairs to their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the old Hollywood atmosphere...Don't agree with the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: odyssey_1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt for 5 days in early November 2010. We had preconceptions about the hotel because we had read so many reviews about the place being snobby and unwelcoming unless you were a Hollywood socialite....but we found it to be quite the opposite, and ended up really enjoying our stay. While I agree that it IS pricey, considering its age and the fact that the rooms are quite minimalist, I think it was still good value. We would have had to pay the same or more to stay at the London or the W. When else are you going to get to stay in a hotel where Marilyn Monroe lived, and where the first Oscars were held? Anyway, so, we had a hire car which we drove in from LAX, found the parking very easy when....you are best to come up Sunset Blvd and turn left onto N Orange Dr instead of going all the way up to Hollywood Blvd. The valet is at the back of the hotel and not ON Hollywood Blvd. The valet were the most attentive we experienced anywhere in the US, and I honestly can't imagine they could have treated us better if we had been celebrities. I believe the parking was $35 a day, and we took our car out once or twice a day so with tips it does become expensive, but I can't see how you would do without a car in LA. We saw more expensive parking in San Fransisco though, at $45 a day. Checkin staff were extremely gracious and friendly. Our bags arrived in our room very quickly too. The room was very simple. We had the most basic room with king bed. It had a well stocked mini-bar and good in-room entertainment. We had room service from the 25 Degrees bar one night very late and it was delicious.....you have to have their sweet potato fries with blue cheese sauce....so good! Thier signature burger was really good too.....just don't be shoked at a $100 bill for a couple of burgers and fries (including tip). It was a good burger OK? We went to the pool, had no problems at all. Nobody tried to stop us or tell us it was for invited guests only. The pool area was really nice, although we didn't end up swimming because it was too cool. I can't say that it isn't compltely manic at other times when they are hosting a party, but it was fine when we were there, no issues at all. The location of the hotel had its pros and cons. If you want to check out Hollywood Blvd and do the typical tourist stuff like take a tour of stars homes, check out the Chinese Theatre and Madame Tausads then you really couldn't get a much better location. Hollywood Highlands mall is just a few minutes walk too, which gives you one of the best views of the Hollywood Sign that we saw the whole time. I personally didn't LIKE Hollywood Blvd, it was just very tacky and touristy, and at night it was very seedy. There is nothing really ON Hollywood Blvd at night, but it is very central to all the clubs. I kind of wish this Hotel had been in another neighbrhood, then it would have been pretty much perfect for our needs. We found we were sick of that area within a day. The actual hotel is just beautiful to look at, and all the bars and restaurants were really stunning. Take the time to wander around and have a look at the ground floor and see all the history of the place. It really is stunning. All in all I would return here so long as I had a car and could get out of the Hollywood Blvd vicinity regularly. The room was very clean and I loved their body products in the bathroom. Don't expect any bargains at the Roosevelt, but so long as you know this ahead of time I think you will enjoy it. A little bit of history was a really nice treat!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure”
Reviews.Author: 69w
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite three nights. No complaints. Perfect location Quick check-in / check-out Helpful concierge Clean Firm bed Slept well Saw Gene Simmons (KISS), Shannon Tweed, Eva Langoria, Bai Ling and other celebs Love hotel's history. That's why you pay more. Recommend

Reviews.Title: “My new place to stay when in L.A. area”
Reviews.Author: backincarmel
Reviews.Content: What a cool place. Great location and I could feel the history. We enjoyed the pool area and the lobby. The folks that worked here were very nice, 2 of them really stood out. Heidi in reservations and I think her name is Baps at the pool restaurant. Both very sweet and accomadating. If you want to experience Hollywood this is the spot. I read one review faulting the location of the Hotel. Give me a break it is downtown Hollywood, what did you think when you booked this location. It is in the heart of the happenings across from the Kodak theater. I loved the old photorgraphs and the vibe of the whole place. To the G.M. , nice touch with the expensive soaps and shampoos.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Don5617
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of Hollywood, it reeks of movie stars of a bygone era. Rooms and elevators are from the 30s, so don't expect all the mod cons. Any minuses in this regard will be offset many times over when you stand in the main lobby or the pool area. Brilliant that its still available to plain old tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Seedy part of Town. Hotel Overrated.”
Reviews.Author: Foufikins
Reviews.Content: When I pay over $300 per night for a standard room I have certain expectations - the hotel met some but not others. Check-in went smoothly and the hotel staff kindly gave us an early check-in as we arrived at 9am. The highlight of the hotel is not the room though, but the outdoor pool area which is well maintained and has a convenient bar located next to it. The corridors are very dark and our room was spacious enough but the furniture is worn down and there is a $10 charge for WIFI. The bedsheets and duvets are very clean though and the beds comfortable. The hotel seemed to be out of shampoo toiletries which is odd as the hotel is in full capacity for the Oscars, and for $300 per night I look for small details to be perfected. For all the foreigners, I would not stay in the Hollywood area if you are travelling to LA. It is seedy and there isn't much to see here other than the Hollywood stars which are really not a big deal. Your better off somewhere nice close to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Always wanted to stay....”
Reviews.Author: Ularu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night just yesterday with my wife and 20 something children, location was great right on the best part of Hollywood Blvd. I loved the lobby and pool area and being a fan of Hollywoods history I found the hotel fascinating. But if you want to sleep forget it! Doors banging in the surrounding rooms constantly and the people in the room next door partying all night, and this was mid week! I can sleep through almost anything but it was like a war zone on the 6th floor. I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wait to check out”
Reviews.Author: MissyJay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dated, dark and seems to exist on spin alone. Dark and dirty corridors, tiny room and pay $4 to make coffee in your room (no fresh milk included in the $4.) Not a safe area for a lady on her own. Met two English ladies who went home 5 days early due to the seediness of the hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “LET ME BE STRAIGHT”
Reviews.Author: speeks06
Reviews.Content: - Close to everything (food, entertainment, shopping, public transport) - Free gym and pool - Have to pay daily for wifi ($10) - Dark Rooms - No street noise but Teddy's nightclub noise until early in the morning - Beware of overflowing toilets (happened to us the 2nd night) - 25 degrees is a restaurant/bar attached to the hotel. It has good food, service and atmosphere although check your bill as we were overcharged $24 for 2 apple juices)

Reviews.Title: “A shame its glory days are over”
Reviews.Author: Curious_traveller005
Reviews.Content: We arrived here very late at night following a delayed plane, whilst I recognise the hour the welcome and the service were not fitting for a hotel. We had to take our bags up ourselves even after being shattered after a long flight which I know is a small thing but it would have been much welcomed. The rooms themselves have a certain charm with regards to references to a by-gone area however a sensitive refurbishment is needed. I think the main thing with the hotel is the area did not feel safe and with people wandering in and out of the hotel to look at the history this did not make it seem safe. Also it was very noisy at night for sleeping. It is nice to have stayed in a hotel with such history but I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood!!!”
Reviews.Author: ALLIGATOR9
Reviews.Content: Back from a day at Universal Studios I shifted my hotel closer to the Walk of Fame. & I land at Roosevelt. Right across the Madame Tussads & Kodak theatre on Hollywood walk of Fame. Couldnt get better. The nightclub & Library Bar at the hotel kept me in high spirits until early morning with a restaurant for a late night meal. Rooms are small though stylishly done. That is what you expect from Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: LukeBris90
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in a Superior queen room. The room was as described on the hotel website and they were very comfortable and not too cramped. A couple of things were not working properly such as the door latch was broken to the bathroom and water pressure in the shower-over-bath was lousy as it came out both the bath and shower head and couldnt be adjusted. We had room service one night which was quite ordinary, very greasy and not worth the money. The female concierge was very helpful making travel and tour arrangements whereas the male concierge didn't seem interested in helping us. There were no noise disruptions during night although as some other reviewers have noted, it does get quite noisy around the pool and cabana rooms especially on Friday & Saturday nights. I was happy with this hotel as there are not many around in the central Hollywood Blvd area for this price and quality and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “two hotels in one - cool and historic”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: An iconic swimming pool, an historic lobby, a cool bar, sexy Thompson rooms... the Roosevelt Hotel thoroughly deserves its Pink rating in the neilsonparc Lust List. We stayed in one of the larger rooms in the tower, which was fabulous and great value. The pool-side rooms were smaller, but would have come into their own if the weather had been better.

Reviews.Title: “Still cool, but should schedule a slight nip tuck soon”
Reviews.Author: genevieve1976
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of the Thompson hotels. However, the Roosevelt could use a bit of freshening up to maintain it,s once held reputation as hotspot. Was upgraded to one of the Cabana rooms upon checking in (my last stay had not been a plesant once and i was offered this upgrade by the hotel manager). These rooms are rustic, manly, stark, very beautiful, much more so than the standard rooms in the main building. Great poolside location, however this means you will be smack dab in the middle of the party come night-time. So bring earplugs - or join the poolside party. The bed was comfortable, in room amenities first class (bathroom & minibar products) and wifi connection solid. The room is very noisy, you can hear everything that is happening poolside, as well as in your neighbors' room. 25 Degrees has great burgers but perhaps the Hotel could offer an additional breakfast spot, only for the resort guests. Complimentary coffee or continental breakfast would be a nice touch. The Roosevelt is not quite the hotspot is was a few years back, its prime Hollywood & Highland location attracting throngs of families wanting to stay right in the action. Hotel guests are given no special treatment in terms of entrance to clubs (you can partake in the most of the hotel's offerings even if you are not a guest) Beautiful lobby harkens back to the Hollywood hayday - giving an almost ghsotly spirit to the large space. Great pool, great gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: colinaManchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Saturday 20th to Monday 22nd November. The Hotel is a little tired and has a bit dingy looking lobby through lack of lighting. Check- in was quick, courteous and efficient, we were given a room on the 3rd floor even though we had asked for a high floor, we asked to change and was then given a room on the 6th overlooking Hollywood Boulevard. The bellboy who took our luggage to the room was very informative about the hotel and location, giving us tips on things to do. The room had 2 comfy beds with white bed linen and large fluffy bath towels but the furniture had seen better days. A major plus point for the Hotel is the pool and bar in a garden setting. It has numerous sunbeds with pool towel service and serves food in the bar. We didn't use the Restaurant but ate at 25 Degrees, which is at the front entrance to the Hotel, the beer was on special at $2 for a Budweiser. Next to reception there are 2 computers which you can use to print and check in online and view your emails with no charge. The location is perfect for sight seeing as we used Star-Line tours which is just across the street, as is the Hollywood & Highland Centre and the Graumans Chinese theatre and on the next block is the Hollywood Museum. Also across the street is a CV Pharmacy and down the stairs from here is a large Supermarket which also sells wines and spirits cheaper than the Pharmacy. The Hotel may have some shortfalls but the pool and location make up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - would definitely come again”
Reviews.Author: Lestreet
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night so it was a short stay but a great one. We flew in from Australia in the morning so got to the hotel well before the scheduled checkin time but hey found us a room straight away and gave us a late checkout because we we not flying out until late the following night. I'm sure the can't do the all the time but we really appreciated that this time they could. Service was great with the friendly staff easily answering all of our questions and the room was bright and clean. We would definitely love to stay again when we are next back in L.A. It would be great to spend some time by the beautiful pool and try out the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, pristine old hotel in the heart of Hollywood.”
Reviews.Author: married∈love
Reviews.Content: This is where the first Academy Awards ceremony was held and of course, many famous faces have stayed in probably every room. The common rooms are splendid to look at and if you want to see a building from a bygone era, in California, this is a very good example. Also, Grauman's Chinese Theater ,directly across the street, is a beautiful movie palace & one of the best I've seen thus far. Also, not to be missed is El Capitan Theater, on the same side of the street as The Roosevelt, about 1/2 a block away. The good: we paid for a standard room, in the lower price bracket (with 2 queen beds) & were rewarded with every thing I asked for in the notes section, when reserving & received a large room overlooking Hollywood Blvd. The bathrooms are circa 1927 however, so don't expect an spa tub or as many square feet as we are used to these days. The bathrooms have been redone and are nice, but not luxurious. The linens were nice also & the beds comfy. The check in staff was excellent & Mark, the head of the valet battalion was, well remarkable & was "on it" as far as I could see. We did have an instance where our keys were left if in our car, unlocked, which was alarming in a neighborhood where most anything can happen & most likely does. But, it was fine in the end. Just waiting for your car, at least when we were there is a genuine Hollywood who's who experience there, so time passed quickly. They even offered the managers safe for my valuables, after we checked out & put our luggage in storage. Room service was an unexpected surprise in that the food was good, the staff in the kitchen & deliverer's quite pleasant, plus the prices were reasonable. Amazing! The not so good: the carpet in our bed chamber in room 915 was in my opinion gross. It was rippled & felt crunchy under foot & this is the first 4 * & above I've sadly had to say that about. At $300.+ a night I expect to feel I am in a luxurious space & I didn't, when it came to the overall feel of our room. The hotel has undergone renovations & the rooms are meant to have a modern feel, which they do, but unfortunately (again) the furniture looks worn & nicked and in the case of the desk chair, really bad. Plus there was no place to sit for breakfast in our big room. That was a miss on the designers part for sure. One more thing, that is in no way controllable by the hotel staff is even on the 9th floor, the noise from people on the street on Hollywood Blvd. goes on into the wee hours. If you have kids or you sleep lightly you may consider something faces away from the street or a super high floor. All in all, we enjoyed ourselves while we attended the AFI Film Fest & seeing all the red carpets being layed down everyday at Grauman's Chinese Theater, from our rooms view, was wonderful. Everything I requested we received with a smile & you cannot ask for more than that from a hotel. My husband gave it a thumbs up & if the crunchy carpet issue is resolved, I will too. Enjoy as always!

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: stabiii
Reviews.Content: After visiting the hotel, I'm very surprised it has a 4 star rating as I've visited several 3 star hotels with much comfier and better looking rooms. The public areas look nice for sure, but the room we stayed in was not only small but looked worn and quite poorly kept. The AC/heating control seemed downright unsafe as turning it on and off would always cause a blue flash of electricity to flash from within the box. Also, there was little chance of getting any warm water from the taps in the evening. The best thing about the hotel, and the only reason I'd recommend it to anyone I know (only after making sure they didn't expect anything special) would be its central location in Hollywood. Close to the Hollywood/Highland metro station as well as several but stops and other attratctions within a walking distance, it is a great place to stay especially if you are relying on your own feet and public transport to get around. If not, I'd definitely suggest to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the Hollywood Blvd area. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: liss0502
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel for a couple of nights (transiting back home from Central America to Australia) in February 2010. Hotel stay was very enjoyable - helpful/friendly staff, bright/comfortable/quiet rooms, and good facilities (however, did feel that internet access was on the expensive side - at $10 per day). The hotel bar (entrance on Hollywood Blvd) is a great option for a cocktail or two. Got a great price on the room through Expedia (booked a few months in advance). Chinese and Kodak theatres are right on your doorstep, as well as the pick up point for the LA tourist bus. So for anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in the Hollywood Blvd district - the Hollywood Roosevelt is a fantastic option. NOTE: If returning to LA, I personally would not choose to stay in the Hollywood Blvd area again, as we felt the area lacked decent restaurant and bar options within walking distance (and I'm not talking about fancy/expensive places - I mean a lack of ANY options in general). However, this opinion does NOT reflect on our stay at the Hollywood Roosevelt - this was MY error in choosing an area that did not suit my needs and interests (and I now know for next time!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Carol39535
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms are small and room service was way too expensive. Would stay there again. Need to bring your own coffee maker. Very clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Centre for siteseeing”
Reviews.Author: beancounter69
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent. The staff friendly and helpful. Location perfect - across the road from the Chinese Theatre with all the stars foot and hand prints - just up the road from the Kodak Theatre. We attended the World Premier of The Secretariat on Hollywood Boulevard just down the road (well we stood outside and saw the stars). There is free internet access in reception, although you have to stand at a counter. The upstairs balcony restaurant (overlooking the pool) is to be rcommended with good food, wine and cheerful staff. Breakfast was served in the downstairs bar area, and was freshly cooked and reasonably priced. A large and spacious, dimly lit lounge, offered a good relaxing space in cool comfort, adjacent to two bars for refreshment. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to shopping and Greek Theater”
Reviews.Author: BestMum56
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded our expectations. We walked through the hotel front door into fabulous shopping on Hollywood Blvd. Throughout our brief stay we saw David Arquett and Jon Voight! The staff was courteous and accomodating. We asked for a room away from the noise of the pool...slept like babies. The room we had was generous in size...no problems sleeping, the beds were very comfortable. If anything...our breakfast from room service was a bit pricey 90$ for four adults but the food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Steeped in Hollywood History”
Reviews.Author: orlandoxx
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 4 nights at this hotel and upgraded to a garden cabana room. Check in was really quick and straight forward and location wise was excellent, right opposite the Chinese Theatre and Hollywood and Highland for shopping. The room we were allocated was fine with really funky, retro furniture and very dark. I have visited the hotel before so I knew how dark it was and mostly very in keeping with the type of hotel it is. However the room was a little too dark to even put on your make up. The grounds of the hotel were lovely, really steeped in old Hollywood history. The main reception area upstairs had so much character, it kind of gave a feeling that some old movie star had just left. Also on a night time it was a great area for people watching and having a cocktail. The only slight draw backs of this hotel was that it was $30 per day for valet parking which I would'nt mind but we had we wait at least 20 minutes every time for our car as there was always and event or party taking place. The only other thing which was annoying was the fact that when you went to bed you were woken up without fail through the night with loud music blaring from the rooms either side of you, it was clear that the people who book these rooms use them to party not to sleep, which is fine but it wears thin when it happens every night. Overall I really liked this hotel and all it's old school charm and glamour. Also all of the staff we came into contact with were very friendly and helpful, we also ate at 25 degrees twice and the food was great. Would I stay here again probably not as I like a good nights sleep but I did really enjoy my experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: TravellingZupas
Reviews.Content: Great location with all the attractions outside the front door but once inside it is a bit dark and old, they have tried to make it look modern but it doesn't work. The rooms are small and more like a cheap hotel. The pool area is great with a bar and cafe, stayed 2 nights and that was about it and probably would not go back. It's overpriced since Marllyn left.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very trendy”
Reviews.Author: sk8195
Reviews.Content: This is not your typical hotel. It is very trendy and most of the customers seemed to be in their 20's and 30's. During the time I was there one night the lobby was closed because David Arquette was having a party and the next night the pool was closed because of a wrap party for a movie. Many of the locals come to the pool on Thursday nights to hang out yet during the weekend the staff made sure that I was staying at the hotel before letting me enter the pool. The location is great, right across the street from the Grauman's Chinese Theater and the staff were very friendly especially Kelly the concierge. Valet parking was $30 a night and internet was $10 a day although there were computers that you could stand at in the lobby for free. The only negative was that the people in the room next to me on the Saturday night were extremely loud at around 2 in the morning and it sounded like they were in the room with me. I did complain and eventually the noise did die down. Overall I had a good time and would recommend this hotel to others although not for families.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of fun, right in the heart of Hollywood.”
Reviews.Author: buzzy-10
Reviews.Content: Very cool. Location is right in the heart of Hollywood. Older hotel but with a lot of history and flare. Only negativity was the parking. They have it at the hotel but it costs 30.00 a day to park here. Cheaper parking across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Versatile”
Reviews.Author: shepherdieu
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Roosevelt in the last 6 months. I was on the 7th floor, hardly any noise and not what I'd consider a 'party hotel'. If anything it was very peaceful. Great bed, good TV, great bathroom. Couldn't complain and the rate was great. Location wise I prefer the Sofitel Beverly Hills but the Roosevelt was great this time.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: al_kennedy
Reviews.Content: Normally when I stay in this area I stay at the Renaissance Hollywood but it was fully booked. There is nothing really wrong with the Roosevelt, but there is nothing really amazing about it either. I did the like that they have tried to keep the feel of a classic Hollywood hotel but that might put some other people off. The lobby at the front of the hotel is very dark and looks like a funeral parlor. Most public areas are also very dark but it works. Check-in was fast and friendly and everyone I spoke with at the hotel was very helpful. I had a corner room on the 2nd floor which had windows on two sides which was nice. The room was well appointed with TV, iron, hair dryer etc. The bed was comfortable but the pillows are way too soft for my liking. This hotel uses duvet covers instead of bedspreads which I prefer. TV reception was OK but not great. The room was facing Hollywood Blvd. and was quite quiet. Of course you have to expect some street noise but it wasn't bad. The bathroom was a good size but like the rest of the hotel was dark. The tile on the floor and the shower was black. I'm sure it was actually clean, but shiny black tile shows every little spot and it just didn't look clean. Same thing with the bathroom door. Black gloss paint that showed every smudge. When you are in the shower and the curtain is closed it is VERY dark. Best thing about the bathroom though was the towels which were the best I've had in any hotel ever. They were almost too thick. Internet access was easy although still more expensive that I would like at $10 a day. I found the hotel overall to be quite quiet and never heard noise from other rooms or from the hallway (mind you I was at the very end of the hall). There is lots to do and see in the area. The restaurant, 25 degrees is good and has one of the best burgers I've had in a very long time. On the north side of the street about a block west there is a supermarket and a large drug store for room supplied and snacks. During the day the area is as safe as anywhere else in LA but at night when the streets are less crowded you just need to be a little more aware of your surroundings. The hotel has valet parking which is expensive but cheaper than parking elsewhere. We didn't use valet the first day and parked in a lot just beside the hotel and it cost $20 for 2 hours. Their valet service is very fast and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pam96
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from an 8 day stay at the Roosevelt before spending 5 days at Disneyland. Our daughters are 20 and 23yrs old and pretty much Hollywood mad! We looked at several Hotels but decided we'd go with this one after reading several reviews on trip advisor. I guess the reputation is one of the reasons to choose the Roosevelt but, really, it has to be about the location. Everything is at your doorstep, Kodak, Chinese Theatres across the road. All the tours leave outside your front door and there are many attractions within walking distance. The Hotel seems to just have something about it. Rooms were very roomy, although you could tell it was old, it was beautifully maintained and spotless. Staff were friendly and helpful and we all enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: bensgirlSydney
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I chose to stay a couple of nights in LA and instead of staying in a chain hotel we choose the Roosevelt and are glad we did. It was a fantastic place, the staff went out of their way for us at all times and were all lovely. The rooms were funky and different to what we are used to in the big chains. We were in room 501 and had a great view of Hollywood Blvd and a red carpet premiere. On the walk of fame and near lots of interesting sights I don't think that you can beat the location.
