I would give the room service a miss though. We had breakfast once, tried some pasta and burgers and they were all terrible. Better to head out and eat. The pool area was great, but we had been warned by others that have stayed here that there are a lot of pool parties on the weekends. We stayed during the week so this did not effect us. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Majors0409
Reviews.Content: We booked the Roosevelt Hotel as I had visted before and had a drink by the pool and really wanted to stay there this time with my husband on our honeymoon. As we checked in saying we were looking forward to a chilled afternoon by the pool after a busy mornings sight seeing we were told we had just an hour as the whole pool area was going to be closed from mid afternnon until late for a private function! Our poolside cabana room became an expense which we couldn't use. We later spoke to the concierge who told us if we mentioned his name at the hotel across the street, the Rennaisance, we could use their pool, which we did. Unfortunatly we also had cause to change rooms as we were just near the pool bar and every minute or so the door was banged and people were up and down with deliveries shouting outside our room. We mover futher down the corridor which didn't have the outside/ veranda area but as we couldn't use the pool area it didn't matter. Check your bill on check out as they had charged us for two lots of parking when we only stayed one night and had just 1 car! This was rectified. Also take a note of your mileage when checking in- ours appeared to have gone up but we didn't write it down. A lesson learned! Next time I think we'll try the Rennaisance- gorgeous roof top pool.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't want to see, or sleep, book this party hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotraveler42
Reviews.Content: I have traveled extensively, and this hotel is OVER RATED. Upon check in I had 3 reservations, even after having called 4 times to fix the problem. Although They had confirmed the room, at checkin time, the 1st floor cabanna room I had reserved and confirmed - was unavailable.This hotel trying so hard to be swank and cool, but it fails miserably-(They need to take a note from the Rivera in Palm Springs who knows how to set a mood and set up a room) this hotel is ridiculous. THe hallways are so dark and depressing, it's design is just dark and cold. The room is not warm cozy inviting or beautiful. The floors are terribly scraped and scuffed. I was in room 224 -The Bathroom is one step above a public park design with cement walls and floors, no tile? It's so ugly and industrial and it looks dirty. Everything is painted chocolate brown. The brightest place in the room is over the mini bar area with a spotlight over the over priced snacks? There is literally not enough light in the room to get dressed or put on your make up. The platform bed is comfortable, But don't plan on sleeping. The pool is beautiful but they rented it our each night I weas there for a private party, Night 1 - a private party until 2 AM a with loud DJ playing and no access to the pool or any where around it. Day 2 the pool closed for a set up for another- private party where a deck was being constructed over the pool, so- no access to the pool or area which means you have to walk twice as far to get to your room, and once again loud pounding music until 2am. Night 3 - the pool not available in the morning as they were deconstructing the pool deck! The whole weekend I felt like I was an intruder at a party. Everywhere you go there is security and check lists. Priorities are about the poolside parties at night NOT the guests. Ordered soup and a grilled chese sandwich, the sandwich was rubbery and cold by the time I got to eat it. Why promote a hotel with a pool if your guests cannot use it? That is stupid. Build a party area somewhere else ont he property or don't promote the pool. 100 degrees and the pool is used for private parties, not for guests paying for overpriced amenities you CANNOT USE! Except for the valet and bell staff they were the most friendly and welcoing people on the team. Go somewhere else!A big dissapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice - Hotel or location?”
Reviews.Author: Matty
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this hotel. For the exorbitant price you would think you would get a reasonable quality room. I booked a king suite with roll away bed. Although the girl on front desk confirmed this on check in it was missing when we arrived at the room, as was the extra linen. The hotel is all about location, celebrity spotting and nostalgia. Just on the nostalgia...it would be more appropriate in my opinion to keep the rooms in the period of the day as the Fairmont Hotels do, rather than furbish the already dark rooms with what looks like dark brown IKEA furniture. That said, our room had a great view of Hollywood Boulevard and the movie premier that was happening across the road. The bar in the front of the hotel had $2 bottles of bud and other great specials that apparently are regular.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel , Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: sarahLouisej
Reviews.Content: Wow is what comes to mind when staying here !!! Classic , yet modern Hollywood all in one . So much history . The location is perfect it's right on Hollywood bv .

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive. Needs a lot of work. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: SamandPaul1
Reviews.Content: Very expensive. Very thin walls. Nice bed and bed linen. Very loud doors. No plug - enormous waste of water. Very dated and rooms badly maintained. V expensive to park $30 a night. Staff polite. Beautiful Swimming Pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of hype but......”
Reviews.Author: berlinnerin
Reviews.Content: The only reason I give this hotel a 3 is for it's common areas. The pool, the lobby, the atmosphere is spectacular. You really feel cool staying here. That being said we had to switch our room 3 times, the first our room's view was blocked by a billboard, the second we spent a night in this room but awoke to old pipe sounds at 7 am. The third room was a wheelchair accessible room so it was quite large. The rooms, though stylishly decorated are VERY worn and dirty. You could see finger prints on the dark wood everywhere. We had a large bathroom but that was because it was wheelchair accessible. In all three rooms you could hear every little noise from the rooms adjacent to and the halls, this was really bad considering I could sleep through anything and was often woken up to drunken neighbours at 5 am. Very cool place but everyone is right, the staff are RUDE and pretentious and share the same brain cells. While I loved the pool and lobby, I would just come in and visit like everyone from the street seemed to. I am glad I can say I stayed here but wouldn't recommend it to a friend. Try the W or the Marmont

Reviews.Title: “Amazing but definitely for the younger, party set!”
Reviews.Author: meliss777
Reviews.Content: I'm 24 and stayed here with my sister and two of our friends, and our intention in LA was to go out each night as well as see the sights during the day - and we wanted to stay at a trendy, classy place that suited us. The Roosevelt was all that and more. I don't know if you can get trendier than this in such a great location - I suppose the Standard would fit as well, but The Roosevelt is right across the road from Graumans Chinese Theatre and right on Hollywood Boulevard, therefore right on the Star Walk. There is great shopping around it, and its minutes away from most of the best clubs (by the way, definitely do SkyBar at the Mondrian, Chateau Marmont's Bar Marmont, and the Standard!!) Teddys, within the hotel itself, was probably our favourite anyway! The room we had was spacious enough and had a good bathroom - a small one, but we didnt find there was a lack of storage space - there were shelves above the toilet to store all your things, and we did our makeup etc in front of the full length mirror in the bedroom anyway. The beds were AMAZING - comfortable and the sheets were so luxurious! I got the feeling this hotel caters to people partying big at night and wanting a minimalist room that has great comfort and serenity - this is what we found. Our room faced Hollywood Boulevard but was quiet as anything. The only thing I would say is that our air conditioning unit was reasonably loud - but it was consistent noise so it didnt bother us. We found the service totally fine - staff were very friendly to us and we were let in to both the Tropicana Bar and Teddys. No rudeness or vagueness. A word of notice - Teddys is not actually affiliated with the Roosevelt apparently, so dont expect to get in because you are staying at the hotel. The crowd inside was very much Hollywood young hipster - so you need to dress up and try and look trendy to get in! I dont know if you get into Tropicana simply because you are a guest - we didnt mention it but got in anyway - the Thursday Night pool party was so fun! But I wouldnt bank on access just being a hotel guest is all - I would email them first to find out. I mention this only because prior to going, a lot of the negative reviews stated their outrage at not being allowed in to either Teddys/Tropicana even though they were guests - the thing with a lot of Hollywood hotels is their bars and clubs arent really there for the guests per se - they seemed more like stand-alone places that just happened to exist within a hotel.... I think the negative reviews are possibly because of expectations of the place. This is not really a family friendly hotel, nor is it really the place to stay if you are wanting to be waited on hand a foot (which is lovely!). I would recommend it for people who either want to party and just want to use their room as a place to sleep/get ready, but its fine for anyone happy to deal with the rare few late night partiers in the foyer (and by late, I mean 2am!) who would love a minimalist place right on Hollywood Boulevard!

Reviews.Title: “A fun vibe and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: OCPB
Reviews.Content: While recently vacationing with our teenagers, who have stayed at some of the nicest "resort type" hotels around, their Dad and I wanted to give them a different type of vacation experience and introduce them to more of a colorful and interesting boutique hotel for a better cultural experience. My husband and I had drinks at the Tropicana in the past and had often considered staying there as a couple but this was our first time as guests. I did check other trip advisor reviews but after calling in to find out about adjoining rooms I was hooked. Any initial concerns about whether the hotel would be "kid friendly" was quickly squashed by the excellent customer service and price I received for our two adjoining rooms. The rooms were small (the bathroom in particular) but we truly only spent our time there sleeping. The beds were comfy and probably my biggest complaint was the lack of lotions and amenities in the bathroom. However the wonderful coffeemaker, killer view and a great black and white of Ziggy Stardust over our bed made up for it! When you walk through this lovely structure, you feel like a part of old and new Hollywood. We had wonderful dining experiences at The Bridge (beautiful setting and excellent service even with our large group of nine) and at 25 Degrees (my new favorite burger......sorry Burger Bar!). The location is amazingly convenient and fun for all. We walked out of our room and right onto Hollywood Boulevard complete with excellent people watching, stars on the sidewalk and general vacation vibe. The service from check-in to dining to valet was absolutely excellent! We will be going back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, pretentious but great location”
Reviews.Author: SRod17
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend for a work trip, and while its in a great location and has nice amenities the staff needs to not be so pretentious! But then again, its Hollywood! Had a chance to relax (and party) at the pool, which was awesome and fun! Reminded me of Miami but in the middle of Hollywood! The food was decent, I didn't go to to Teddy's since the club isn't run by the hotel. But its right smack in the middle of Hollywood and it has a great pool! I would definitely stay there again. My only problem was the room walls are pretty thin and you can hear everything next door, thankfully my neighbors weren't too loud but I could hear their conversations. Also the bathroom was pretty tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Missy_Aussie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was "famous and was a piece of history". Centrally located on Hollywood Bvld. across the road from Manns Chinese Theatre & Madame Taussauds. Walking distance to the Metro/Trains. Very easy to get to Universal Studios just jump on the train & its 1 stop. The lobby is a nice relaxing dim lit area to chat and catch up. Seeking an American SIM card - Reception staff didn't know what a SIM card was and directed us to an AT&T that was "walking distance". It was at least half hr each way and then AT&T couldn't help us. Annoyed. Ate at the diner "25 degrees". It was AWFUL!! The burgers were disgusting. I took 1 bite of my overpriced burger and then left the rest. Even the fries were mediocre. The rooms were clean and roomy and surprisingly quiet. If you don't need anything form the staff, don't want to eat there & want something centrally located then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: DW2_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I couldn't have picked a more perfect location for our stay in Hollywood. The hotel is exactly as we imagined, beautiful and charming. There is so much to see and do right on the door step of this grand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Marilyns Mirror”
Reviews.Author: DawnB11
Reviews.Content: Old fashioned feel with modern amenities. Rich in ghost stories. Marilyn Monroe's full length mirror is part of a story. Ask concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest, specially for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: fb132
Reviews.Content: It was an okay stay, but I wouldn't reccomend it. The price is way too high and they charge you an arm and a leg on everything, heck you have to pay for wi-fii when ive been to some hotels in LA which offer it for free and they aren't even a 4 star. However, it is a beautiful hotel and the location is perfect if you want to see Hollywood. The swimming pool is nice too, beware if you are not comftorble with the way you look, going to the swimming pool can be scary seeing all these models like people.

Reviews.Title: “Great quirky hotel with Hollywood glamour but bad attitude...”
Reviews.Author: jessicasbrown
Reviews.Content: We opted to stay in this hotel due to it's location and it is very well situated, just across the road from Mans Chinese Theatre, on Hollywood Boulevard with the walk of fame just outside the doorstep. We didnt have a car so wanted to stay somewhere which was within walking distance of the main attractions and it certainly was. We could see the famous Hollywood sign from our bedroom window which was nice and we were about 45 mins drive away from other key attractions like Disneyland. The hotel itself is very trendy and quirky with history steeped in old Hollywood glamour (Marilyn Monroe famously was photographed lounging by the pool) but the hotel does have a reputation of being popular with the party people of Hollywood. Thankfully we didnt have a single disturbed nights sleep. The one thing I would complain about in this hotel was the service. We booked our room online through the internet and got a fab rate for a king suite. It seemed too good to be true and when we checked in it turned out it was as we were put in a standard double room. I called concierge only to be told that was what I had booked so that was what I would get. I disagreed so asked for the Manager and when he eventually showed up and I showed him my confirmation print out he had to agree that although the rate offered had been a mistake, they had to honour it and so we were moved rooms. The process to achieve this was long however and the staff seemed rather disinterested in anything related to work - they were chatting amoung themselves and less interested in the waiting guests. We also wanted to arrange transport to Disneyland so were advised to visit with the concierge. Again he was engaged with a colleague for some time before he realised we were waiting. Overall a pleasant hotel and I would definately stay in this chain again as they do have them in other American cities. The room itself was huge and the main areas, lobby etc were spacious and opulent., although the layout was a little confusing but maybe that was just me!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE AS YOU WILL NOT GET WHAT YOU PAID FOR. VERY POOR TREATMENT AND SERVICE AND RUDE STAFF.”
Reviews.Author: Nicole40M
Reviews.Content: Please read my review as i normally wouldn't do this but i feel that you need to know exactly what you are booking if you go ahead and decide to stay here. I booked a twin room with 2 beds for my teenage son and myself two months ahead. I booked here because of its location and the fact that it would be a great "Hollywood" experience for my 14yr old son for a night before going to Anaheim. I paid $320 AUD for a twin room. Upon checking in i was told i was getting a King Bed. I showed my booking confirmation that my travel agent gave me for a booking with twin beds. The receptionist Marie i think her name was, (part Aisan lady) insisted she never had a booking for twin bed despite the proof i had in my hand. The other receptionist (very long hair to her waist) although i had no dealings with her one on one, was very unfriendly to the point of rude to customers and treated everyone like they were second rate citizens. My son and i had the pleasure of observing her whilst trying to sort our issues out! My receptionist said they were fully booked and couldn't help me. I insisted it wasn't good enough and for the price i was paying and the two months notice they had of my booking, that i want what i had booked and paid for. She refused to put me in another room and said best she could do was to give me a rollaway. I stated that i had booked this accomodation given the location and the quality of the hotel and the fact it did offer two queen beds on the website. She then said well just because you booked twin bedding it doesn't mean you requested twin beds!! At this point i became very annoyed at her patronizing attitude and requested a manager to which she said she will go and talk to one. She then came back and said that there was nothing they could do for me as they were fully booked. We since found out there was Skateboarding competition on and there were a lot of single people that had booked accomodation so i suspect our booking was given away to two singles wanting 2beds. We were given a room and then were called an hour later after settling in, that the room they had given us was too small for a rollaway so we got moved to another room, even though i was told they were fully booked. We then called down to reception 4 times asking for the roll away and were told every time that is was on its way. I suspect the girl downstairs was being very unaccomodating on purpose. The rollaway finally arrived at 8.30pm 6 hrs after checking in. We had attempted to go to the pool during the day and went downstairs to find the place absolutely packed with no where to even sit down with a towel so we decided to flag it and go back to the room. The bathrooms were extremely small and you couldn't fit any more than one in the bathroom at a time. The shower leaked all over the floor and wet everything we had sitting down there. No shower caps, no extra pillows, no extra towels and only one dressing gown for a superior room with king bed. Tony the guy who bought our luggage up was very helpful. Overall it was a very bad and expensive mistake to book here and i certainly recommend that you do not make the same mistake. From someone who stays in many hotels, this hotel has only its name going for it. Since returning to Australia on Saturday i have confirmed through my travel agent and the wholesaler they used to book the accomodation that in fact the hotel did receive a booking for a twin room. But they gave it away because they reserve the right to give it away at any stage and provide you with whatever is available at the time. So be aware this happens with all hotel bookings and relies on the hotel to do the right thing and fulfill their obligations but they can in fact they don't have to. We then went on to spend 4 fantastic days at the Hyatt Regency at Anaheim who i cannot fault. Everything ran smoothly and they couldn't do enough for us. DO NOT BOOK ACCOMODATION AT THE HOLLYWOOD ROOSEVELT HOTEL AND TELL YOUR FRIENDS!!!

Reviews.Title: “overated”
Reviews.Author: 2SPICY25
Reviews.Content: I checked in the Roosevelt for my bday.I had been to a few pool parties at this location and loved the pool.Lindsey checked me in and was nice and friendly she even offered to up grade me to a cabana suite since it was my birthday.I declined becauce i had a king suite on the 12th floor which was much larger.Boy do i wish i took that offerus as im getting ready to change to go to the pool i find a XTRA LARGE CONDOM WRAPPER on top of the toilet papper in the bathroom.I contact the front desk and they tell me to stay put a manager will be up to my room.I wait 45 min and the manager is a no show.So i have to walk downstairs were im told by the young lady at the front desk they will buy me 2drinks ans honor a late checkout a manager never showed there face.After i had causethose drinks because i needed them i return to my room for a nap and the sheets on the bed have various stains 1 being blood the other is yellow in color and wait thats not it behind the flat screen tv was a bag with more condom rappers and a hotel slip with the guests from the night befores personal information on it.Once again a manager never showed there face and i was told i already received 2 drinks for the problem and there was nothing more they can do.Overall the loction is great and the price point is good but unless u want to get some sort of rash from the unclean sheets and towels i do not recommend this hotel.The staff is not friendly and they do not care if u are unhappy about anything i ordered room service and my steak was over cooked and i was told that it was alread y made so there was nothing he could do.I think if u are a hollywood vip then u will be okay but this hotel doesnt cater to reguler folks.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hollywood hotel in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: JoeinTO
Reviews.Content: Right across from Gruman's Chinese Theater and the Kodak Theater. Very busy area during the day. The hotel is historic and pretty and the rooms are very modern and funky. The staff were very friendly and the service was excellent. The hotel does get busy and somewhat noisy later in the evening when the young crowd comes by for drinks.

Reviews.Title: “great location for hollywood...!”
Reviews.Author: jollyjoArran
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, it was a great location for the hollywood walk of fame and shopping etc... the bar in the hotel is top... lots of famous ppl to see!! altho the rooms were a little dirty!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in a great location - can be noisy on an evening.”
Reviews.Author: zeeberino
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here with the girlfriend, the start of a 3 week West Cost USA tour. We picked this hotel for its location – right on Hollywood Blvd opposite Grauman’s Chinese Theatre, and its reputation as being quite a “cool” place to stay. Finding the proper entrance is difficult as it’s not signposted. We entered through a side door (even though it was on the main road). Very dark inside, but that’s the look they go for. Check in was fine, very helpful and friendly lady at the front desk. Our room was a corner room on a high floor. Tastefully decorated, retro print of the Rolling Stones/Bowie on the wall behind the bed, comfy bed, nice clean bathroom. The room itself was not huge, but we had only booked the basic room I think. Still, it was adequate for our needs. Very impressive mini-bar (although not cheap) with all sorts of things including a “seduction kit” (use your imagination…). The pool looked nice however seemed more of a nightclub through the day – i.e. packed with the 20 something LA “it” crowd drinking and dancing to loud music, meaning there was no chance of a nice relaxed afternoon by the pool. However they were all friendly and accommodating when you encounter them in the lift. Got quite noisy a couple of nights with partying (well, more of a small gathering of people talking and having a few drinks with a bit of background music, nevertheless kept us awake) in the room next to us until 3am on a Monday night – although unlike British partying it seemed relatively chilled out and sensible, and they kept quiet once warned by security. The area around the hotel is packed with tourists looking at the walk of fame and the hand prints outside the Chinese theatre. Lots of people trying to sell you stuff, give you “free” tickets to shows, beggars, people asking for charity donations etc. Can get annoying but that’s LA and it is a tourist area. The hop on hop off bus tours start just over the road which is very handy. Plenty of places to eat and drink nearby (check out Mel’s Drive In round the corner), and generally a great place to experience LA at its finest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wahoowa91
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for a weekend and enjoyed how conveniently located the hotel was to shops, clubs, tourist sights and restaurants. It is right across the street from the Kodak Theater and Chinese Theater. Also, you could see the "Hollywood" sign from our room. The room was spacious and had two queen size beds. There was plenty of room for the 4 of us to move around and spread our things out. The staff was friendly and helpful. The beds were extremely comfortable. I did think the room was on the pricey side, but it was worth it for the special occasion we were celebrating.

Reviews.Title: “A step into hollywood history...”
Reviews.Author: Tinarussell
Reviews.Content: My stay in this hotel was very enjoyable. It's location is priceless and it's place in hollywood history is very special. These are the key appeals. There are of course then the facilities. I was actually disappointed when the hotel was featured in a tv series as I would hate for it to become overrun and even more commercial. I recommend it and very much look forward to being able to stay there again. Tina Russell

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but sometimes treated like second class....”
Reviews.Author: MOSullivan120
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel for six nights in July 2010. We used priceline and got the room for $150 a night. Doesn't seem bad, but then add tax, $30/night for parking and $10/day for internet. It came out to $220/night when all was said and done. PRO: Reasonable price for a great location! We arrived to check into the hotel at approximately 3:00PM. We were told that none of the rooms were vacant and a manager would go around to make people check out. The clerk at the desk was extremely friendly and gave us 2 drink vouchers to enjoy a drink at the Tropicana Bar and told us someone would call us when our room was ready. Nobody ever called. We checked back close to 6:00 and were given the keys to our room. Once we entered the room, I noticed a bug on the bed, but didn't think twice about it. We left and went exploring over at Hollywood and Highland which was right across the street. PRO: The friendliest front desk staff BIG CON: The bug situation: we were initially not concerned, but when we kept finding the same type of bug we became alarmed. We caught one of the bugs in a glass so we could show hotel staff. We called the front desk and they said they would send someone up. A handy man came, and looked around for more bugs. He then called the supervisor of housekeeping who was very friendly. She stated that they had never had bed bugs before, and she wondered where these bugs were coming from. They offered to change our room, but not after trying to tell us that we brought the bugs with us, or it was our fault because maybe we "left the window open, or had food around". Neither of which were the case. Regardless, they said a bellman would be sent up in 5 minutes to help us switch rooms. If you are told a bellman is coming, you assume someone is going to bring a cart to help you with your many bags. Not the case. A man arrived about 20 minutes later with keys to the new room. He looked at our stuff and said "Oh.... you need help with your bags?" He carried 2 suitcases that he left in the room, but we were left lugging 3 heavy duffles and another suitcase down to our new room. The staff never apologized, or offered us anything for the inconvenience of a) wasting an entire day to "investigate" the bug situation and b) having to switch rooms mid-stay. Our first room was much nicer than the second room in regards to furniture and amenities. It had an iHome iPod dock radio, and a dresser, which the second room did not. CON: The first room almost the entire time smelled like marijuana. We never figured out where this was coming from, but the smell was strong enough as if someone was in our room smoking. CON: Both rooms had extremely loud air conditioners. I had to wear ear plugs to sleep, and could still hear it. CON: Security in the hotel was non-existent. You needed to enter your room key in the elevator in order to get to the guest room floors. Anyone could follow you in the elevator though, which we learned the hard way. We arrived back to the hotel relatively late one night (at approximately 2:00AM) and a man followed us into the elevator. He asked us if we wanted to smoke weed with him and have a threesome. It was scary! Being two young girls from NYC, nothing scares us, but this did. He was a creepy predator! CON: The valet was very expensive, and you weren't taken seriously unless you were driving a Beamer, Benz, or Bentley. It was almost as if we were second class citizens because we were driving a rental car. I did, although, tip the valet men EVERY TIME we exited or entered the hotel. PRO: The pool at the hotel is nice, and the bar at the pool is fun. You do need to be supermodel type though to feel comfortable laying out or swimming here. Overall our stay was OK. There were several things, as you can see that were inconvenient, but the location of the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Historic, amazing, swanky, contemporary hotel in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: coasterlink
Reviews.Content: With it's rich history, now under the Thompson Hotels brand, this hotel has stepped it up a notch. It's decor and furnishings are very contemporary in a W Hotels-esque kind of way, giving it a very youthful vibe. A part of my room's floor that was constantly very damp wasn't enough to overshadow the outstanding room, very accommodating service and incredible location in the heart of Hollywood. For the right price, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: xsophierugbyx
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days in a 6th floor room. The location was perfect for hollywood sightseeing, and if without a car, getting a ticket for the hop on hop off bus is ideal if you want to see further afield. back to the hotel: checking in was no hassle, and the staff behind the desk were nice and polite, as were the concierges we dealt with. the room itself was lovely, if a little small. As previous guests have said, they arent extremely well lit but we found it ok for the little amount of time we were there. we ate at the 25 degrees burger bar for breakfast, and also tried theyre burgers, both were good meals at reasonable prices! we didnt try the formal restaurant as we had reservations elsewhere, but it looked funky. As for the pool, we didnt actually go in it as we just didnt have the time, but went for drinks one night, and there was a playboy party going on! I had read that sometimes they close the pool var to guests when parties are on, but we had no problem walking through the bouncers and sitting at a big table by the pool for cocktails. We actually were sat down next to Bam Margera and family, which was a bit odd! Overall i would definitely recommend this hotel, moreso for the under 30's. I would not bring kids to this hotel, but for young couples wanting an ideal sightseeing location and trendy digs, it is ideal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: carameliz
Reviews.Content: We were debating between Santa Monica, Malibu, Beverly Hills and Hollywood, and after seeing all these on our trip, we couldn't have been happier that we ended up choosing this hotel. It was an excellent location for what we were interested in seeing. It is literally across the street from the Kodak Theater, Graumans Chinese Theatre, Starline Tours, and Madame Tusauds. It is on the walk of fame as well. We booked a cabana room with patio. I asked for an upgrade, which they easily obliged. We got a cabana room with balcony. The room was modern rustic with hardwood floors, dim lighting and a very comfy platform bed. It overlooked the nice pool area and Tropicana bar. My gripes: We checked in at 2:15 and they said they would call me when the room was ready. I never got a call, even by 6:30p, so we went back after seeing some sites. They apologized, but this was unprofessional. $30 for valet was not fun, especially when certain valets acted like they were more like club bouncers. Tips on our end were minimal to say the least. We tried to avoid it by pulling into the parking lot next to the hotel, but the signs indicated it was not entirely public parking, so you are kinda stuck with valet if you have a car at this hotel. Although retro and cool, the lighting in the room was not the best for seeing yourself, packing etc. I need some area with a bright light. Apparently, there is a club there called Teddys that is frequented by celebs and such. We thought about going, but were too tired and heard or overheard how hard it would be to get into.. I overheard the valet saying this to some Australian guys and the guys commented that there should be some sort of courtesy given to guests. I agree. This hotel is perfect for active, partying early 20s and possibly up to hip 40 year olds. I am 33 and would take my husband or girlfriends here, but not my parents or child. There were no kids in sight, and you can expect some noise if you are by the pool and some possible disruptions of the drunk partiers in the wee hours. However, it was not extreme or anything. Also, the hall wreaked of Mary Jane on one of the nights....must of been CA's medical MJ users. We were out and about most of the day and part of the night. Even with my gripes, the compliments outweigh them and I'd certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I are from London (uk) and...”
Reviews.Author: Rixstar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are from London (uk) and recently stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt in los Angeles (June 2010) after a recommendation from a friend. The previous year we had stayed at the Mondrian, but was assured this was just as good! (how more wrong we couldn't have been). Three things that really disappointed us about the hotel: 1: The friendliness of the staff was absolutely appalling, unless you are either staying in penthouse or buying bottles of champagne that is. Around the pool area we were asked to move several times to make way for other guests! Whatever happened to first come first serves! We are all paying guests at the hotel! 2. Small and dingy rooms. The rooms in the tower are small and dark. You can't unpack your suitcase as there is nowhere to put your clothes. The maids rarely replenished the complimentary showers gel etc! 3. The elevators were constantly out of service, in which case we were made to walk down 12 flights of stairs on more than one occasion. All in all I believe the hotel is trying to be something it is not, after all the bar staff (after trying to force champagne on you every time you go to the bar) are not paid half as much as they would make you think! Attitude like this has 100% confirmed that I will never be staying in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel, pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: PipJH
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with this hotel, and pleasantly surprised by the experience (since we had read some negative reviews). We stayed in a Deluxe King, which had a nice view (looking down across towards the Kodak Theatre). The room was very large and nicely furnished in a slightly funky, slightly retro way. Very hollywood! The building itself is lovely. I loved the lobby and the bars on premises - although my husband felt the ambience was too dark. We had some amazing cocktails at the Library bar, mixed by a bartender who really knows his stuff. Fresh ingredients, and made to specific tastes - very nice. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood at its finest”
Reviews.Author: nkwroger
Reviews.Content: I did not have high expectations upon arriving at the Roosevelt for my friend's wedding. I assumed, as it is a historical landmark and right on Hollywood Blvd amid the madness, that they would not have made any effort to keep it up. I assumed wrong. The Roosevelt is an absolutely lovely and charming hotel. We started our day at the peaceful massage garden receiving the most relaxing treatments from two expert masseuses. Then onto the legendary pool where we enjoyed delicious poolside cocktails and really excellent salads for lunch. Our friend's wedding was elegantly done in the spacious hotel library and followed by a cocktail reception in the garden. The service we received from the whole staff was impeccable, and we will make it a point to stay there whenever returning to Hollywood. It really is a wonderful escape from the massive throngs of people on Hollywood Boulevard. You'd never know the El Capitan theater is right next door. And the 25 Degrees Bar and Restaurant in the hotel serves up a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A HOTEL OF TWO HALVES”
Reviews.Author: Bugerov
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to book the Hollywood Roosevelt at late availability (through a website that specialises in getting cheap deals for 4 star hotel rooms), so only paid $135 USD per night for the room. For a 4 star hotel in Hollywood Boulevard, that is a bargain. The Hollywood Roosevelt in superbly located on Hollywood Boulevard, within easy access of a number of attractions (Madame Tussauds and the Chinese Theatre are literally across the road). However, in terms of the hotel itself I was a bit disappointed: the public rooms (ie the bars, reception and sitting areas) are beautifully designed and decorated, like you would expect to see in a 4 star hotel. Yet the room in which we were accommodated was quite, well ordinary - more like a 3 star hotel at best. Don't get me wrong, although it was a small room, there was no 'problem' with the room: there was a double bed, decent tv and it was clean and comfortable. I'm no snob that demands the best and an oppulent lifestyle, but I have stayed in 4 star hotels in various locations in the world and the Hollywood Roosevelt rooms frankly don't compare in my opinion. I'm not sure if when they took over, Thomson maintained the current standards of the public rooms but 'toned down' the other rooms to keep prices down and/or make it more affordable?!? Anyway, you'll understand now why I describe it as a hotel of two halves. Internet access costs $10 per 24 hours, and although there is a coffee machine in the room you have to pay for the coffee! I'm not sure if this is standard for LA hotels in prime locations but I've nearly always found such ammenities free in USA hotels. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the quality of the food but we did go to the Library Bar where the resident cocktail mixer (Matt) mixes some wonderful cocktails using locally grown produce, and at a reasonable price. The service from all staff was very good. In sum, great location for the Hollywood area. A fair bargain if you can get a good deal on the rooms instead of paying the standard price. But a hotel that builds up expectations as you enter but then may disappoint slightly.

Reviews.Title: “Good for party people, otherwise avoid”
Reviews.Author: Lou12
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood roosevelt hotel is in a prime position if you want to be at the heart of the tourist attractions and near to the metro links. The hotel lobby is based on two floors, both are historical, clean and fashionable. Our bedroom was spacious, the bed was really comfortable and the small bathrooms was clean. However, the bedroom decor is now looking worn as the carpets are marked and the curtains are grubby. With your stay expect to pay:- Valet parking $30 per day, bottled water in your room $7 per bottle, wi-fi access $10per day, $14.99 for a movie and a pint of larger at the pool $8. Warning - If you are looking for a peaceful location this is not the hotel for you. The medium sized busy pool is packed with models and wannabes and each weekend they have an all day and night pool party with very loud club music playing. It also uses all the pool side seating and beds. If you are looking for a 18-30 holiday vibe this is the spot for you. If like me, you wanted a peaceful afternoon in the sun, this is awful and something the hotel staff do not tell you about when you check in! The car park is busy at all hours, you can hear the Hollywood boulevard salesmen on their tanoys from before 9am each morning. There are also a lot of people hanging around till early in the morning, whilst they party at the hotel. The hotel is on the doorstep of the Hollywood and highland entertainment complex where you can eat, drink and shop. It is also next to the kodak and manns theatres. Best of all the hotel is next door to the la metro line. This can take you all over la (including universal theme park) for less than $2! If you are in la I would recommend the following places: 1. The grove - great brand name shops, farmers Market and the cheesecake factory restaurant (does soooo much more than cake!) 2. La star homes tour - great if you like celebrities! 3. In and out burger on sunset, just behind the hotel - famous with the celebs for the best burger in Hollywood! 4. Broadway and Dws shoe shops - next to hotel on sunset and Hollywood boulevard. Very cheap brand name shoes - bargains! 5. Universal & city walk - great day out.....go on the metro! 6. Disneyland - good, smaller version of disneyworld in Orlando 7. Santa monica - have a walk around the pier, the beach front and the 3rd street promenade 8. Malibu - paradise cove. A great spot to spend a day at a peaceful beach.     Finally, if you go to la in June, be aware that the sun does not burn through the clouds until after lunch. Before this time, and after 5pm, it can be chilly so bring layers in your suitcase! In summary, the hotel overall was ok. The pool situation was very poor. next time I would stay at a quiter five star hotel in a nearby area (the London, the w hotel, sofitel, the westin etc)

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location for first timer in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Ronow
Reviews.Content: We felt like special guests in Hollywood! from their valet parking service (yes it's $30/ 24hr but it costs about the same in every hotel in Hollywood), check in experience, and service from bellboy. We didn't spend much time in the hotel at the pool or lounge area. Instead, we had dinner at 25 degrees right inside the hotel facing Hollywood Blvd. I enjoyed the atmosphere there and I still miss their sweet potato fries and shake. The hotel is right at the center of Hollywood Blvd and every attraction is within a few minute walk. We had a night stroll and by 11PM all the shops were closed, we didn't feel safe in the area we had to walk back to hotel. If this is your first time staying in Hollywood, or even LA I would highly recommend this hotel. If not, then I guess hotels in Beverly Hills would be a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Cookie cutter boutique”
Reviews.Author: mikebern
Reviews.Content: There's nothing really wrong with this hotel. It just saddens me to see what it's become compared to what it used to be in the days when it was slightly seedy, seemed to cater to British tour groups and guests on Sally Jesse Raphael (or some other similar show,) and had the David Hockney pool. I know it's been a while since Thompson took it over, but I can't forget. Back then, staying here was always a crapshoot -- but a lot of the time you'd end up with a huge, weirdly shaped, purely spectacular 'old Hollywood' room. Or better yet, if you asked nicely, they'd give you one of the bungalows out by the pool which were even weirder. When Thompson renovated the place they made everything the same. Cold functional rooms, small bathrooms, identical decor, perfectly symmetrical. I thought the purpose of a boutique hotel was for it NOT to be a cookie cutter. They took one of the truly unique properties in the entire United States -- one that I always looked forward to staying at -- and made it into a humdrum experience that's fine if you like sameness...and some people do...

Reviews.Title: “The star treatment and a must stay if visiting Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: ozcc
Reviews.Content: I had read negative reviews of the Roosevelt and was concerned however our stay was a very positive experience right from the moment we arrived. All of the staff at the are wonderful, service is excellent and if you are visiting Hollywood the Roosevelt is probably the only star attraction there! I am very pleased that I did book this hotel as I found Hollywood to be a very trashy dirty place and the Roosevelt a sanctuary away from the madness. We spent an afternoon around the pool which has an exciting atmosphere and you really do feel part of what one imagines the Hollywood scene to be like. The Hollywood Roosevelt exudes class and the style of the old Hollywood. The room was comfortable and the Beds the best around except for the shin knocking on the bed platform, you soon learn to be careful! The bathroom although small was functional, toiletries were very nice. Well equipped mini bar in the room. The valets are fantastic and look after all guest arriving extremely well. In fact we were waiting for someone to arrive and sat in the lounges provided outside, this proved very interesting watching luxury cars arrive with guests. All in all this hotel provided us with a five star experience that has become part of our wonderful holiday memories.

Reviews.Title: “Pool party meets Beverley Hills 90210!”
Reviews.Author: Lordie1
Reviews.Content: A great hotel if you're Paris Hilton!! The hotel itself is ok and looks the part but perhaps that's LA.. The rooms were nice but I've stayed in much better... In fact words fail me to conjure up my overnight stay in LA. Sushi at Katsuya is a must (expensive and a fair walk but worth the trip).

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: CAgolfgirl
Reviews.Content: Don't be sucked in by the Hollywood idea of this hotel. The bathrooms have no counter space and the shower is terrible. There are a type of spanish rounded tile on the stairs, which are everywhere and it's very difficult to walk in business heels let alone fashion heels. Unless I have to for an event, I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy boutique hotel right in the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: gambit76
Reviews.Content: Great place to people watch at the lounge and in the lobby. The water pressure in the bathrooms needs to be improved but the rest of the room was nicely upgraded for an older hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelledGal
Reviews.Content: This grand old history-laden hotel has gotten a recent facelift but for just under $300 a night (!) the room was really tiny, had chipped paint and nowhere to put your travel bag. The bathroom was also a disappointment - cramped and not well thought out. There is, however, a lovely pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm...not sure why people rave about Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Coastal_NC
Reviews.Content: I will start out with the best feature of this property which is definitely location. You are right in the middle of everything on Hollywood Blvd. However, that is where the accolades end. I travel for a living and have stayed in more hotels than I can count, so I do tend to be rather particular when it comes to accommodations. We stayed here since we got a great Travelzoo rate. We arrived and found out that our only option for parking was valet at $30 a day. Crazy. Check in was smooth and they "upgraded" us to a deluxe room. I would hate to see what a standard room looked like. The room was a weird shape, bathroom only large enough for one person at a time and the furniture was dinged, chipped, dirty, etc. I will say the bed was extremely comfortable and we were fortunate to be on the side away from Hollywood Blvd since it can be terribly loud at night. Hallways were very very dark and later in the trip the hotel staff was rather aloof and the valet staff plain unhelpful and even rude at times. With the other options available in the area I would definitely stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel, service outstanding, and location to die for.”
Reviews.Author: twhitey11
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. Location is superb,the service from all staff was brilliant, rooms spotless and a great diner at the front of the hotel. You need to stay in one of the rooms near the pool, which costs more than a standard room, but is well worth it. Rooms are quiet even though the hotel fronts onto hollywood bvd. Also if you want to find some party time, the hotel has a great nightclub.

Reviews.Title: “HOORAY FOR HOLLYWOOD”
Reviews.Author: tbirdman1955
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at the Roosevelt in April, while attending the TCM Classic Movies Film Festival. I had read many of the reviews posted here and hoped that the issues brought up had been resolved. I am happy to say that I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there, in every way. The location is right on Hollywood Blvd, across from Grauman's Chinese Theater. If you are into old Hollywood, you are in the right place. Friendly staff, quiet room, quick valet service. Wish I was still there......

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tigerman93
Reviews.Content: This place is a great experience. Full of charm. Its trendy, cool and hip. We were on our Honeymoon and we had an awesome time here. Stayed in the King room. The Tropicana bar is great at night. heaps of fun. The location is great, across from Kodak Theatre, shop and supermarket. Cant wait to come back

Reviews.Title: “Old school glamour”
Reviews.Author: wintermuteLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. Great service, cocktails and pool. Great for people watching all the Hollywood hot bods too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: danni_bh2b
Reviews.Content: I had a few reviews on there prior to staying at the roosevelt so i wasnt too sure how my stay would be. But honestly the hotel was beautiful and staff were super friendly and helpful. The beds were like clouds so comfortable. I dont understand what people could complain about , maybe there just enjoy complaining? But would definatley reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bizarre Rooms”
Reviews.Author: lesdeb
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and poorly lit. Furnishings are bizarre, and not in a good way. We paid extra for a cabana room and were given one on the second floor down a long and twisting hallway. We thought we would have a view of the garden or pool, but the room had no window to see out of! We pulled back the drapes and were faced with an opaque frosted glass like a shower door! Unbelievable! I went back to the front desk, and the clerk kindly said that she could give me a complimentary upgrade to poolside on the first floor with a patio facing the pool. Great! The location was excellent, but the noise level in the evening, especially over the weekend, was terrible. Loud hammering music blared at full volume from the poolside bar until 1 o'clock in the morning. Don't expect to sleep unless you have some Ambien.

Reviews.Title: “Good vibe!”
Reviews.Author: RogierHendriks
Reviews.Content: Location is not too good, but the Vibe is super relaxed. Good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: NORMSMRS
Reviews.Content: The roosevelt had lovely public areas and the pool area was also very nice although rather full of young people too busy looking good to relax! The first room we had the air con was so noisy we asked to be moved. The rooms are small but not particulalry well appointed and the bathrooms very dated. The burgers in 360 are fab as are the staff. The hotel restuarant is a little over priced and we flet that the waiter was doing us a favour by deeming to serve us! Very expensive. Location is fab you literally are on the walk of fame. Hollywood itself is tatty though and disapointing for more than a day trip. We went and did the stars tour which was nicely naff! El Captain cinema is well worth a look and was reminicent of the golden olden days with an organ player at the start of the film - loved it. The Farmers market is worth a bus trip as is Santa Monica. We also did Universal - brilliant and all this using public transport - it does work honest!

Reviews.Title: “Star spotting hotel”
Reviews.Author: sti5brigade
Reviews.Content: Came as part of a business trip. Was upgraded to a Studio Suite - quite nice and spacious. The ward-drobes and safe area could do with much more light Good bathrooms Beds are supportive but very comfortable - not too hard or soft Reception service excellent Very frosty concierge - blonde lady with fake smiles Excellent breakfasts, good pool area, excellent service and food, reasonably priced. Breakfast very good - you can get a breakfast including drinks and tip for under $20, the service can be a little slow at times - they need more staff! Lifts - these are the biggest drawback and at times you can be waiting some time - they have 2 old lifts serving all the rooms - its a bit of a nonsense really But the key to this hotel is the celebrities Had Colin Farrell near me at the Pool Blur/Gorillaz full band were staying at the hotel and I saw them regularly There was a famous NFL linebacker and his entourage - Tyrell I think he was called Its the mingling with the stars - who all seem totally down to earth that completely makes this stay - in such a short period I have never seen so many celerities If your looking for somewhere in Hollywood I dont think you'll find a better located hotel, though I think you would be bored quite quickly - better to stay on the Coast I would think I'm rating this 5 stars overall - on a 10 point scale it would have got a 9 The lifts are the main issue!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: SatisfiedinTX
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive to stay at this hotel from all the bad reviews, but my stay was flawless. The ambiance of the public area is like stepping back in time. The rooms, in contrast are very modern and beautifully appointed. The staff is young and energetic. Everyone at this facility was top-notch and service oriented, right on down to the obvious security detail present everywhere. I will only consider stayng at this hotel anytime i am in Hollywood. I did notice at 53 years old I was the oldest thing in the building other than the impeccibly maintained vintage lobby and entrance, so it is not oriented to children. Go and enjoy yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting. Clearly Old Hollywood! Which is good! But a four star??”
Reviews.Author: MiamiOlivier
Reviews.Content: I would call it Boutique on a Budget. The rooms are nice (although a little light in the rooms would be nice - very underlit) The design is good - actually very good. But it comes off as design on a dime. In my room, I had a flat screen, but 26" - Come on? And the electrical socket in the bathoom didn't work. Room wasn't dirty..but the clearing seems be always done in a hurry - throughout the hotel. For example, the logo carpet in the elevators - whew, they need cleaning! I was concerned when I read the reviews of this hotel - and they are accurate. My experience wasn't bad, but left me with a, "Really, this is four stars?" The location is outstanding (and the parking garage next to the Hotel Parking Lot is 20 bucks for the night. The bar, next to the pool, was trendy and would love to see it at peak season - but at the prices that the hotel wants to charge...I'll pass. Net Net - I didn't feel totally ripped off -- but I had a very good rate. If I was paying full fare - I would feel ripped off ...

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: DanielleK723
Reviews.Content: I went with three friends from San Francisco (four women). We wanted old-school Hollywood, and that's what we got. Accomodation: The hotel is gorgeous. Shiny tile lobby, great photos and decor, beautiful rooms. We love the smaller porcelin bathrooms with pedastal sinks- very stylish and what we have in our 1930s apt buildings in SF. That's class. Not like the Marriot where the bathroom countertop is like an airport runway and the shower is made of molded plastic. Amenties: The 24-hour diner was awesome- fries and onion rings a perfect end to the night. The pool was great. We just made sure to get there by 10 to get chairs. Staff: The receptionists all were professional, friendly, and helpful. The pool staff were friendly and funny. The car valet people were wonderful too. The women who cleaned our room made things look like a modern art arrangement. Given all the bad reviews, we were a bit skeptical, but then again we were extremely friendly (you get what you give) and we like old-school style. Go in with a positive attitude!

Reviews.Title: “ROOSEVELT NIGHTMARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: im666johnny
Reviews.Content: Not only is the Roosevelt over priced- but don't expect any fair service! The staff is unprofessional, rude, inconsiderate, and down right racist! I, nor my spouse have ever been more insulted by hotel staff members- but the staff doesn't try to accomodate their guests. The hotel is like a maze.. you can not find anyone to guide you to any part of the hotel. We were lucky enough to put our expenses on an American Express (which I highly recommend) and disputed all charges because we had such a horrible experience. I still get upset when I hear the name of that god for saken hotel!

Reviews.Title: “completely exceeded our expectations – it was absolutely terrific”
Reviews.Author: Shmees
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend from March 6-8, which happened to be Oscar weekend – and we are not in the film industry or any type of VIP. We were nervous due to the reviews of the hotel. We entirely expected to be treated quite badly, or at best ignored, and to have a small shabby room. However it completely exceeded our expectations – it was absolutely terrific. From check-in to check-out, the staff had huge smiles and were extremely, extremely gracious and accommodating, and so cheerful and nice (front desk, concierge, valet). We had booked one of the less expensive rooms – around $360 per night (a bit pricey). Our room was very large (10th floor, 2 dbl beds), sunny with a cool view (Kodak Theatre, Grauman’s Chinese, hills), and a huge bathroom (bit of a scuffed floor, and ugly coloured tiles, but that is all I could find to criticize). It seemed to have been recently renovated, and it looked great. Even the lamps and art and TV were really nice and new-looking. There was absolutely no noise, although I know there were parties going on in the hotel. We were thrilled with the room and the hotel. We are tough customers who have stayed at amazing hotels around the world, and we love to complain, but we couldn’t find anything to complain about. There were long waits for the elevators, but we didn’t mind because such interesting people (celebs, producers, etc) were going in and out of the elevators. We didn’t go to the pool/outdoor bar, but we did eat at the burger place downstairs - a pleasant surprise, because the prices were so reasonable and the food was great. We had a drink in the library bar (nice) and wandered around a bit since the interior of the hotel, although dim, is interesting and nice. The location is great too. We did not experience any of the bad stuff I saw in other reviews – to the contrary, it was completely great from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Posh, Overrated but Definitely an Experience”
Reviews.Author: Schmew
Reviews.Content: What can I say. This hotel is an icon but with all its fame and glamor it is just an average trendy hotel. Obviously trying too hard to be something that it lacks the important thing, customer service. Maybe it is that I am not a celebrity, but renting a suite I thought would allow me at least a welcoming reception. Nope, I got a snobby, trying too hard, young guy who made me feel little for not wearing designer clothing as he looked me and my business partner up and down. Its 2009 kid, we work in internet, we make more in a month than you will in 10 years and we don't care what we look like. When we wanted to go to the pool in the evening we had to be on a guest list. We were because we rented a suite. However, my partner went before me and he did not have his name on the suite and was declined access by the over sized bouncer at the entrance. Can't a guy go for a swim? And the last complaint (I could list many).... It is VERY loud. I think we were there during some high school grad party. Skimpy dressed chicks and loud mouth guys being waaay to hammered all over the hotel. Would have been nice if the hotel would have notified us that we were sharing the hotel with an out of control group of teenagers. Yeah, that really went over well with my clients. The good list: Well equip and sizable suites, right on Hollywood, hot chicks everywhere (not the high schoolers. I know you were thinking it) Bad: Poor service, elite status mentality, overpriced drinks. I will not stay here again. I can find better places to impress my clients.

Reviews.Title: “* Live like a movie star *”
Reviews.Author: Canuckgal25
Reviews.Content: I had seen the Roosevelt on movies, and decided that when I ever got a chance to go to California I would stay there. When we first pulled up to the hotel we were so excited. It was large, and right in the centre of Hollywood. We had to pay $40 a night US to park the car, plus tip the bellman. The hotel room wasn't as large as it looked in the pictures, or as new. It was really nice though, and the bed was huge and so comfortable. From stay at other hotels like this it was a little over priced. Hollywood itself was pretty dirty. We ended up just taking out food and bringing it back to the hotel to eat. We stayed in a Cabana room overlooking the pool. At night the pool area is converted into a nihgt club. It was awesome!! We loved the night time. Be prepared to pay $18 a drink though. During the day the pool area was amazing. It looks like an old Hollywood movie with palm trees and lounge chairs. Overall it was a lot of fun, and very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, amenities”
Reviews.Author: DWfromNY
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a few days in LA at the Roosevelt. It was my second stay and the hotel has only gotten better. The gym and pool are great. Beds very comfortable. Staff very accommodating and cordial. If you want to see Hollywood the location cannot be beat. Ate at the Dakota this time and food and service were excellent. Previous reviews mentioned problems with the elevators..... I did not have any problems. I would recommend to anyone who wants to be in a comfortable, clean hotel with a gym and pool in the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Spooky and Overprised”
Reviews.Author: BellaTejana
Reviews.Content: Great Lobby and pool area! Burgers are scrumptious! Location was awesome! We stayed one night, and that was enough. Staff service was ok., nothing special. The 9th floor hallway was "spooky" and everything in the room just seemed so average. Bathrooms are small, and our view was a vacant alley like area. The website was a bit misleading. I don't recommend this hotel and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Live Up To It's Reputation”
Reviews.Author: Ki-lo-li
Reviews.Content: I have seen this hotel on tv, movies and heard people talk about it so I was excited to stay when I visited LA. I was so disappointed, the "garden view" was rubbish so we upgraded to a Cabana room which cost about $100, the room was much better as it had a balcony and view over the pool. I was not impressed with the room though, the concrete bathroom made me not want to use it and the furniture in the bedroom was old and tatty and the bed very low and strange. The pool was lovely as was the bar in the evenings. The location is great if you want to do very touristy things eg go on the open top bus tour, as it is located right on Hollywood Boulevard across from the Hollywood and Higland Centre, Kodak Theatre, Walk of Fame etc but LA is very spread out and it is best if you hire a car. Santa Monica is well worth the drive, The Grove and Robertson Blvd are great for shopping too. I think the Roosevelt is good for first time Hollywood tourists and wannabes but the reality is that it is overpriced and does not live up to it's reputation.

Reviews.Title: “A bit each way”
Reviews.Author: starcat20
Reviews.Content: This hotel definately has good bits and bad bits. The beds are divine, and the room I had was reasonably sized. The bathroom was a little small, but suitable for one person. The only downside was that there was no counter to put cosmetics, toothbrush etc. I found the hotel a touch intimidating as I was clearly a "no one" to the staff, and I never made it to the pool or bar. Most evenings of my stay the front lobby was closed for a red-carpet function, making me feel like I was in the way if I wanted to enter or leave the hotel. No noise complaints; I was on the top floor and there were only a few other guests up there, including one who flooded the hall. I really enjoyed 25 Degrees; their bugers were to die for, and the chips as well. Their cocktails were nice also. The worst part of the experience for me was having my credit card declined elsewhere as the hotel puts a hold of $150 per night, which they don't tell you, and in my case they did it twice. There was no sympathy from reception for the fact they left me with $2 credit available for the last few days of a month long holiday. The hold was only released after I had returned to Australia. Overall, I really did like the hotel, but if you aren't a celebrity you arent treated quite as well as you should be. I would stay there again, particularly for the location.

Reviews.Title: “mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: nightpanda
Reviews.Content: the pros: beautiful old but still trendy hotel - so much history! the staff was extremely polite and helpful. the bed was the most comfortable thing i've ever slept on. the room itself (a cabana room) was tastefully done. location perfect if you want to stay in hollywood. the cons: the bathroom was so small you couldn't fit more than one person in a time... with two of us getting ready to go out we fought over the itty bitty mirror. even though the room was an upgrade it was still small and dimly lit. the mini bar was soooo expensive! i know they always are but this was ridiculous! bottom line: great for a treat but incredibly overpriced -- and i was there on a promotion! You have to be prepared to exchange the modernity of say a westin or an omni for funky and unique

Reviews.Title: “Good times at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HappySydChampers
Reviews.Content: After a bad experience at another hotel we escaped to this hotel and were pleasantly surprised with place and the staff- especially the guy who checked us in. The rooms were clean and the location was great and the history of the place and connection with Hollywood made the stay even more memorable. I think that the girls at reception in the morning shift could be a bit more friendly but overall they did not detract from the overall positive experience we had there. Perhaps at check-in the staff could explain some of the services and amenities on offer. Overall a great Hollywood experience! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always the Best”
Reviews.Author: directorsassistant
Reviews.Content: For the money, the Roosevelt is one of the best hotels in LA. They still have smoking rooms. Their staff is usually friendly and amenable. Perfect location. The only reason I wouldn't recommend the Roosevelt is simply to make sure I can always get a room there!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: 1995sb21
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here for a Christmas party. LOVED the dining room, the mac and cheese is wonderful. We stayed in a suite. The room was pretty good size but it is an old hotel which means small bathroom and a bit of a funky lay out. We asked for a quiet room and have no complaints about any noise. I would stay here again only for the location. There certainly are far nicer and more luxurious hotels but this location is prime and the hotel was good.

Reviews.Title: “My worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: gaby10289
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews on Tripadvisor, I was wary of what to expect but figured the location was reason enough to book a night here plus perhaps if I booked one of the nicer rooms, the a cabana room for $489 a night, maybe it would not be as bad. I WAS WRONG. Thanks to the Roosevelt my new years was turned into a nightmare. To start with, the front desk clerks who checked us in were aloof and seemed not very bright. The room looked nothing like the picture on the website, was dark, small, and worn. There was also nothing original about the room or it's design. For a period of 2 hours the power proceeded to go in and out, which lead us to be late for where we were going. If I had known we would be in pitch darkness for so long I would have stayed at a motel 6 with the lights off and saved $450. And to summarize the staff was the rudest I have ever experienced--condescending and took no accountability for their faults/had little knowledge of the simplest things like "where can we get some ice?" I've stayed at plenty of hotels in LA (viceroy, chateau marmont, shutters, casa del mar, standard, beverly hilton, the W, the bel air hotel, and thompson beverly hills) but never have I been treated so poorly or as disappointed as I was with my stay at the Roosevelt. Seriously.....steer clear of this AMATEUR, MEDIOCRE, RUDE, and DESPERATE ATTEMPT AT BEING HIP and save your money for somewhere else (viceroy and chateau marmont would be my recommendations for about the same price and infinitely better service and accomodations).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redgrange
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood roosevelt is a classic hotel in Los Angeles. I have stayed there several times and have never had any issues. The rooms are clean, however, are somewhat small. The hotel is very trendy and on the weekends tends to be a bit loud. On several occations, I could hear people hanging out in the hallways, but only on the weekends. The pool and pool bar are fantastic. The staff is great and usually recognize me each time I visit. The only downfall is the cost. The rooms are somewhat expensive and parking is expense. Overall, its a great hotel and I consider it every time I travel to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Perfect for a screening at Grauman's Chinese, El Capitan, or a party at the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tracee3d
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on a weekday for a movie premiere at the Grauman's Chinese Theater and the reception at the Roosevelt Hotel. It could not have worked out better for us. The room rate was reasonable since it was a school night and we booked ahead online at the advance purchase, non-refundable rate of $169, which came out to be about $250 after taxes and $30 valet parking, etc. I haven't seen the credit card bill come through, so it's a bit early to review the entire experience, but wanted to write while it's fresh in my memory. Overall it was pleasant and super convenient. When we got there, the reception didn't have our reservation on their system, which was a little frustrating. Once we got our room, we were able to unpack, get ready, and walk across Hollywood Blvd to the line forming outside of the theater, watch the movie, go back to the room to use the restroom and freshen up, back downstairs to the party without standing in a long line to get in. When even went back up to the room and rested a while and waited for the crowd to thin out. The bedding was comfortable, the amenities were adequate, and the decor was tastefully done. We had breakfast at "25 Degrees" the following morning, and it was pretty good. We would stay there again if we're going to an event in the area. We've stayed at the Renaissance Hotel at Hollywood & Highland for an event at the Kodak Theater, which I liked better. But, the less walking you have to do in high heels on Hollywood Blvd, the better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sushifest
Reviews.Content: Before I lived in LA, I used to stay here when I visited because it has a really unique vibe about it. It's an old hotel that has a lot of history behind it. From what I understand, a lot of the "Old Hollywood" celebs such as Marilyn Monroe used to love staying here. But it's also a hangout for today's celebs as well. Although the hotel is old, it's not run down. The rooms are nice, clean, and comfortable. If you want to spend an extra couple of bucks, you can stay in the cabana rooms which are nicer and right by the pool. There are many places to hang out right at the Roosevelt. There's the Tropicana Bar which is usually hard to get in if you're not a guest, celeb or know someone. The exclusivity makes it fun to hang out here. It's great people watching and the service is great. Very loungey type of outdoor vibe. Then there's the lobby area which is really dark for a lobby. And next to it is the Library bar, which is a small room that has an intimate feel. That is open to the public. There's also Teddy's which is an even more exclusive lounge than Tropicana. On a good night, you are likely to see celebrities in there. I know I saw a few.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GREAT SERVICE, BUT THE ROOM.....”
Reviews.Author: Briarbruin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick Thanksgiving holiday and I chose the Roosevelt because we enjoy classic, historic older hotels. The public rooms are gorgeous and definitely Old Hollywood, including the pool area. The location, on Hollywood Boulevard across from Grauman's Chinese Theatre, Madame Tussaud's, and the Hollywood & Highland Center/Kodak Theatre, is convenient for sightseeing, shopping, and bars/restaurants. The staff at the hotel, from valet to front desk to concierge to waitstaff, were very friendly and professional. We had Thanksgiving dinner at Dakota and breakfast at 25 Degrees and both restaurants were excellent. NOW, to the room. I realize older hotels have certain constraints placed on the room based on size and configuration and that is a given at any older property. Our room, a king nonsmoking, was decorated in a hard edged and off putting modernist style, with not one chair to sit in except for a flimsy desk chair. The room was generously sized and there was more than enough room for an occasional chair. The bathroom was a weird combo of industrial and traditional, with a pedestal sink and no room for even a toothbrush and toothpaste anywhere in the bathroom. I am not saying I wanted a foo-foo room with chintz and silk curtains, but a comfortable chair to sit in would be nice. And a bathroom that you can leave your toiletries on the sink instead of carrying them back and forth from the room, which I did after one of my prescription medication bottles fell into the toilet. This may not be an issue for some people, but it is for me and I would probably not stay here again despite the other very positive features I described above.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch = Hollywood Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: trojanchick
Reviews.Content: The pictures of the rooms on their website look nothing like the room we were given. Aside from that fact, the common areas, lobby and pool are nice, but the rooms leave much to be desired. The walls between the rooms are paper thin; we heard everything our neighbors did and said. The room we were given was smaller than a dorm room, the lighting was terrible (fluorescent lighting), the snacks in the room were typical of that found at 7-Eleven (not Dean and Deluca as their website claims), The bath products are by bigalow (not Kiehl's as their website claims), and the $30 a day parking for hotel guests is the biggest rip off ever (not to mention inconvenient). Additionally, their website claims that their rooms have "state of the art technology." If by State of the art they mean an ipod player, telephone and a small flat screen tv, then that's true; but since we all live in the 21st century - that assertion is also another big farce. Bait and switch is a form of fraud and someone should report this hotel to the Los Angeles District Attorney's Office.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: SauceyK
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on this site we decided to give the Roosevelt a go, only because if it's location.....to be honest, we arrived expecting the absolute worst! This was the first leg of our Honeymoon and the part that we were not expecting much from! We were pleasantly surprised.... Check in was great (although i agree that the staff do think they are a bit too cool, bellboys in particular!), we'd mentioned in our booking that we were on our honeymoon and we were upgraded to a bigger room on level 12 with views (didn't have any issue with noise at all), our names were placed on the guest list of the nightclub. Our room was huge, a little dark and there was a slightly funny smell in the corridor but nothing too overwhelming..... after all this is actually a fairly reasonably priced hotel, we weren't expecting 5+ star service or amenities Loved 25 degrees, the pool bar, the foyer and the closeness to everything hollywood had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Steer Clear!”
Reviews.Author: WexfordBlue
Reviews.Content: The most expensive night of our trip through California and the worst by far. Where to start? Pool closed to guests for some private party all afternoon and evening! (We were furious at this to be honest, I mean - they advertise this facility then tell you it's out of bounds) Pool bar closed for the night (well, it was still being stocked when we gave up waiting for a drink at 10.30pm).
