Had to get past a bouncer to get to our room. Virtually impossible to get a drink in the lobby bar - packed with non-guests. No drinks or table service in the lobby. A 45 minute wait, while standing, in the corner of the restaurant. Small dark rooms with a lousy air-con system. In general we got the feeling that we were an inconvenience to the staff. We hadn't experienced this anywhere else in America on our trip. We complained bitterly the next day and managed to get our bill reduced, but this was only after we insisted on seeing the manager. I would advise people to avoid this place. Big time. Guests are treated as second class citizens behind whatever wannabe party is taking place. Terrible value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of history!”
Reviews.Author: moo1986
Reviews.Content: I would, after returning home, give anything to be back in the bed's at the Hollywood Roosevelt! The hotel had the best bed I have ever slept in! The hotel is in a great location near the Chinese theatre and makes you feel like you are being preserved in an era of old hollywood glamour. Try a steak at the restaurant (inside the hotel) - "Dakota" and have a cocktail at the poolside "Tropicana Bar". You won't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Ok- but not as good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: Bunny1982
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok. I found the lack of lighting a bit annoying. I know it is to create a "feel" for the place. But it just frustrated me a bit. The lack of clear signage was also annoying. I had no idea where I was going half the time. The fact that in this day and age you have to pay for internet is stupid! It is ten dollars for 24 hours. It was fast though. My partner and I were on our honeymoon and mentioned it to the staff. We still had to pay extra to get a nicer/bigger room. The pool area didn't look as nice as I was expecting. I didn't swim though as it was too cold. The location is right next to the Hollywood Strip. This could be a good or bad thing. It was handy. But the area is just so dirty!

Reviews.Title: “If your going to LA stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: spider256
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the middle of the week on vacation. From 10pm to 3am the suite next to us had music so loud that our walls were shaking. We had to turn on our fan to our AC which was so loud itself and that did not even help. Do not book this hotel if you are planning on relaxing. Also, the bathrooms are really tiny and the decor is not that great. If you have a car plan on spending $30 dollars a day on valet as there is no parking; internet you have to pay $10 a day. On the plus side the location is good and the staff was friendly to us.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: jovertigo
Reviews.Content: the roosevelt was such an exciting experience!! best location, at the walk of fame... nice pool and often there are parties in the evening! first we had a room in the main building which has been okay but we could make an upgrade to a room by the pool with a balcony which was amazing!!!! the hotel is a absolute must when you go to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated, over priced, no service”
Reviews.Author: Summer_solstice07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and if it had been any longer we would have moved. First you have to carry your suitcase down a flight of stairs to the reception area, you then have to carry them back up the stairs to get to your room, no bell boy and you have to find the room yourself. We payed extra to stay in the pool area, what a mistake. First they constantly have parties here all weekend and the smell of spilt alcohol, people being sick doesn't leave during the day, secondly to hide the bad décor the rooms are very dark, so dark in fact it was hard to read and you had to check your make-up etc upon leaving the hotel in a nearby store, thirdly all the party goers have access to the guest rooms, you're meant to only be able to get in via a swipe key however this didn't appear to be switched on, fourthly due to all the parties the noise level is high, fifthly they have day pool parties, which were great to people watch but as a guest i felt i couldn't sit by the pool and just relax. We were asked if we wanted to upgrade to have a view over the pool, thank fully we said no to this, speaking to another guest who had they found they couldn't sleep due to all the noise. On the plus side this is a great location, but with so many other places to stay i would avoid this. For the price we paid per night we could of stayed at the Château Marmont, i'm upset we didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, shame about the noise from the next room”
Reviews.Author: Kilty249
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and liked it very much The staff were very helpful & friendly, and the dinner we had in the Dakota was lovely. The only complaint was that the people in the next room were very noisy, despite our resquests for them to tone it down. Some sound proofing would have been nice. Would stay here again though. Location is 2nd to none.

Reviews.Title: “A trendy hotel with no service.”
Reviews.Author: victorsh
Reviews.Content: I guess this is a good place to stay if you want to be close to the major sightseeing points near Hollywood. Otherwise, the place seems to be overrun with the stereotypical Hollywood wannabes. Oh, did I mention there was virtually no service?

Reviews.Title: “Great place to party.”
Reviews.Author: RohanC
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay and party on a Saturday or Sunday. Get there early to enjoy the sunshine. Take your booze in early to your room if you want to have a drink, as they search bags and confiscate later in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: doctorKDK
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of our honeymoon and were seducecd by its hip and trendy reputation as being a fab hotel where all the celebs hang out and the lovely pictures of the rooms on their website - however, we were hugely disappointed! When we checked in we asked for a nice room as it was our honeymoon and were told that they could'nt accomodate us as they were fully booked, fine we thought, how bad can the other rooms be! Well, the answer is BAD! we were shown to our room and were horrified at its size - it was little more than a box room, where i could get out of bed and be in the bathroom and shower all in one step. Rather unimpressed by this, we complained and were offered a few alternative, none of which were much better, however, we opted for a slightly bigger room, however, still as dingy as dark as the one before. The rooms werent particularly clean and inviting and the staff werent particualrly friendly - all wannabe celebs, actors and actresses in general. The hotel bar was closed on all three nights we stayed there, as they had various celeb parties going on - wow, i hear you all say - well not really, firstly i means that the hotel is super crowded, the staff are wholly focused on these parties and it gets very noisey. basically, i cannot find a redeeming feature for this hotel and would never stay there again or recommend that anyone else does for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hootie63
Reviews.Content: From check into check out, we enjoyed our stay at the Roosevelt. The staff was friendly and professional. Despite other reviews here, our experence was wonderful. We stayed here for our anniversary and were very impressed with the entire experience. yes, the bathrooms are small, but this is an older hotel. The decorations were fabulous. We will definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: adviser2009
Reviews.Content: With all those bad reviews I was a little bit afraid about to spending vacation at the Roosevelt Hotel. Lucky me I did not change my idea! The Hotel is in a great location, right in front of Hollywood & Highland; The staff was very helpful and polite!! Our room was amazing, with two flat screen TVs, a great living room and a wonderful bed. So nice!! The room service was divine!! The Tropicana bar at the pool was very good, parties every evening and if you are hungry, take some steps at the Hollywood Blvd. and grab a meal right in 25 degrees, another rooselvet´s restaurant. No complains, no regrets!! I just wonder how all those people, had so many bad experiences from the best hotel in hollywood!!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood OK”
Reviews.Author: SaraMarieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt Sat 9/19-21. We payed over $200 a night for a room with 2 queen beds. The hotel is in a great location if you want to walk along Sunset Blvd. A few complaints: Parking is $30/night. I know most hotels are charging this much now but it still really bothers me. The room smelled a little musty so we kept the windows open. This let in lots of noise but its expected in this location. The furniture was modern/stylish but very worn looking. There was dark brown wooden desk/drawers that were all chipped and Im not sure how this happens. Both mornings we were woken by house cleaning knocking quickly and loudly at 8am. There were a few quick knocks and then they tried to force the door open. Luckily, we used the latch lock. We didnt even get a chance to respond! It happened again the second morning twice! The second time we were up out of bed and dashed to the door to open it. The house keeper asked when were were checking out and it wasnt even 9 am yet! Check out is noon...Called room service a few times for towles, coffee, food and they were not very quick but that was ok. There was only one large mirror in the room and its not in the bathroom. There was no electrical outlet near the mirror and I needed one for my hair dryer and curling iron. I called room service and they brought an extention cord right up. That was pretty cool. The beds are comfy and thats a huge deal for me. My next stay will be at another hotel but it was cool to stay at this famous place. Once is good enough for me :)

Reviews.Title: “A MIXED BAG”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: I'm very mixed about my stay here. The plusses: great location, nice food, a nice pool scene (before 10pm and then it's populated with stupid hipsters), good bedding, it's a grand historic hotel and the staff was courteous overall (especially considering they're all hip 20 something wannabes!). The negatives: outrageously expensive and rude valet service, a real mix of guests, many of whom are d-listers and trashy partiers, dinged up furnishings in the room and it's a bit overpriced. I would likely not stay there again but would recommend it for a one night stay on a weekday, when it's much calmer.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Experience with some issues”
Reviews.Author: j_kis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mom and 2 sisters for 3 nights. Hotel is in a great location, right on Hollywood Blvd, with many restaurants in walking distance. We did not have any bad issues with the staff at check-in as other reviewers have complained about. They were actually very helpful and polite, as was all the staff we encountered at the hotel. Our only complaints for this hotel was that there was a private party going on for 2 days at the pool for the labor day weekend from day to night. Only 2 guests from each room can go if they paid $20 per day. Not fair when you are more than 2. Had I known prior to booking that the hotel pool would be off limits I would have opted to stay elsewhere. I have heard this happening before at this hotel and I think that they should post this on their website when not all ammenities will be available to guests during their stay. I think it is unacceptable. We pay for the room expecting to be able to use all facilites that they have to offer unless they are out of order. My other compaint is that the shower leaks all over the bathroom because there is no shower curtain, but only a glass barrier that does not reach the corner walls. By the end of your shower you have a puddle of water all over. This too has been noted in other reviews on tripadvisor and I do not understand why the hotel has not bothered to fix this problem. Besides those 2 complaints our stay was pleasant enough. The hotel is beautiful, our room was clean and the staff treated us well.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: JAus_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in January, our second time staying here and word of advice -GO ELSEWHERE! Great location if you are looking to be on Hollywood Blvd - however my advice is stay at the Renaissance Hollywood/Highland opposite - nice staff, great rooms and cheaper. Anyway back to the Roosevelt, the main thing that lets this hotel down is the RUDE unwelcoming staff, especially on the front desk. The beds are comfortable, however the bathroom is far too tiny and the walls are paper thin - beware! Also they hold money on your credit card for each night you stay there which is meant to be put back on yuor card within 3 days. Got back to Australia and 2 weeks later it still hadn't been put back up meaning i had to make numerous long distance phone calls to try abd rectify it extremely frustrating! Travelling to L.A regularly this hotel has definitely lost me as a customer. I recommend the Mondrian and Sunset Tower on W Sunset Blvd, the Renaissance as previously mentioned, and i will be staying at the London West Hollywood in 2 weeks so fingers crossed it lives up to the hype and has great customer service!

Reviews.Title: “COOL HOTEL BUT BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: erica,esq
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself has a very cool ambiance - almost too cool. The staff seems to be composed of 20 something year old actor wannabes. I often felt that I was inconveniencing them with any requests (probably wasting their time from which they could otherwise be self obsessing or discussing their latest head shots). I had a pair of subscription sunglasses mysteriously disappear from the pool bar. All my requests to please look in the lost and found were denied. I was simply told that no sunglasses were found at that specific time or at that specific location. This clearly would preclude the possibility of the sunglasses either being turned in at a different time or found at a different location. As I have a strong disbelief that there is a market for stolen one year old prescription glasses, I am sure the glasses are still at the hotel (most likely in the lost and found) but the staff is otherwise too preoccupied to retrieve them. Of course, the other possibility is that the hotel attracts unsavory visitors that would stoop to the level of stealing used prescription glasses. I'm from NYC, by the way, so it's not that I am naive as to the possibility of theft - just don't comprehend it in the area of used glasses. Either way, I would have been better off staying someplace else where at which guests are appreciated and staff can take the time to accommodate them. Hotel stay ended up costing me the price of having to replace the glasses; almost two times as much as the cost of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Hollywood …..”
Reviews.Author: jbwilkins
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there over the Labor Day weekend and yes there was a pool party every night, but it didn’t bother us (and we’re hardly 25) and while the other post are accurate; small rooms/bathrooms, it’s what you get with a hotel built back in the 20’s. The staff was gracious, met our every request, and left us wanting for nothing. It was expensive, but that comes with the location. I do agree that this place is for tourist and the younger set…definite not a business friendly property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great party scene, but paying for history not luxury and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Peppermintpatty2
Reviews.Content: Although classed as a luxury hotel, it isn't, the rooms are very small(postage stamp strings to mind!) and the standard is not high quality( badly stained carpets-not pleasant to live with), but thats not what your paying for. The hotel clearly invests more in the local party scene for which it has a good reputation, than the hotel guests.If you are looking for somewhere quiet-forget it! From Tuesday thro to Sat there is a party in the pool area every night which you can hear from the rooms until 2am! The pool area is lovely, but again, unless you have a penchant for loud music and scantily clad kids , for get it! This place is like designer clothing, you pay for the name but that doesn't always mean you get the best. That certainly is the case with this hotel which clearly survives on it's long gone historic reputation. However , it wasn't all bad, unlike others we didn't have any problems with the staff, who were friendly, helpful and pleasant. I found the bouncers a little over enthusiastic and didn't get the point of them at all?!! I personally wouldn't return there, my advise: If you want a quiet hotel, surrounded by quality and class ,avoid like the plague. However, if you want to party all day and night with under 25's..... go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: callycasey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two days mid August as part of our honeymoon. We had two weeks in Mexico and two in the USA. We spent two nights at this hotel and thought it was an ideal location for exploring Hollywood. The reception staff were very accommodating and upgraded us, as soon as they heard that we were on our honeymoon. Our room was very comfortable and clean. The bathroom,however, was very tiny and nothing special. The concierge was particularly helpful with restaurant recommendations and local information. He booked a wonderful Italian restaurant in Santa Monica and even surprised with desserts with compliments of the hotel at the end of the meal. You have to pay for valet parking, which is quite expensive but a very good service. To be honest everywhere in Hollywood seems to have this parking, so you don't have much choice. I think that we paid 30 dollars a day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool scene but rooms could use an update”
Reviews.Author: laker_girl007
Reviews.Content: I live and work in the Los Angeles area, but thought that I'd stay in a hotel during the weekend of my birthday to create a small "mini-vacation". I've been to The Roosevelt on many occasions for their poolside events, so I figured that the rest of the hotel must be just as nice. Sadly, I was disappointed with the room - especially at the price we paid per night. We were told that we were given an "upgrade" to a recently remodeled room. The bathroom was tiny and had no ventilation. Television was very small and oddly enough in this recently remodeled room wasn't even a flat screen. Nonetheless, the staff was very pleasant, the lobby and common areas were beautiful and the beds were large and comfortable. I enjoyed the pool area during the day as it was very relaxing. Drinks and appetizers were quite over-priced though. $18 for a drink is a bit much. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone that doesn't mind spending a little more for something less fancy, but wants a good place to relax in the heart of Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hollywood Party Hotel”
Reviews.Author: verecy
Reviews.Content: I was a little cautious reading so many bad reviews on this hotel but was relieved to be fully satisfied with my stay. First off GREAT location right on hollywood blvd. across the street from the chinese theatre and many shopping locations. The hotel parking is 30 dollars but I got around that by parking in the parking structure on sycamore street..it was only 8-16 dollars for overnight (2 days). As far as the hotel itself great place to impress a date definitely more of a hip younger crowd around, nice spacious lobby to hangout with a classy bar close and a pool bar outside. I recommend the cabana room with garden view, not poolside or balcony. The room had 2 beds 1 outside 1 inside very nice, overall VERY IMPRESSED

Reviews.Title: “Forget It”
Reviews.Author: JakiBuie
Reviews.Content: I would avoid this hotel If you are really looking for a swanky place to party. Upon arrival this place was packed with hollywood kids just hanging aorund the lobby looking for someone famous to walk in. SO ANNOYING! When we got to the desk they didn't have our room ready - we waited 45 mins before we got in. We got one of the cabanna rooms near the pool and to get to our room there was no regular hallway to go around, we had to pull our own luggage across the pool area to get to our room. It took us about 20 mins just to maneuver around people with our luggage. Now when entering the room I was expecting much more glam in the rooms. The sheets smelled horrible of alcohol and smoke, our shower was dirty and the room was so loud all night long. They had failed to mention that the DJ at the pool area plays until 3 in the morning - so If you are going to sleep any earlier than 3am avoid the pool rooms. Room service was completely over rated, small portions and big prices. Bring your own water because its 10 dollars a bottle. We ended up checking out early because of how low grade the room was and how snoty and rude the staff was. Unless you are Paris Hilton, Justin Timberlake, or Madonna, don't expect to be treated with any respect by staff or vacation goers. In a nut shell its overrated, not worth the money, and should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you like that sort of thing”
Reviews.Author: hellokitty30
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Hollywood Roosevelt during our 3 week honeymoon in the USA. As others have mentioned in their reviews, this hotel is very 'sceney' so if you are not expecting this, I imagine it would leave a negative impression. On the first eveing, many parts of the hotel were closed off for a wedding which looked beautiful. When we arrived the valet parking attendants were attentive and the bell boy took care of our bags. Check in was quick and painless. We had booked a Cabana room - garden view. The hallways are very dark and there was an odd smell which seemed to come from the bar area. The room was a good size and nicely furnished. On our first evening (Saturday night), we decided to eat in the burger bar which was very good and then we went to the Tropicana bar. I think you would either love this or hate it. If you don't like that sort of scene, I would not recommend hanging around the pool area. We had a couple of drinks (yes, it is expensive) and took ourselves off to our room. On the second evening, we went back to our room, were getting ready for bed when suddenly I became very aware of an extra guest of the cockroach variety in our room. After a comic chase around with the bin, we called down to reception. They did send someone up very quickly who asked if it was vermin (!!) and moved us to a poolside cabana. To be fair, they were very good dealing with this although I was a little traumatised! Overall, we liked the hotel - very atmospheric in the old lobby, lovely pool and cool bar area but I think you would need to consider carefully if this is the sort of thing you want. We were only in LA for 2 days so wanted something quite, well, LA! If you want this, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel at all costs!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: amy1610
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel i have ever stayed in not worth a dime! 1) upon arrival hotel was buzzing with underage hollywood morons taking up the space in the lobby. No ramp for luggage or bell boy on hand to help out. staff were uninterested and unhelpful making us feel surplus to requirement. 2) our room was situated on the 5th floor along what i can only describe as a dark alleyway (like a scene from ghostbusters!) this room was filthy the carpets were all stained the bathroom could have been painted by a five year old. The fixtures and fittings were absolutley appauling ikea could of done a better job! this room was very very noisy you could hear the noise from the nightclubs outside the revving of cars in the carpark and of course the young wannabe idiots who'd located themselves in any free seat at the hotel entrance. To add to this the air con broke in the middle of the night and made a hideous churning noise, even though it was switched off! After much deliberation from both a maintenece man and unhelpful receptionists at 4am we were upgraded to a 3rd floor studio! ( i would rather have slept on the roof than this room it was even worse then the first!) 3) THE STUDIO!!! IF YOU ARE THINKING OF PAYING FOR THIS SORT OF ROOM DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!! This room was hideous again filthy carpets ,a crap bed, fixtures and fittings were worse than the first room. The only difference between this room and the first was a sofa and a room with an ironing board! The noise in this room was unbearable whatever goes on underneath seriously needs to be sorted out each night i was kept up until after 4am by banging (people also get banged above!) what noise i can only describe as the dragging of coathangers across a metal bar. this noise is continuous and really loud. 4) the lifts are a waste of time always full and take ages. the pool is full of high class idiots who have nothing better to do in their hollywood wannabe lifestyle than sip martinis by the pool whilst annoying other guests. Staff have no interest in the guests at this hotel it is more intersted in accomodating people who visit on a regular basis. Staff shouldnt take themselves so seriously if they took there heads from other peoples arses they might actually see sunlight although i doubt it since the hotel only has 5watt lightbulbs at best. Seriously people if you are considering this hotel then really think about it its not luxurious or relaxing its a bloody nightmare. If you fit in with the hollywoood morons then you will be fine and love it all other normal people avoid at all cost, try the renaissance in highland across the road a much better hotel by far!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at Best”
Reviews.Author: NJHockeyMom26
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Roosevelt Hotel , nothing more than an okay place to stay. The rooms are small and all seemed to have the smell of cigarette smoke . The location is great if you want to be right on Hollywood Blvd across from the Chinese Theater and all the trash that this location brings out. Beware valet charges you $30 a day to park your car and you have to give them plenty of notice to fetch your car, although there will be several attendants standing around with nothing to do. 25 has great burgers other than that we did not eat at this hotel. The pool was fine there wasn't much of a scene there during our stay. Seems to be that young locals like to walk or shall I say strut around the pool and bars acting as if they are someone very important(when they are no one in particular).On a positive note the shining star of this hotel are solely there concierge staff . They are attentive and very professional . They helped us out in several situations and had great recommendations for us . All in all I would not return here...the Thompson Hotel chain can do so much better than this mediocre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: alfver
Reviews.Content: Reasons NOT to stay here: 1) Rude, unhelpful staff 2) Ridiculously small, DIRTY rooms (ew!) 3) Will overcharge your credit card 4) Manager doesn't care 5) Noisy!!!!!!!!!!! 6) Broken appliances and furniture 7) 4 star?????? Dont think so!!! 8) For the price, your better off going elsewhere!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: mesh4321
Reviews.Content: service is soo bad staff do not know what is going on i will never stay there or reccommend it t anyone again... the hotel is just a name for the stars literally the the worst i have been to... WARNING NEVER WASTE YOUR MONEY AT THIS HOTEL STAY AT THE $ SEASONS OR HOLIDAY INN

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and Glam”
Reviews.Author: dawdler1
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is amazing. I usually stay at The Standard downtown, but they were all booked up this trip. I had been itching to try the Hollywood Roosevelt for awhile now, and they did not disappoint. *Just so you have a bit of background on me, I am not a "hipster". I like hotels with style and personality. I don't drink or party (out of all the times I have been to The Standard - never once visited the famed rooftop bar). I used to work in hotel management and I am very picky about service. That being said, I am a little iffy about these online review sites. If I am having a terrible stay, I prefer to take it up with the hotel management directly, at the time of service, instead seething about it later. But if a hotel is truly great, I do think they deserve a public shout-out. My public shout-out to The Roosevelt is as follows: First and foremost, the hotel is simply gorgeous, a true balance of old and new California. There is a lot of history to this place, and they did a great job of preserving the historical aspects and sprucing it up at the same time. The courtyard-like lobby is stunning. Our room was perfect, clean, comfy, cozy. Loved the Kiehl's products in the room. Because we didn't dine or drink at the hotel, I cannot speak to the service in the restaurant or bars. The front desk, bellmen, valet, and housekeeping were all superb however. Warm and welcoming but not too stuffy. The front desk helped with my many queries and were quite friendly and knowledgeable. This frequent traveler will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Pretentious Staff, Crappy rooms”
Reviews.Author: idontwaitinline
Reviews.Content: I recommended the Roosevelt to a friend who was in town and coming to LA for the first time. The main reason was the location, in that we could walk to everything, also because I wanted to hang around the pool all day, and go to Teddy's at night. The front desk staff were ridiculously rude and full of attitude when we attempted to check in early, so we went to the pool, where the hostess gave us a hard time getting in, and then some guy in a Fedora hat with a little spiral notebook informed us we were not likely to get poolside chairs until 4 p.m. as they were all booked (despite the fact that nobody appeared to be sitting in them). The hostess promptly seated us at the worst table available, which was right next to a bad speaker that was blaring Bon Jovi. The clientele around the pool were total skanks, many of them topless to show off their silicone, I suppose. They appeared to be understaffed that day and it took an hour or longer for the server to bring drinks (which were $16 each). If you're going to spend $400 to hang out by a pool all day, you expect better service. Then we get into our room, which had only 2 towels for the three of us, a bathroom that was so tiny when you sat on the toilet your knees hit the wall, nail polish stains on the carpet, and a smoke detector hanging out of the ceiling by its wires (and we're told this was an upgrade). We showed up at Teddy's at around 1:30 a.m., and were told that we weren't "on the list." I explained we were hotel guests, and we were still turned away. Considering we paid to stay at the hotel, and that there was only a half hour left until the bar closed, I called the front desk to complain and was told by the gentleman who answered, "Just because you're a guest doesn't guarantee entry into Teddy's...that's just the way it is..." Subsequently went to the Beverly Wilshire the next night, which is a MUCH nicer hotel, and was treated like royalty by the staff there - and they actually DO have something to be pretentious about!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service from self-serving staff.”
Reviews.Author: StringStrummer
Reviews.Content: Always wanted to try this hotel during one of my concert trips down to Hollywood. Checked in before heading to the venue and found the air conditioner did not work. Went back to the front desk, explained I was in a hurry and asked if I could have another room. The clerk told me I could not be moved to another room and she would send a maintenance man by. Maintenance came by was able to get it running-great except I ended leaving a half hour behind schedule! Went to the valet station to get my car, took over 20 minutes to get my car. The original valet held my keys and then passed them off to someone else. Evidentally he didn't think musicians tip! The night after the show I checked out and it took another 20 minutes to get my car. Three other parties that came after me had their cars brought before mine. The room was nothing to write home about and the service was terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: JohnW98
Reviews.Content: ﻿We read the mixed reviews about the hotel before booking our stay. Unfortunately, the negative reviews were correct. We stayed in a Deluxe room with two queen beds. The air conditioner was incredibly noisy. When we spoke to the front desk about the noise, they replied, “sir, we’re an older hotel”. They did not offer Maintenance and/or a different room. The beds were comfortable, however they are made with only a bottom sheet and duvet. When we requested a top sheet, the housekeeper brought up two sheets and handed them to us (never offering to put on the bed). We ate at one of their restaurants. The food was very good but the service was very poor. After we were seated, a server did not come to the table for over 15 minutes. When he finally arrived, I mentioned our unhappiness of the wait, and he replied “don’t make an issue about the wait with him, he just got on shift”. Yet, he delivered the drink order and took the food order for the table next to us (who were seated after us). I frequently stay in the Hollywood area and know that the Roosevelt was closed for some time while they renovated. They should have spent more money on guest room renovations, and need to invest time/money in customer service training. If not, they may be forced to close again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Emilion276
Reviews.Content: We are quite well travelled and generally don't complain much as we understand different places offer different things and we have to try and fit in for the duration, but this hotel was very poor. We travelled here in November last year, this was the last leg of our 3-part honeymoon, what can I say .... it was a let down, looked nothing like the pictures I'd seen, the room was cramped and you could only just walk around the edge of the bed without bruising your legs !! The staff in the hotel weren't very helpful and seemed impatient, however, the bellboys were really nice in comparison. We felt that the hotel didn't have much to offer, overpriced restaurant ($70 for burgers, fries & beer for us both) and really dingy inside. Outside the hotel the touters became quite aggressive if you refused their trips to the movie stars homes, it became intimidating - thank heavens for the chance to escape to Universal Studios !! Having had a brilliant time in San-Fran & Vegas this left a bitter taste and really put a sad end to what had been a fantastic honeymoon .... never again.

Reviews.Title: “Third Time Not A Charm!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieS29
Reviews.Content: We have tried to give the Roosevelt three chances in the last year to prove that they can provide a professional and pleasant stay that corresponds with their location and history....and they have disappointed us for the last time. From the uninformed girl trying to check us in at the front desk to the lack of service at the pool (including an apparently loopy server who kept trying to give us other tables orders) to the room change occurring at 2am after several requests to the front desk because of excessive noise - it seems as though the staff and management is intent on pushing their guests to the edge and riding on their so-called reputation. We travel extensively and have stayed at several other comparable hotels in the Hollywood area. None have treated us with such unprofessionalism and basic lack of interest. We also sent an email to their corporate office over a week ago and at least they didn't disappoint or surprise us.....absolutely no response. Why should they change now??

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Weecathy
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, everything about it, it had such an authentic classy feel, the lobby is stunning and the staff very nice. The location is perfect just opposite the Chinese Theatre. The hotel is a tourist attraction in itself. The poolside bar is lovely, and at the weekend attracted the "It" crowd, but it was fun to see how the LA lifestyle seems to be. The rooms very clean and maid service excellent. Bathroom a little on the small side, and some aspects of the room, carpet for example could be doing with renewal. Internet connection 10 dollars for 24 hours. The hotel restuarant was nice, lovely steak and the prix fixe menu for 40 dollars for 3 courses represented good value for money in comparision to other top class hotels in the area, in the Bev Wilshire for example this would hardly buy you lunch. Hotel is very near to Metro station and the Hollywood Highland Centre its ideally located. I would definitely stay here again if need be, but I wouldnt be returning to LA in a hurry, give me NYC anyday!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a little pricey, but close to everything you want!”
Reviews.Author: LegsyFamily
Reviews.Content: First complaint was our concierge didn't know how to help us to get an international line out to Australia, so that was quite irritating, however his replacement, a lovely woman, redeemed them all by recommending the loveliest restaurant, and then securing us a booking there that evening. The hotel was groovy, the room was clean and fresh with beautiful Kiehn's bath products, the barman at the lobby bar was fun and friendly and the diner at the front of the hotel served scrumptious food! We didn't have a celebrity spotting this time, but we'll definitely stay again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and trendy!”
Reviews.Author: jenniesarina
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really big and has a trendy interior. We loved eating our breakfast in lounge chairs by the pool. The location is perfect if you want to get to tourist places. The only minus was the loud night club in the hotel that was open until 3 am, and was so hip that we couldn't get in.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool but bad service as mentioned by most!”
Reviews.Author: JO-RY22
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 4 nights and found the overall experience OK. Luckily we only paid around $140 a night which was refelected in the room we were given! The room was tiny and resembled nothing of the photos online. We were really keen to get into some clubs whilst in L.A. so we asked the concierge to put our names on the list...she proceeded to say she couldn't guarantee we would get in so didn't even try to help us. I'M SORRY but if we are staying at a good hotel the concierge is supposed to help you with these things. I must point out that this is the female concierge not the male concierge who was lovely. She should not be in the job if she can not help us and not get over herself!!! The pool was awesome which made up for the whole experience. The location is perfect for great bars, restaurants and sightseeing. The valet staff were the most helpful in the whole hotel. The girls on reception also need to get over themselves. I think they really need to look at their staff if they want to survive....at the end of the day the hotel is on sale all over the internet so they can't be doing that well. I would reccommend this hotel again for it's pool and location but just don't expect to be 'looked after' and only book through sites like Travelocity and Ebookers.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HospitalityPros
Reviews.Content: No complaints whatsoever. We had a cozy room with a view of the Hollywood sign and downtown area. Great service by staff, valet parking and a reasonable room rate. Lot's to do and see within walking distance of the property. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for Nothing!”
Reviews.Author: Fearghas
Reviews.Content: WARNING: The customer service in this hotel is dreadful! In the time it took the bell man to bring my things to my room he managed to lose my glasses from my jacket. I noticed they were missing the next day but it was too late as I was at the airport about to board a plane. When I called the hotel they explained that the bell man had located them and that they would be posted to me. They never arrived and when I complained, a front of house manager all but accused me of fabricating the story to try to extort compensation from the hotel. Indeed the bellman in question denied having ever lost, found or posted my glasses. Strange indeed. I then complained to the general manager and I've been given a free night's accommodation for my trouble - yeah right, like I'm ever going back to this kip. The common areas of the hotel are dark, dark, dark - the restaurant was permanently empty, although the burger bar is quite nice. The pool is a bit Butlins circa 1960 and unbelievably is supposed to be a glamourous hang out. Whatever! The Kodak Theatre is directly across the street and I chose this hotel as I was going to see a show there. The mini bar in the room is imaginative, quirky and fun and the rooms are much nicer than the common areas might lead you to believe, in fact they are very comfortable with great bathrooms. If you have a fetish for being treated badly then this place is right up your alley!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, but a bit overpriced and staff can be hit or miss as far as attitude”
Reviews.Author: Terpsfan72
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt four times now (my only four trips to LA area) and I dig the whole vibe from the hotel, but I do think it's a bit overpriced. My last trip I stayed in cabanna room...which I wouldn't recommend. The pool is a cool spot but despite them saying I have full access to the pool while staying in the cabanna I was kept away for almost an entire day and night of my three day stay because of a "private" part. Well I believe one of my nights should have been free or at the very least discounted since you pay a premium price to stay around the pool. I'd suggest getting one of the 700 sq ft one bedroom suites or one of the 500 sq ft studio suites. I stayed in the one bedroom suite in july of 07 and had a much better expeirence 2 summers ago. I'm coming to LA again this July but am seriously thinking about staying somewhere else this year. Just can't justify the price for a 3.5 star hotel. I'd recommend this hotel a friend but with some reservations such as price and the hit or miss staff. Some can be very nice and easy to deal with while some are total snobs or just plain jerks. If you stay here they have a decent burger joint. Hotel is NOT FOR FAMALIES!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: mamachev
Reviews.Content: My daughter decided she wanted to stay at the Roosevelt Hotel for her birthday this year instead of having a party. We live in Hollywood, so it was a nice walk to the hotel. I remember the Roosevelt prior to its major renovations. They did a really nice job. The hotel has an elegant feel and you experience it as soon as you step into the open lobby area (upstairs from the front desk). The rooms are small. Although the upgrades have done the rooms justice, it's still an old hotel. Our bathroom was tiny. The shower took up most of the space. There was a little mold in the shower, but other than that the rest of the place was clean. The hotel has two restaurants. We didn't eat at either, although I have eaten at 24/7. Great burgers, fries and wine. The pool scene was interesting. It almost seemed as everyone there was a smoker. Being a non-smoker, we didn't stay very long. My daughter really enjoyed the pool. It's definitely not a family oriented environment. A bit over the top in my opinion. If you're into the "Hollywood Scene" then you might enjoy. Considering I live right in Hollywood, I could do without. We ordered food and drinks by the pool which was very good. A little pricey, but comparable to any other property. The service was good. Front desk service was good. Requested a room with a view of Hollywood Blvd. When we got to the room, most of the view was of a rooftop with a partial Blvd. view. The girl at the desk was accommodating in changing our room for a better view (there were no other rooms available with a Blvd view). Overall, the experience was good. My daughter had the best time and that's what counted. For visitors that come into town, I would most likely have them stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Expected a bit more but definitely a cool vibe”
Reviews.Author: Babenoname
Reviews.Content: I expected a little more knowing what I know of the history past and current of this hotel. Once you get over the somewhat seedy location of the hotel and find your way in the lobby's cool vibe hits you. My room was a very far walk back and you can easily get lost in the hallways. The rooms are a bit cold (unfriendly) and very basic. I was a little disappointed but there is something about the hotel that would make me return.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay in an historic hollywood hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vodcal
Reviews.Content: we booked the hollywood roosevelt for 2 nights to explore hollywood in a quick amount of time. we arrived and our car was valet parked very promptly. we were welcomed by many staff and checked in immediately despite arriving a few hours early. our room was lovely with views over the walk of fame, the chinese and kodak theatre and the hollywood sign visible too. the corridors had pictures of hollywood stars and films from past and present. the lobby was beautiful and grand with a variety of leather chairs, couches and daybeds. the food in the diner was lovely and the cocktails were fab - as was the service from the friendly staff. the hotel is directly on the walk of fame and virtually opposite the chinese theatre and kodak theatre. there are shops and bars nearby, though we didn't leave the hotel at night so couldn't comment on how safe the area is at night. the pool was lovely and you could imagine Marilyn Monroe and the likes lounging around it both n the day and at night. the bar by the pool had fire-pits to keep you warm in the evening whilst having a drink. we were lucky enough to be there whilst a boxing promotion was on as we got to see mickey rourke and mark wahlberg in the hotel! if you're looking for a hotel with a feel of old hollywood with all the mod cons, then book this place. we were glad we didn't book a travel lodge or other motel as it wouldn't have been the same.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and pretentious - celebrity hot spot”
Reviews.Author: Clioontour
Reviews.Content: I should say straight off that I'm still smarting from ordering from room service - a salad with a side of fries and fruit juice which came to $60. (For one). Other amenities (laundry, valet parking etc) similarly over-priced. The room was a little shabby and had no coffee facilities, but clean and with a view of the Kodak theatre (where the Oscars are held), the Hollywood sign and with the stars on the pavement outside. If spotting celebs is your thing and you want to do 'Hollywood' LA this may be your place, but I found the staff distant, bordering on rude, and - as I said - I'm still hurting over that salad. If room service etc isn't important to you, I'd advise the Beverly Laurel Motel every time.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, stand-offish staff, made to feel extremely uncomfortable!!”
Reviews.Author: needanotherholiday43
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and 3 of our children aged 15, 13 and 7 stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of August 2008. Our check-in clerk seemed to be more interested in helping everyone else as well as us and so check-in took over an hour as our rooms were also not ready although we were there at 4.30 pm. One of our rooms was no better than a box and only just big enough for the bed. The hotel decor is very dark and the corridors appear even smaller because of this. I went once with the children to the pool, we only wanted to swim as we were off the the Teen Choice Awards later that afternoon, the member of staff at the pool looked us up and down and we were told that we would have to wait for a lounger, when told we didn't want to 'lounge' just swim they found us a stool to put our over clothes and room key, the pool was almost empty although all loungers were full and although my children are very well behaved we were almost sneered at by other guests and staff, we were not even given a towel, so we dripped back through the hotel. Extremely uncomfortable and we have never felt like this at any other hotel, and we have stayed at quite a few and all 4 or 5 stars. I realise that the hotel cannot be held responsible for the people hanging around outside but homeless people with trolleys is not what I was expecting, and some of the unsavoury characters made us feel very uncomfortable. I would only recommend this hotel if you are of the young and beautiful set!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hollywood Experience”
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying at the Roosevelt after reading some of the other reviews. I was hoping I'd be one of the people with a good experience, and I was. The young and very polite person who checked me in assigned me a room on the 12th floor (I booked my room through Priceline.) I had a view of the Hollywood sign and Graumann's Chinese Theater. The décor was contemporary – a bit cold, but the room was very spacious. The bed was comfortable. I had no problem with noise from other rooms. I did get cigarette smoke seeping into my non-smoking room from the bathroom vent, though. It's true the bathroom has a red light right over the sink. But you can turn it off. I agree with other posts -- the lighting in the bathroom is not great for putting on makeup. And, I see what other people mean about the shower not having a full enclosure to prevent water from getting on the floor. But if you shower carefully (not uncomfortably carefully, just with some awareness) you won't have a problem. The hotel is very cool. You really feel like you're in Hollywood. Most people I saw there were young and hip. I did see a few more mature people like myself, though, so I didn't feel out of place. I didn't see any ghosts, but I did think of them when I was alone in the elevator or walking to my room in the dark hallway! The pool is beautiful, especially at night with lights twinkling and fire pits burning. The neighborhood is great for tourists – I saw Tom Bergeron filming at Graumann's, Kevin James filming on the Walk of Fame, and The Rock at the premier of Race to Witch Mountain at the El Capitan theater. I also attended a screening of an independent movie at the Egyptian Theater where Bruce Dern was part of a Q&A session after the show. All of these took place right down the street. I had a great L.A. experience staying at the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “The”
Reviews.Author: SoCalGirl112
Reviews.Content: We were closed off to these advertised "Amenities": Teddy's (bar) and the historic lobby (seriously!) due to a private party- which we were not informed of prior to arriving. Wow - how can a hotel guest be told they could not use these major parts of the hotel?!?!? Night manager told us to "go to another club". Wow, that was unreal. This hotel advertises a cool vibe and great personal service but we saw nothing of that! We actually checked out at 10:30 PM, it was that unfun. We felt quite misled by the Thompson Group's website and it's other advertising. Room service food was very dissappointing and took twice as long as stated. Room was not that clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for LA!”
Reviews.Author: a_lee_nyc
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in LA and staying at the Roosevelt was extremely convenient. It's right across the street from Grauman's Chinese Theater and down the street from other tourist attractions. Also close to excellent restaurants. The staff was really helpful (found us a charger for BB and phone) and helped us with different restaurant ressies (one night they messed up but more than made up for it). It seems to be quite recently renovated and there are Khiels products in the bathroom but no moisturizer (which you desperately need if you're coming from the east coast to west coast). Room service was fast even on NYE. We were there for NYE party which was good but seems like they should have had a couple hours of open bar for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Hollywood Experience”
Reviews.Author: hawnsteeldoc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Hollywood . It was the first time since my wife and I were kids (30+ years) that we had been in that area of Los Angeles. The whole time they were gearing up for the Academy Awards. By the time we left , they had closed off the street in front of the Kodak and Grauman's Chinese Theatres. Overall , we had a good experience at the hotel. It's a classic , old architecture jewel to be sure and situated in the middle of the Hollywood experience . There's lots of funky activity going on with the street performers and urchins. It's life in the big city after all. With a few exceptions, the service at the hotel was quite good. The guys at the door were extremely helpful and the service and food in the restaurants (steakhouse and hamburger joint) was fine, we thought. The rooms were of adequate size and the maid service was prompt and noninvasive. It does strike you that the hotel is quite dimly lit. We saw no ghosts, but the way. I guess that adds to the charm. One night we accidentally stumbled onto a crossdressing , gay party held downstairs....ooops . No problem. Here are the exceptions: They have to work on some of the help at the front desk. Our receptionist acted like she owned the place, or maybe she was just nominated for best supporting actress? You know the type. No pleasantries at all. We were interrupting her day. Service at the pool was lousy. We couldn't get anyone to come over and take our order, so I stepped up to the bar and was told to go sit back down as the waitress would come over. She never did. We waited . We left. Our shower had this half glass door . No kidding. It doesn't close off the shower stall . It would leak all over the floor whenever we tried to take a shower.... it was like living with a puppy dog.... There was some loud party going on our floor. It woke us up at midnight. It sounded like it was right next door. I tried to call the front desk, but could only get a busy signal. Kept trying , but no luck, until we heard someone knocking loudly on their door, could have been security....only happneed one night. You will have fun at the Roosevelt , especially if you're there to take in all of the funkiness and history of the Hollywood scene.

Reviews.Title: “Most stylish place in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: voyagevoyage028
Reviews.Content: The public rooms--lounge, Dakota restaurant, pool area, etc.--are super stylish and comfortable. What I love about this hotel is that although it has been trendified, modernized, etc. it is not TOO perfect. It has all the charm of the classic old style hotel that it is, but it is not so shiney and slick that it becomes stuffy. The main lounge at night with hundreds of candles flickering away is simply stunning. Also enjoyed the comfortable pool area, bar. Service is correct, and a bit cool which I happen to like. The staff are not obsequeious like you find in too many luxury hotels. They definately will not fawn over you, yet they magically appear when it is time for a new drink, or to take away a finished plate or used towel. The hotel is also great value (I paid $199) and will remain so as the basic architecture of the building and the rooms mean it will never be able to attract the hyper lux crowd who now insist on enourmous bathrooms, rooms, etc. Your room and bathroom will be small. However, I've never sleep in a bed as comfortable as this with a delightful duvet and perfect pillows. And get this, they still give you the option of "Smoking or No Smoking." Truly a "step back in time" experience. This place gets the important stuff right. It is the antithesis of Trump, Wynn, or Helmsley vugarity.

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous hotel in the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: vissi87
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel for 2 nights and was just what we needed after a disappointing stay at Bellagio in Las Vegas (see my other review). The Roosevelt Hotel is a gorgeous historic hotel dating back to 1927 which is superbly located in the heart of Hollywood, situated directly across the street from Grauman's Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre and the Hollywood & Highland Center. The Hollywood walk of fame runs directly in front of the hotel’s front entrance. The port cochere is beautiful with large drapes and palm trees which gives it an almost safari-like appearance. Entering the hotel is like stepping back in time. The woman who checked us in was very welcoming and the whole process was very swift. We were given a room on the 9th floor, however once we got to the room we discovered it had 1 king bed in it when we had booked a twin bedded room. A quick phone call to the lobby was all it took and they changed our rooms immediately. We were moved down to the 4th floor, but the new room we were given was quite a lot larger with two queen beds fitted with quality Sferra linens which made them amazingly comfortable, a large walk in wardrobe and a small but funky bathroom with great Kiehls toiletry products. The room was very spacious, modern and clean. One thing which set this hotel apart from all the others we stayed in on our trip was that the Roosevelt was the only hotel to offer complimentary wireless internet which was fantastic! My only minor complaint with the hotel is that there are only two lifts and they are quite slow which means quite a long wait for a lift, but I understand that this is a very old hotel so I can easily look past that. We visited the pool area once and from what I could see it looked like a very nice place to relax and have a drink. The hotel oozes glamour and is absolutely stunning. The historic lobby is gorgeous and is lit with candlelight (I think they are candlelight light bulbs that give the same effect) which gives it a dark and moody atmosphere. We didn’t end up eating at the restaurant Dakota which is right next to the lobby but it did look very classy. Instead we ate at 25 degrees burger bar which was excellent. Definitely the best burger I have ever eaten! We went back for breakfast the following day and I was equally impressed with their banana and walnut French toast and blueberry pancakes. Overall our stay at the Roosevelt Hotel was nothing short of fantastic. All the staff members were came into contact with were very friendly and accommodating and the hotel itself was gorgeous. I’ll have no hesitation in recommending the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel to anyone planning to stay in the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Celebs and great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: KentBerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Roosevelt for a week,the rooms were ok was smaller than expected although the location was excellent for all the tourist attractions like the Chinese Theatre,Hollywood sign and good transport links around L.A......... The hotel was great for celeb watching,as there was a MTV party at the time.......pool area very lively....night and day....although pool area was closed off most of our stay due to private functions etc... Staff were very helpful and the lobby area was still to it's original.......would def recommend to a friend......

Reviews.Title: “2 Stars at Best”
Reviews.Author: dan57rank
Reviews.Content: Got there Friday night at 10:45pm and room wasn't ready...it took us over an hour to get checked in. I told the clerk the least the hotel could do is buy me a drink ($28 for a draft beer and glass of wine) and she giggled at me (how professional is that?). At one point during my 60 minute check-in the clerk asked me where I was from and when I told her Chicago she made a face and said: "you must be happy to get out of there" (shocker: not EVERONE wants to live in LA, young lady!). The carpet was dirty, the noise from the bar area loud (despite being on the 8th floor), the air conditioning system was loud, the bathroom tiny. Parking was $30 a night. The area of town is run down. I would never stay there again. When I checked out and told them how unhappy I was the young lady said "she'd make a note." Great...thanks a ton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Smasher1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt for 2 nights in January. From the first minute the staff could not do enough for us, from the valet parking guys to the reception. We were given an upgrade on the room to a Junior Suite and really looked after. The hotel itself is in a great location and it is a great base from which to see LA including Beveley Hills & Venice Beach. We had a hire car and it is so easy to get around (recommend you hire a GPS, worth the small fee!) Valet parking is resonable at $30 for 24hrs + tip, but not to many other options around and they really look after you, it is so easy.. The rooms and beds are very comfortable and if you go when the weather is good the pool and pool bar would really be a massive plus..! Overall the hotel and staff were first rate and would really recommend the Hollywood Roosevelt to anyone..!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, except for...”
Reviews.Author: RuckOU
Reviews.Content: The room was fantastic. Great views, great location, spacious, and clean...only problem was that there was a colony of ants in the bathroom around the bottom of the sink. Out of the three rooms we had mine was the only one with ants so it looks like it's probably just the one room and after the maid cleaned the next morning they were all gone. The staff is excellent and the location can't be beat if you're looking to experience Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a fun stay if you'd like to be right in the action in tourist central”
Reviews.Author: genluxx
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business. This was a good place to stay if you want to be right in the middle of the action on Hollywood Boulevard, and by action I mean being able to step outside your hotel and be accosted by Daffy Duck or Spiderman or Pocahontas etc. and have shops right at your door. The hotel is opposite The Chinese Theatre so also puts you somewhere easily reminiscable when watching films as you'll frequently see both the hotel and vicinity on tv and in films. There are a lot of bands and celebrities who stay here so this is another level of action that you may seek out. After getting the chance to drive around lots and see different areas I reckon next time I'll probably rent an apartment by the beach, I tend to prefer more low key quiet chilled places with walking potential, and if this strikes a similar chord this hotel may not be for you. Anyway, the hotel itself was made up of a gorgeous exterior and the same if somewhat dark interior, something I've noticed popular in celebrity haunts, 'all the better not to see you with my dear'. The pool is legendary, the rooms okay. Clean a modern take on the 70's but as they are somewhat small and as the mattress sat in the middle of a larger wooden platform I kept bashing my shins on the corners every time I would walk around it- I still have the scars, so this was somewhat annoying. Good desk, smallish window, dark bathroom with not much light, but all in all it was okay. Meals there very pricey, breakfast, oatmeal fruit and tea plus tip set me back over $45. I couldn't relax very well in the rooms though, and I still don't really know why, there was nothing really wrong with it, and a great walk in closet if you're staying there for a while as I was. Some say the hotel is haunted. Who knows.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller28London
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this summer with our two teenagers and it was perfect. We had a standard room and it was a little small but perfectly alright, everywhere was very clean but the bathroom was a squeeze! Considering its central location, it was very quiet at night. The hotel was in such a central location, literally across the road is the hollywood and highland centre and the chinese theatre. There are also limo tours everywhere for the beverly hills tours and lots of restaurants. The concierge were very helpful and there are 2 free high speed mac computers to use by the reception. The interior of the hotel is very boutiquey and luxurious. The pool area makes you feel like a celebrity with waitresses in tiny shorts bringing you drinks and big sunbed loungers to lie on with palm trees and the sun shining. I used the 24 hour gym a couple of days too and it's small but adequate but doesn't provide water which is a real disgrace! I would definitely stay here again if i came to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay”
Reviews.Author: DenverWing
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt last week for a couple nights on a business trip. The hotel was in a terrific location and had tons of character. The rooms were small, but very warm and well appointed. My only caution on this hotel (especially if you get a good online rate) is all the add-on costs. Parking is vallet only at $28 and all the resturants are pretty pricy. Even packets of coffee in the room come at a cost. I ate most of my meals at nearby establishments; many just steps outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed w/ the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: MidwestBizzyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to my stay at the Roosevelt for a business conference I was attending. The location on Hollywood Blvd., is ideal, with plenty going on around the hotel. The room they initially gave me had an interesting style -- an urban, efficiency apartment feel to it, as I walked through (intentionally) dimly lit hallways with carpeting that mimmicked a brick road. The room had a brick wall interior (still dimly lit-- by design), hardwood floors, and a pavement like (concrete?) floor in the bathroom. The problem was---------- the noise. There wasn't necessarily that much noise, but, because of the (extremely) poor soundproofing of the rooms, ... you could hear very clearly every detail of the conversations in the rooms next to you. It was as if you were sharing a cabin with people you didn't know. When I called the front desk, to ask to have my room changed... they 'played' naive about it, but, I sensed this was a common complaint with guests, in that they quickly ended the charade, and gave me a more conventional room in a different section of the building. That room was indeed quieter, but very, very small. Personally, I'm alright with that. When I opened the door, and walked into the new room, there were two staff members (not housecleaning) that had shocked looks on their faces (guilty looks). They immediately hung up the room phone, and bolted out of my room. I was kind of ticked, and called to make sure there were no charges against my room bill. Because there was limited shelf space and closet space, the housekeeping crew accidently knocked my shaving kit into the toilet when they were cleaning. Rather than fess up to it, they quietyly put it back in it's original location. That evening, when I got back to the room, I reached in, and noticed the thing was saturated with all of my toiletries wet., and items saturated. There was construction going on on the (street) lobby level, so guests needed to take the (only one operating) elevator down to the ground level, and hike back up a set steps to get outside. I know each of these issues sound minor and random, but, my general feeling is that for the price they charge per room, you should expect good customer service and attention to details. At a minimum, a reasonably quiet room would seem like a fair expectation. I wouldn't recommend the Roosevelt... not for the prices they charge. I'm probably going to try the Renaissance the next time I'm in the area. I don't expect everything to be perfect.. I just want a clean and quiet room to stay in, with minimal interruptions. I did not get that.

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevelt Has It All Covered”
Reviews.Author: Louis13
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure staying at the Hollywood Roosevelt last month for a long weekend. I found that the hotel had all aspects of a hip and fun, yet luxurious hotel covered. Having an aversion to anything pretentious, being a fan of historic buildings and given the amentities within the hotel.... I was tempted to never leave. From the super comfortable bed and linens, Kiehls bath products - to the pool, restaurants and bars. Not to mention the helpful, attentive staff. The allure and ambiance of the lobby alone makes you want to stay! When I did leave, the location is unbeatable. Right on Hollywood Blvd with so much within walking distance or a short drive / taxi ride away. Kudos to staff and management for dialing it all in and creating a wonderful experience. I will definitely be returning to the Hollywood Roosevelt when I am in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Atmosphere, Service its all here”
Reviews.Author: Aussies88
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights from Oct 4th. with 3 adult children and 1 teenager. Bathroom small and with no exhaust system became quite steamy but loved the Keihl products, water pressure great. Soft luxurious towels. Room had two amazingly comfortable queen beds with enough room for 3 of us ( other 2 had own room). 4th floor room 414, I think not much of a view, looked over rooftop, if we hadn't been quite so tired( had just flown in from Australia) we may have asked for better view but once we settled couldn't be bothered, although I'm sure they would have accommodated us. Not dark and dingy as made out in some reviews. Contemporary in design. Have read reviews of snooty staff this was not what we found at all. Check in was smooth, initially given room with only one bed but was rectified immediately. My children went to the bars in hotel, we brought various food and drink back and had no problem with security at any stage during our stay as other reviewers have complained about. A movie was being filmed one day of our stay with an enormous amount of equipment but this did not affect us at all. Concierge (Lauren I think) was helpful in organising Limo and with any questions we had. Lobby near main entrance is really old world Hollywood and just beautiful, yes it is dark but that is part of its charm. Location can't be beat right on Hollywood Blvd across from Graumans . Felt safe in this area at night as long as you don't go more than about 5 blocks down. Although my children didn't worry at all and even walked to Sunset at night. Probably not for young children or budget conscious but we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: lizzyb2
Reviews.Content: we chose the roosevelt for its location...directly opposite manns chinese theatre and a stone's throw from the metro. this was a great decision as we only had two days in LA & the hotel was well placed for all the local attractions. we booked directly with the hotel but on arrival ended up with one of the smallest rooms next to the elevators. after 4 hours we decided to ask for another room as the noise was unbearable. this posed no problems and we were promptly moved (luckily to a bigger room, away from the elevators). despite this mishap the hotel had a lot of character...it was very dark but this only added to it's appeal. we ate in 25 degrees...and had a tasty burger lunch (good value & service). room service was pricey - for breakfast we a ate at Mels diner round the corner opposite the metro (fab, retro place open 24 hrs). the hotel had some nice touches e.g. the kiehls products in the bathroom, a turn down service at night and little bottles of m&ms left on your pillow. the only other down side was the bathroom - small but perfectly formed. i'd stay here again - but only for a couple of nights

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: TG1981
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at The Roosevelt! I loved the mediterranean tiles the hotel was decorated in. I really loved the old feel of this hotel. You cannot beat the location! Its on Hollywood Blvd right across from the Kodak & Chinese Theatres. Room was comfortable & I slept very well. The staff was very accomodating and pleasant. A lot of celebrities were walking around the hotel, and I thought that was very cool. No one was paying them any attention, as if it was very normal, which was very cool.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sequin-Sue
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our twenties and were pleased with our choice of the Hollywood Roosevelt for a two-night visit. The location is perfect for exploring Hollywood as it's right opposite the Chinese Theatre. The rooms are very small, but nicely done. For a two night visit the room size wasn't a problem, but it might be an issue if you're planning a longer visit. The bathroom was lovely too with a good supply of products by 'Fresh'. The hotel itself is very dark, but that's part of its ambience. The reception was lovely and the concierge very helpful. We asked the concierge to book us tickets to The Police who were playing at the Bowl that evening - she sorted it all out for us while we went out sightseeing and our booking confirmation was under our door when we got in (although she did spend slighty more than we'd agreed). On our first evening at the hotel there was a pool party which looked fun, but a bit overwhelming after a long day travelling - it was packed full of local rich kids, with music from a live DJ. The pool area is lovely during the day, unfortunately we didn't have enough time to make the most of it. We ate in the restaurant once and found the service very impressive. The food was lovely although there was not a great choice for my boyfriend who is vegetarian. The breakfast place within the hotel is very good too. During our stay there was a limited lift service which was annoying as it meant a long wait each time, but I'm sure that was just temporary. Despite the hotel being rather pricey, its a great place to stay to be in the heart of things.

Reviews.Title: “This is LA!”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Weasel
Reviews.Content: Just what I thought LA would be like. This is a great looking hotel in a great location. Extremely friendly staff. The concierge was a bit too cool for school but helpful to an extent. Hire car was dealt with very well by reception, and free internet in the foyer made getting local info very easy. The room was nice. Not as big as a lot of American hotels but comfy. We only stayed for two nights and as our room was on the third floor on the same level as the flat roof, we were disturbed on both nights by people drinking on the roof until early in the morning. On the second night, a lady actually managed to enter our room! As easy going young guys this was not a major problem, but I can imagine other people having a big problem with this! Ask not to stay near the flat roof! The pool bar area was absolutely great though, and I think my favourite bar in Hollywood. Full of great looking people, great music, all set against a lit pool beneath the hotel sign. Looked very nice. Just sad I didn't drink there every night. Overall, a very nice hotel exlcuding the "disturbances", very friendly beautiful smiley faces everywhere and a great spot to explore Hollywood and Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Big let Down”
Reviews.Author: tellsitlikeitisSpain
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hollywood Roosevelt as a newley wed couple after a four and a half hour journey from the beautiful friendly Ritz Carlton hotel at Lake Las Vegas. We walked into the hotel reception feeling like the Beverly Hillbillies, the staff at reception were cold and unfriendly although the receptionist did give us and upgrade to a cabana (Which he said was overlooking the gardens! and was really overlooking a multistorey carpark with a vine growing up the side of it) The guy who took our bags to the room was friendly he gave us the ins and outs of the place. The hallways were dark, very dark, the cabana room was dark, not as chic as it looks on the website, even with the lights on you need a torch to see in your suitcase. The bathroom was about the same size as the wardrobe and the floor of the room wasnt very clean. All the furniture just looked cheap and tacky not great for the price! We ventured off for a drink (out of the hotel) and luckily we met a nice couple who was also staying in the Roosevelt, after a few drinks we all decided to head back to the Roosevelt and keep on drinking at the Tropicana bar which is at the poolside at the Roosevelt, I had this idea that it would be full of Hollywood glamour and lots of beautiful people but it wasn't. Everyone was dressed casually, very arrogant, rude and pretentious. The hotel was overrun with teenaged kids spending daddy's money. We were made to feel like intruders everytime we wanted to go to our room as the tropicana security staff would stop us and ask us where we were going and check us off their list, even if you had a bottle of water you were asked to get rid of it (BUT IM JUST GOING TO MY ROOM FOR GODS SAKE!) Don't even bother to ask any of the staff about the history of the hotel, because they don't know. Just read it up before you go and educate them while your there. Also don't bother saying hello or smiling at the staff because they just look at you like your off your trolley. The room was noisey all night long, the walls must be paper thin. Loud music, car alarms, talking from the rooms nearby, dont even get me started on the airconditioning unit! Honestly I thought this hotel was going to be chic, sexy elegent, classy, brimming with Hollywood history and Glamour and it was totally the opposite, which is a big shame. The owners of the hotel seriously need to reconsider who they are contracting the leases of the bars to as they are making this hotel a very uncomfortable place to stay. This hotel could be a magic piece of old Hollywood if it was just managed properly. We left after two nights and I couldnt believe that while we were waiting for the car to be brought round for us to leave, the car valet guy told us which room Marilyn Monroe had lived in for two years and it was the room right across from ours. I'd asked the staff several times and no-one knew. I couldnt believe it i had walked past the room several times and the door had been open and I didnt get a proper look. :( Over all a complete let down.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: australian_8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice albeit very dark. The room we were given was very small and as the furniture is all brown it looked even smaller. After a couple of hours in the room I felt myself gettin agitated and couldnt stand being there anymore. The hotel staff were very good and changed our room to a larger one. I was very happy until the pool bar started playing their music and then sleep was out of the question until 2am when it ended. On the 3rd night we decided to go to the pool bar and have a drink and see what it was all about, my husband was then told that he had to change his clothes, he was dressed very smarlty in shorts and shirt but as it was yet another private party it wasn't good enough for them.
