Looking around we noticed that most men were dressed in scruffy jeans and t-shirts but that was ok. Again the noice went on until 2am and then drunken shouts and cars honking for another hour. on our 4th and last night all was quiet and we thought, great we can get to sleep at a reasonable time until, that is, 12.20am when "pass the duchy on the left hand side" blasted from the pool bar, out came the sleeping pills again. And we were on the 7th floor. If thats what you want on your holiday then its a great place, but then who can afford to drink all night at the hotel pool bar, $24 for 2 drinks. Its no use complaining because it goes on deaf ears.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Experience!”
Reviews.Author: MaYBaBeOSU13
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hollywood is a beautiful place to stay, especially if you want to experience the history of it. Marilyn Monroe used to live there in one of the suites above the pool, and she also had her first modeling job at the pool. Many of the old moviestars used to hang out at the hotel for drinks, and it still has that classy feel. The first Academy Awards was also held in one of the meeting rooms there. Rooms: The first night we stayed in the Cabana suite, which was amazing inside. It overlooks the pool, which as other reviews mentioned, does turn into a hotspot at night with fun music and a young crowd. The other nights we stayed in a standard room. It was very nice as well. Soft feather comforter! The only downside is that only the suite had bathroom counter space, so as a girl, it was hard to get ready with just a sink. Pool: The pool is one of the most popular, if not THE most popular, hotel pool in Hollywood. It's surrounded by 50s style suites, pretty palm trees, has wonderful soft lounge chairs/beds, as well as wait staff for food and drinks. The only reason I did not give this hotel a 5 star is because of some rude staff (not all of them, just some). There is a club called Teddy's that very popular, but it turns into a "guest list only" after 10 or 10:30. It is not owned by the hotel, so that's why people can't just get in even if they're staying at the hotel. Most bars/clubs at night are "guest list only" so you have to call during the day to get on the list or go early unless you're with all girls. Overall, this hotel is worth the stay just to experience both old and new Hollywood, and it's so close to everything else in LA. 15 min. from the beach, Beverly Hills, etc. The Kodak Theater with all of the famous gold stars and handprints is across the street. You can also see the Hollywood white letters too. The valet service is very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good - But Pool Turns into Club Scene at Night”
Reviews.Author: heaven911
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 10 day stay at The Roosevelt. I'd heard good reviews from friends but was a little disappointed. I stayed in a regular room with 2 beds overlooking the roof (had a lovely view of the air conditioners). PROS: Bed was very nice -- soft white down comforter and pillows. Front desk and valet staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is great. Restaurants, food and walk of fame etc very close. There is a Longs a block away where you can buy anything you could ever possibly need. CONS: There is a coffee machine in the room but you have to pay 3.50 for the coffee in the mini bar. I've traveled all over the world and don't recall ever seeing that before, is it just me or is that a little ridiculous? Closet was dark due to the dark paint and lack of lighting. Water leaks out the side of the shower so you're guaranteed a pool of water under the sink after every shower. Overall it was a good experience but there is one thing I do want to mention. The pool turns into a club at night and can be a rather nice place to hang out - if you can get past the bouncers. I had no trouble getting in but some of my co-workers did. Despite being guests they were told they needed to be with girls and on another occasion they were told they needed to go change their clothes. Being a hotel guest doesn't guarantee entry or that they'll treat you with respect. So, if you're not in the mood for a club scene, as soon as they put up the velvet ropes avoid the pool.

Reviews.Title: “A Hollywood Classic”
Reviews.Author: gandgturner
Reviews.Content: We've never stayed in Hollywood on a visit to SoCal, so thought we would give it a try. For anyone who appreciates Hollywood as it was this is a must...absolutely gorgeous, excellent service and elegance everywhere. Granted, stepping out the door is like being dropped into a Fellini movie, but, that is why you are here. Hollywood is tacky, trashy, slimey...and thoroughly enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “for somebodies”
Reviews.Author: theschmidthouse
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a great spot in Hollywood (albeit very dark). The bell staff and housekeeping were very helpful and courteous. The reception staff were only interested in you if you were somebody (we weren't). Room small but well fitted out. Beware of the air-conditioning that sounds like a jet taking off and shares the scents of nearby rooms.

Reviews.Title: “All around nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl007
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at this hotel for our first trip to L.A. The hotel itself is very nice but dark everywhere. It's in a great location on Hollywood Blvd, within walking distance to many exciting attractions. We paid extra for a larger room and were disappointed to see how tiny it was. The shampoo and conditioner in the bathroom were really nice but they really need to figure something else out for the shower door, every time we took a shower the entire bathroom floor was covered in water. The lighting in the bathroom was horrible, the lights are red....no good for putting on makeup! Every night there seemed to be a private event at the pool that we were not allowed to go to. I would expect them to at least let paying guests attend!! Don't know what they do about guests in cabanas that have balconys that overlook the pool during these exclusive events. All in all it was nice and clean, I would stay here if the price was right but def. try to get a cabana! Oh and parking is $28 a day a little pricey and it always took them forever to bring me my car...I guess it wasn't nice enough to be in the front!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: Penelope_Keith
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt for 3 nights from 4 Aug 08. The location was really good for tourists without a car. Across the road was the Hollywood & Highland Center which had numerous shops and eateries. There was also a pharmacy and supermarket nearby. The hotel looks very luxurious inside as you would expect for the price (about $279/night + tax). We didn't get to the pool or Tropicana bar. There is a restaurant within the hotel for those wanting more than fast food. The room was fine, but wouldn't want to be any smaller. It had a fridge and well stocked mini bar, which we didn't take advantage of. The bathroom was a bit of a disappointment. It was small, but doable in terms of space, except for the toilet being too close to the wall. This is one of my pet hates along with a passive air vent rather than an electric exhaust fan, so the bathroom fogged up quickly and took a while to de-fog. They provided nice toiletries. Our room looked out over.. a rooftop. Our room also backed on to the elevators and so there was some noise at night when they were used. Other rooms shouldn't have had this issue. If you need a taxi, the valet parking guys have taxis on standby that they call over immediately. I believe they had two standing only internet terminals for guests. Overall, the hotel was fine, but bathroom let it down. Location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Lost Soul”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissShiny
Reviews.Content: My family and I visisted this hotel six years ago and we were disappointed with the changes when we re-visited in June. The historical lobby is no longer the main entrance and is very dingy and dark. All the historical material and the piano has been removed so it feels soulless. When private parties are held at the hotel, residents are not allowed to use the Hollywood Boulevard entrance, the lobby, the pool or the gym. When we arrived after being up for nearly 24 hours, we had to prove we had a reservation before we were allowed on to the premises. They seemed to be more interested in the celebrities than their hotel guests. Non residents are allowed to use the pool which regularly means there is no where to sit. Also, you are not allowed to eat your own food there as they have a small restaurant which serves food and drink. The gift shop appears to be stocked with "fashionable items" which are very expensive and are not for the regular tourist. The hotel prides itself on the fact that the Oscars were held there but you would be hard pressed to see any evidence. The air conditioning was very loud and would keep light sleepers awake. On a positive note, the room we stayed in was very clean and the position of the hotel is excellent for visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevelt Hotel-SPA”
Reviews.Author: ljubalassala
Reviews.Content: Had one main issue- THE SPA. The massages were a total rip-off!!!! three one hour sessions totaled to $600!!! What they call the spa garden is located right next to the busy streets. How is one suppose to relax when you can hear the traffic as clear as if you were on the sidewalk. I do not recommend it!!! save your money and go to a real spa... The rest was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel ....worst ever and I`ve seen bad”
Reviews.Author: neal1260
Reviews.Content: Shocked the rooms have a door connecting to the room next door with no sound proofing and believe me you can even hear a whisper. The first night was respectable guests next to us trying their best to whisper the second night was a couple having sex. The manager can close the pool and parts of the hotel for private functions so tough if your stay falls then but you do get a photocopied letter. As a guest you are a number not a guest, you will not be back but the room will be filled tomorrow attitude . Two nights with constant sleep disturbance ruined our time in the day to see sights as we didn`t have the energy. At todays standards it would be a UK three star rating...just half the price and it still wouldn`t be worth the stay it survives by name and location which incidently we thought has seen its day and now the area is run down and seedy. Never again. Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: sleepymiami
Reviews.Content: stayed at hotel november 2007 and june 2008. great location, but attitude staff below average my first trip. because of location i chose to stay when i was back in LA in june. the personal service has really picked up. i think they hired new personable agents or they were not working when i was there in nov.. they were very helpful. they took care of a room change with speed and care. they made me feel like a million bucks.they are good looking too!

Reviews.Title: “Loud and obnoxious”
Reviews.Author: SF0811
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while on a business trip. It has a great poolside bar for cocktails, two great restaurant options and the cabana rooms were super cool (although a bit dark). Everything seemed to be great and, with all the high security, we were convinced there must be a celebrity staying there. In the early evening, the cabana bar started playing music that was really loud but really good. Fine, I thought, by the time I get back from a late dinner I'm sure they will turn it off - there's no way they'd expect guests staying in the cabana rooms to sleep with that music blaring. When I returned at 11pm the music was still going strong. I thought about switching rooms to the main tower where it might be quieter but, again, thought management couldn't possibly keep the music going all night. I was wrong. After a bleary-eyed investigation at 1 am I realized there were literally speakers right outside my room! At 2 a.m. they finally turned off the music. I was exhausted and had a full day of work ahead of me and had just paid a small fortune for the room. I'm only in my early thirties and usually not bothered by good music. But how do they expect anyone except twenty-something party-goers to stay here?

Reviews.Title: “First time visitor in L.A”
Reviews.Author: Lugageboy
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, living on the ninth floor. Perfect location for a first time visitor in L.A. It's near to all cool classical places if you wanna tick off the the hollowood to do list! The pool area is really nice, and during night it turns in to an outdoor club/bar. We had a lot of help from the Concierge, Tao, who made a great effort to make our stay and experiences in California great. We stayed five nights at the hotel. Complains could be that the breakfast place in the hotel, 24 degrees, wasn't that great. Boring menu and the last day we unfortunately had a very rud woman serving us...

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as expected”
Reviews.Author: devanisha2905
Reviews.Content: A group of 3 of us (21 - 22 yrs) stayed here from the 23rd -27th and were very impressed. The decor was very sleek indeed although the bathroom could be mordenised slightly. I am an extreme clean freak & this hotel lived up to my "desires". The after party for the BET awards were being held there, so alot of celebs were there and young people in general, which is the kind/type of people that this hotel is perfect for. Other reviewers pics are exacltly how the rooms look, a little better though and the ground floor decor is absolutley gorgeous. Definatly contact me for more info P.S. Also visited orlando & new york if you need help

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!! Loved the Pool! Def. stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny W
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Roosevelt for 4 nights and I couldn't get enough!! The hotel is in a great location right on the Walk of Stars in Hollywood! The hotel was right across from the Chinese theater where there was a red carpet event during the time we stayed there. We also went to the Jimmy Kimmel show right down the street from the hotel. The hotel is clean and the rooms are hip with a contemporary feel to them. I would definitely reccomend this hotel for any age. The pool was great, but the prices of drinks are ridiculous! The hotel staff was nice, but come to Hollywood with a plan of what you want to see and do, don't count on them to help with planning. I loved this hotel and area, and can't wait to go back!! Also, there is a restaurant called 25degrees and they have the best burgers!!

Reviews.Title: “YOBS 1 FAMILIES 0 !”
Reviews.Author: RetrieversDad
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel a total of 4 nights in blocks of 1 and 3 nights over 2 week period as part of a major birthday treat. Was put in a large twin double bed room the first night due to mix up with our booking. The room was extremeley nice except for a rather noisey fan which are in most of the rooms. Ordered room service which was quick and very high standard. We left the next day looking forward to our return trip. On our return trip put in a more smaller standard room, which was fine because that it what we expected to be in. It had adjoining doors and that is when our problem started. At 3am we were woken by the most astounding noise also consider we had a young child with us. A group of youths were using the adjoining wall as a soccer net. There were shouts,screams and bangs which sounded like it was coming from inside the room. After 15 minutes of this we rang the front desk who said they would sort it out. A further 30 minutes later still no end to this noise, our child was quite scared by then. We rang again and explained we had a young family and by now glass's could be heard smashing and foul language clearly heard. Their response was casual but they would sort it. A further 15minutes later and by now they were up and down the corridors with a video recorder which was the final straw.. I made my way to the front desk and spoke to a very sleepy HINT HINT looking night manager whose only solution was for us at 4am to move to another room which i suggested because the noise had not stopped and we had to be up early the next morning.On telling my wife this she rang the front desk a threatned to call the police to sort it [ which is amazing when you see how much security is on in the daytime] and surprise suprise within 15minutes everthing was quiet. We could not speak to anybody first thing the next day due to us leaving for a trip early and nobody available. To cut a long story short it took 2 hours of chasing when we returned to get an solution from the Management about the next night because our child was to scared to stay in the room. We were told to our amazement that it was not the Hotel's policy to throw these type of noisy people out or move them and it would have to be us that moved room's. The only positive thing about this incident is they put us in a suite but the only thing we wanted was COMMON SENSE as we were not after a freebie. Pleased be warned of our experience if you are due to take family's their and require a good nights sleep! This hotel is set up to be a adult playground which is a pity because as a hotel it is quite unique and different than more modern hotels.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: floirdagreat
Reviews.Content: stayed at hollywood roosevelt for 8 days lovley hotel great american service great views to manns chinese theatre, loads to do during the day but night time beware hookers, beggars about. had tours from here to santa monica ,venice beach, easy access to hollywood bowl hollywood sign disney land universal studios. hotel has spa in march we had the spa to ourselfs. didnt eat in hotel local cafes 2 mins from hotel cheap buffet breakfast. only downfall was when movie stars use part of hotel we were aksed nicely to use back entrance only once

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: nyc_kosta
Reviews.Content: I had read some sketchy reviews about the Roosevelt but decided to check it out anyway. The location of the hotel is awesome and is very close to everything. We arrived at the hotel around 2pm and our room was ready for check in. The room was nicely renovated with 2 queen beds and 2 bathrooms. It was pretty big and very clean. The cleaning staff was amazing. Everytime I returned to the room it was clean and the beds were made up. The pool area was beautiful and the bar had a large selection of mojitos and other drinks and snacks. The food was ok and a liitle pricey but hey, you're at a pool so what do you expect. The hotel had a few restaurants, the Tropicana (pool) Bar and Teddys, which is independently owned. We had no problem getting in to Teddys and also had a great time. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge people, Lauren and Adam, def made our trip great. They got us dinner reservations to Koi and Boa, both great, and also got us into Goa and Villa Lounge. Granted, we spent over $3000 at Villa, but it's still the toughest club to get into in LA at this time. Sunday and Monday there were pool parties at the Hotel which featured different dj's and a ton of hot people. Loved the Roosevelt, can't wait to go back. Constantine, NY,NY

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: SoCalGirl2
Reviews.Content: I was very optimistic to experience the "Roosevelt" during a busy summer weekend. However, my experience was awful. The hotel's elevators were broken the entire weekend which resulted in a 20 minute waiting period to take my bags up to the room and several trip up and down the stairs to the 8th floor. The staff was also very unaccommodating. I got the feeling that they didn't care if we enjoyed our stay or were satisfied because they would have guests no matter what because of their name and didn't care if we ever returned, which we wouldn't anyways. They also would not allow more than 2 guests per a room at the pool, which only has 90 chairs for the 700 guests to boot. If you wanted a chair you had to get up a dawn and sit in your chair for the entire day or else you would lose it. If you expect to lay out or party at the pool, it is very difficult to do. The hotel also allows their "guests" aka, people who greased the pool bouncers and front desk people, to be at the pool making it even more crowded and much harder to get a $15 drink. Don't stay here, you will be disappointed. This is not only my opinion, but many other people who were staying there at the same time also spoke this way and said they would never stay there again. Being a guest also does not give you any priority at the door for Teddy's or the Tropicana Bar. Use your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: JLuv033
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice. Rooms are small. My AC was not blowing air my first night. This was probably due do a dirty filter. The smoke alarm in front of the vent was covered in dirt. The shower pressure was so high I couldn't put my face under it-and I'm not exaggerating. It was the worst shower ever and that is not good early in the AM. The stall was 1/2 door style so the water soaked the floor unavoidably. I had to shower with my side pressed against the shower wall. The sink was leaking water from the pipes. The bottom of the porcelain was mildewy because of this. The staff corrected the AC problem when advised but not the shower issue. The pool is beautiful but the servers are want to be actresses who are lazy, slow and less than friendly. They are not much to look at either. This hotel is way overpriced. I don't mind paying for a nice stay-I expense it anyway-this was just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: jenialexis
Reviews.Content: After a terrible experience at The Standard I was very pleased with my stay at the Roosevelt. First of, I just want to say that the staff (especially after staying at The Standard) is extremely nice and helpful. They really do go out of their way to make you stay pleasant. We got a garden view cabana room....and...were frightened when we walked in...to put in nicely, you want to commit suicide if you stay there too long...dont know who's brilliant idea was to paint a room BLACK (!!!) but it doesnt add cheerfulness to say the least. After staying there for a few hours we headed to the front desk at around 2am and after speaking the with concierge (who smiled upon hearing the suicidal remark) were offered a second floor pool view cabana room for no extra charge. Normally these rooms go for about $400 (we originally paid $240 on expedia) The beds are super-comfortable and the mini bar is great....i think a bottle of Patron really changes ones mood... Pool area is very nice and big....its really busy on the weekends and there are quite a few good looking LA folks hanging around Overall, I would recommend this hotel...just stay away from the black room :)))

Reviews.Title: “Probably a good hotel for Europeans who want the surreal Hollywood experience”
Reviews.Author: woolloomoolo
Reviews.Content: First I will say that this hotel tries so hard to be cool and the 'it' place to stay but would be better suited to invest that money on a new elevator and carpeting. Recently stayed here to find the elevator broken, the gym and fitness center shut down. So I thought, hey I'll go for a swim in the famed Hockney pool. Well that pool is only for supermodel wannabe types and there's a major scene there--so if that's the kind of Hollywod experience you want then the hotel pool is for you. The rooms are small, and while there have been some nice touches like quality bedding, nice vibe, it just doesn't mask that this is essentially an ancient hotel. Last, my pre-ordered room service didn't arrive and that really cheesed me off .....and I don't like having to pay for coffee when they provide a coffee maker... So, that's the negative, there are many positives to this place although I'm not sure if they'd be enough for me to stay again. The location is great, right across from Mann's chinese theatre and on the walk of fame. The Fresh toiletries are a really nice touch, the rooms are immaculate and the linens are good quality. Free internet access in lobby is nice and the Hamburger restaurant attached to the hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ambience”
Reviews.Author: vanessam
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in a hotel that had some character this hotel oozes glamour and is very elegant. We were not disappointed with our choice. We did book a supieror room and on checking in found the reception and bell staff very friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a poolside cabana room and we accepted even though we were fully aware of the reviews mentioning the noise problem from Tropicana Bar. We found the music was louder during the day then late at night, however we were at the Tropicana bar until 12.30am anyway. I have read alot of the comments that the hotel is dark this is true however I found it to be in keeping with the hotels atmosphere and creates the elegant ambience expecially in the main lobby and bar areas. We had pre dinner drinks in Teddys/Library bar great atmosphere and dined in Dakota for dinner the service and food was great. The hotel is very central to everything in Hollywood and there was even a movie premier across the road. You will also find that most of the tour groups leave from the Kodak Theatre across the road. The only down side was that the concierge didn't book our airport shuttle after she said she would and we were lucky enough to get one at the last minute (1 hour before we had be picked up).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - not for families”
Reviews.Author: thepurple_monkey
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at the Roosevelt from April 9 to 13, 2008. Front desk staff was extremely helpful and polite, as was the concierge, both giving us great dining and partying suggestions, and helping get us in to the hottest places in Hollywood. The room was average, nothing to brag about. We had room 510 (2 double beds). It is true that the bathrooms are a bit tight, and the furniture, although it looks modern (due to dark colors) is a bit old and chipped here and there, but I really can't complain that much. If you're staying at the Roosevelt, it's not cause you're going to be in the room much!!! 25 degrees and Dakota are both excellent restaurants. I had one of the best steaks of my life at Dakota (and I've eaten alot of steak all over the US and Canada!!!). Tropicana bar is the place to be in Hollywood after dark, as well as happy hour! (don't even bother going to clubs, Tropicana and the lobby bar is where the action is at!!) The hotel is great for the 21-35 crowd, but I don't see it being that great for families (it's kind of dark, literally not much lighting, everywhere) and lots socializing... Overall, great place to stay, would stay again, but Hollywood and L.A. in general is not what we expected. If you go to California, go to San Diego, Santa Monica, Pasadena, Venice beach and Disney land (all beautiful), and try to spend as little time in hollywood or L.A. as possible (beverly hills is the only thing to see there, and that's a half day situation, extensive shopping included!)

Reviews.Title: “Unique experience”
Reviews.Author: juckett
Reviews.Content: If you want a brand new hotel with all the amenities and clean lines of a new hotel, this place is not for you. However, if you want a unique experience at an old Hollywood hotel, then book it. While some of the rooms are very small, and they don't come cheaply, the service that we received from the concierges (Lauren and Adam), bellhops, and parking attendants was outstanding. They exerted a fair amount of effort to ensure that our trip was pleasant and our needs were taken care of. The lobby of the Roosevelt is one of the prettiest lobbies (again old) of any hotel I have stayed. I found the 25 degrees restaurant (open 24 hours) to be above average - although their menu was a little oddly set up. The room was not spectacular, but I believe that is what you get with an older hotel. The bed was relatively comfortable and bathroom was small (hard for the "fatter than average American") and had a shower drain that drained very slowly. However, the location was amazing, convenient to many things (we drove to Beverly Hills in 15 minutes, West Hollywood in 10, Hollywood sign in 5, Warner Studios in 15-20, and out to Santa Monica in 30-35 - all in LA traffic). I would recommend as long as you are okay with older hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Eirinoula
Reviews.Content: Besides the great location, there is nothing else going for the Roosevelt Hotel. We arrived in the morning to find very rude and unfriendly front desk staff. When I got to my room 503, it was small, smelly, and dark. I had nowhere to put my clothes, so kept them in my suitcase in the cupboard. The cupboard was so dark; I had to take the suitcase out every time to see what I was doing. The TV was on top of the fridge. The furniture was old and chipped. My son had room 502. It was much bigger, had a chest of drawers for clothes plus the fridge. It had a big flat screen TV and it did not smell. I rang the front desk to ask why both rooms are the same rate, yet one is far inferior to the other? I was told, the cost of a queen bed is the same no matter the surroundings. The bathroom s are extremely inconvenient. The tiny scratched shelf above the toilet, and the vertical storage that looks like an old cd unit, were not adequate at all. I had no where to put my toiletries, as that unit isn’t big enough to hold bottles upright. I had to close the toilet and use the lid when I wanted to apply my make up or dry my hair. I had to bend down under the basin to find the hair dryer. I was waiting for an envelope to be left for me at the hotel in the afternoon. I asked the desk many times from about 6pm to 9pm, if the envelope had arrived. I was told no. At about 10.30pm I found it underneath my door. Please be advised that on enquiry the envelope had been delivered to the Roosevelt at 5.30pm!!! It took 5 hours to go up 5 floors. At 1am on the same night, I was woken by Room Service who asked me what I wanted to order. I had not put in a call or an order to Room Service. Lauren the concerge is very nice, and the food at 25deg. Other than that, I will not ever give the Roosevelt even a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Own Beer? Not Here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RusedatRoosevelt
Reviews.Content: OVERPRICED, OVERRATED ROOMS that resemble more of a glorified Best Western than a historical top-rated hotel. Worst of all, security CONFISCATED OUR 12-PACK OF BEER in elevator, citing "hotel policy" that prohibits guests from taking alcohol to their rooms!!! This after paying $300/night. Although the front desk returned our beer in the morning and promised to refund our mini-bar charges, we had to call the hotel several times to actually get the credit posted. In addition, the credit manager promised to refund our $30 parking charge but later reneged on this and offered no other remuneration.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Margaritaville11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in two different rooms . Great location across the road from the Kodak Theatre. Unique Hotel with a very dark atmosphere, rooms were very modern recently remodelled. Negatives were the parking is very expensive, $28 per night valet. After the first night I hunted around for cheaper parking in the area and found great overnight parking next to the Renaissance hotel for only $10 per night in a very safe,huge parking garage,only a short walk up the road. I had similar problems as previous reviewers firstly the fan for the Aircon wouldn't turn off , it was very noisy and I wouldn't have been able to sleep, had to call maintence to turn off via a circuit breaker. When checking into hotel please check room first as they vary, we had a room across the hall from the X35 room previously mentioned by a reviewer and I agree the elevator is very noisy it sounded like thunder every time it went up and down. We also had the problem of the front and side entrance being locked because of a function , which meant we had to walk around the back in the cold wind, they should have a security entrance that uses the room key. In my opinion I would have rather stayed at the Renaissance hotel it still has the same great location .

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience at Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thetravelers45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for our anniversay on March 24, 2008. The front desk staff was extremely accomodating & very pleasant. Our room was beautiful, large and more than we expected. The view from our windows overlooked Hollywood Blvd and we didn't hear any noises from below. We chose to stay at the hotel so we could walk to other restaurants, the Kodak Theater ,Mann's Chinese Theater and other attractions. We enjoyed the "look and feel" of a older, historic hotel, but with the amenities of a newer facility. It was a perfect evening and will return again soon. From Huntington Beach, CA

Reviews.Title: “No More History At The Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: prockbirdman
Reviews.Content: The new Hollywood Roosevelt now hides its historical legacy. This is a very different hotel than it was 5-10 years ago. Its' location along Hollywood Boulevard is still unbeatable, but the hotel's atmosphere does not welcome tourists and history buffs anymore...

Reviews.Title: “Very hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: MexicoAnaMaria
Reviews.Content: A very nice stay. This hotel has the mood of hollywood. Pics of famous people all over the place. The rooms are very simple but totally confortable. I really like it and I will recommend it. The staff always very friendly. The dark atmosphere inside makes you feel like you are a hollywood star.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jorrit9
Reviews.Content: Expensive but great location, nice swimmingpool, altough too bad they took the jaccuzi out. Nice poolbar and lobby. Very historial building. Everything is pretty much remodeled a few years ago, now it's one of the hippest places too hang out. Parking very expensive: 25 USD a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: jknecole
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is difficult to pin in terms of location from LAX. It took approximately 45 minutes to get there from the airport. Blame it on traffic and we were going against the grain. We took Super Shuttle (book online or just show up at the counter). This was $15. Not bad, as a cab would have cost about $50 (one-way). It took approximately 25 minutes on the Sunday morning we left. I guess LA was asleep. The hotel upon arrival is like a gem. I was highly jealous to see others get off at the Renaissance (right down the street) and I was upset the b/f booked Roosevelt. However, to my surprise, we arrived at the beautiful Roosevelt. The front of the building does it no justice. It is beautiful inside, hip, colorful with restaurants, lounges and plenty of amenities. Check in was smooth. The concierge offered assistance for dinner that night. There were PCs with printers available for printing pre-boarding passes. Great! We arrived to our room, X35. If they offer any room ending with 35 (i.e. 535, 935, etc.) Do Not Take It. This room is right next to the elevator. After major jet lag and a midnight sickness, the elevator ran all night. You could hear the beeps per floor and feel a vibration. And this was a Wednesday night. What were people doing? Where were they going? I don't know. But don't take this room. Not only is it near the elevator, it is SMALL. Very small compared to the other rooms. After a morning complaint, we were moved to another room on the other side of hall, still a side view. This room was (and I'm not kidding) 2 times the size of our previous room. Plenty of space to walk around, be free, think and not feel so crowded. Again, don't let them put you in a room that ends with 35. After that incident, we were given a 50% discount on the first night. The stay was fine afterwards. Side note: They charge a $150 per night hold on your credit card. With 4 nights, that was a hefty $600, that's not outlined to you upon check in. This hold is for incidentals (room service, etc.) Be careful. That's a huge hold. A wedding took place on Saturday and you weren't allowed to enter through the historic lobby, which is a quicker way to enter and exit the building to get to Hollywood Blvd. Also there was an after party for Barack Obama at the hotel after the Presidential Debates, which blocked off the historic lobby entrance and exit on Thursday. This can be a bit of an issue, if its cold, raining, etc and you have to walk all the way around the building. Not a huge issue but for some it's extra effort. Still the hotel is beautiful. I don't personally suggest the in-house restuarants. They aren't that good. 25 degrees is a rip off. Some liked the burgers, but I didn't but at least they are huge (they fed my fiance and I). The fries were delicious though. Across the street are a pizza place with decent meals on the go and a great and cheap diner (the breakfast was awesome). Less than a 2 minute walk is the Kodak Theater, and much more. This is a prime location if you are looking to stay in LA. I would stay here again, if the Renaissance is booked. If not, for sake of trying something new...I'd try the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lork
Reviews.Content: On a brief trip to LA last year, our tour bus broke down on Hollywood Blvd, right outside the Roosevelt. Our tour guide took us into the lobby to wait for a replacement, out of the sun and I knew straight away that I was coming back and staying there next time. The lobby and 'public' areas have a real old Hollywood feel and you know that if the walls could talk, they'd tell some great tales! When we arrived at the hotel it was approaching midnight on a Saturday night and the reception area was milling with young trendy people partying. Having just stepped of a 12 hour flight, in track pants and trainers, I felt completely under dressed and a little intimidated and wondered what I had let myself in for. I was made to feel extremely welcome, though, and I have to say that these feelings had disappeared by morning when the hotel was "back to normal" (and I'd had a little sleep!). I felt completely at ease for the rest of the trip. Our room was quite big, on the 7th floor, with a view of Hollywood Blvd and a small corner of the pool. Thankfully we were high enough up not to notice any noise from downstairs bar the odd squeal of laughter. We had two large double beds and mine was probably the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. We had a dressing area with a full-size ironing board, electronic safe and plenty of room for clothes and luggage. The bathroom was a decent size with plenty of towels and a bathrobe each. It was a little on the dark but perfectly adequate for the amount of time spent in there. We also had a desk, CD player and a selection of magazines (very useful when the jetlag kicks in at 2am, as was the complimentary copy of the NY Times each morning!) There was a fully stocked (but obviously expensive) mini bar with drinks and snacks, and a coffee machine but they charge something like $3.50 for the coffee and it was pretty awful stuff.(There's a Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf next to the hotel - go there instead!) The housekeeper left ice in the ice bucket each evening and put the bedside lights on, and left us a tube of M&M's on a couple of occasions! As there was a corkscrew and bottle opener in the room, we bought our own drinks and snacks from the drugstore across the road (next to LA Fitness) for a lot cheaper. The hotel is in a great location right on the Walk of Fame, opposite Mann's Chinese Theatre and the Hollywood & Highland Center and provided a great base for us to do what we wanted to do using public transport. There are plenty of restaurants near the hotel (mainly in the H&H Center) but by far the best meal we had was at 25 degrees at the Roosevelt. I had read reviews here saying that the burgers are the best people had ever tasted and was a little sceptical but had to try it out and see for myself. I have to say, they really are the best burgers in the world, with lots of different cheeses and extras to choose from, so that you can build your own burger. We had two burgers, half fries/half onion rings (to die for!) and two beers for $60.00 including a tip, which I thought was quite reasonable. The restaurant is open 24 hours a day and you can also order from room service. The staff are really friendly and will recommend options which will or won't compliment each other. I'd fly back just to eat here again! The hotel was quite busy during the day, with conferences and meetings, etc. The only time we were affected was when the lobby was closed for 24 hours for a commercial shoot and we had to use the entrance through the parking lot at the back, which was no real inconvenience. I was a little disappointed not to see any famous people during my stay but then got to sit next to Jesse Metcalfe on the flight home! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Roosevelt, and if money were no object, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. However, I'm planning another visit next year and will look at staying somewhere a little cheaper in the Hollywood area (as this was an early 30th birthday treat to myself, I could justify the expense).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: ValerieMow
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Hollywood and were quite overwelmed by the fast pace of the place and were even more shocked by the valet parking at the Roosevelt hotel - it was very expensive. We were a bit early for check in but there were no problems. The room itself was a bit small but had everything in it. The decor of the hotel was lovely and the lobby was out of this world. There were quite a few weddings taking place in it while we were there. The pool was a different story!! Impossible to get a bed and at times was closed without any notice!! The one time that we did actually get to the pool (a sunday) it was terrible!! There seemed to be an influx of young, hip, toned and very loud people who had stayed in the hotel for the weekend. We felt totally out of place with our books while quietly sunbathing!! The norm appeared to be very much loudness, drinking and dancing by the pool!! One of these sunbathers was one of the contestants from Americas Next Top Model - not our cup of tea I'm afraid. Overall the location is excellent. Mann's Chinese Theatre and the Kodak Theatre are across the road and all the other main attractions such as Universal Studios and Venice Beach are all very close by. Great hotel for celeb spotting - Rushour 3 premiered across the road! The staff were also very friendly and it was nice to say we stayed in the Roosevelt hotel but I don't think we would stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “closed pool at no notice. Dodgy local cabs”
Reviews.Author: Camberleybob
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, if a bit small and only showers we have Cabanna pool rooms, but on second day at no notice (we negotiated the pool rooms on arrival) they simply closed the pool for renovation for a week. So in instead of pool rooms, we had building site rooms! Compliants lead to an upgrade, but would I have booked an LA hotel with no pool in first place? No. It was an expensive con. Watch out for local taxi rank - utter rip off as they take the long route, and room service ridiculously expensive. Gym nice, but no sauna or steam room. Dont book Cabanna rooms if you like an early night. Stupid loud music played into the night some nights. Le Montrose better.

Reviews.Title: “Could use some sprucing up!”
Reviews.Author: LondonJetSetters
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel is a totally FINE experience for someone who wants to be out and about and enjoy LA. The price was reasonable enough, the rooms were fine, and there is a fun scene at the pool bar. As per other reviewers, the parking is expensive-- it is actually $28/day and we imagined we would just use public parking but all the parking nearby is closed overnight, so this is impossible. We looked at 5 rooms before we found one that was a reasonable size (and we were not in the cheapest room category) and then, picked one that smelled of smoke, because at least we could walk around it. The rooms were all quite worn-- chipped furniture, chipped bathtubs, but it did seem clean enough. All in all, I don't feel the need to COMPLAIN about the hotel, but I wouldn't give it a rave either. It is a good place to stay if you are in LA to have fun-- out and about during the day and on the town at night...

Reviews.Title: “Very good, couple of reservations”
Reviews.Author: isee1
Reviews.Content: This is a very good historic hotel that has been extremely well restored (check out the lobby). Excellent location virtually opposite Grauman's theatre. The room was an ok size, sufficient for the 4 nights I stayed there. Staff very helpful and friendly - excellent concierge. Nice pool and bar. Main gripe was that you can hear every word of your neighbours next door. No soundproofing in evidence -- I am encountering this problem regularly when I stay in hotels worldwide these days. Other than that treat yourself to a nice merger of old and new Hollywood (also recommended an excellent steak at the hotels Dakota restaurant and propably the best burger I've ever had at 25 Degrees also on site).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BobAdams111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights while on business in Hollywood, CA and I really enjoyed my stay. This is a great hotel (high 4 stars) and it is very different from most luxury hotels I've stayed at. The design is modern and chique and this fits in well with Hollywood Blvd. Overall, I enjoyed the atmosphere, the cleanliness of the hotel, the quality of the accommodations, and the convenience to where I needed to be. Also, it was nice meeting celebrities by the pool at night! Here are some things I did not like: 1. No Heat. There was AC only. At night, temperatures in LA dropped to 30 degrees and heat was needed. 2. There is only a fitted sheet and a comforter on the bed. There is no sheets between the fitted sheet and the comforter. You use the comforter as your only blanket. While the front desk assured me they clean each comforter every night, I like a sheet and I found this unusual. 3. The bathroom was dimly lit. 4. The lobby is a historic and well decorated lobby. Yet, it has the atmosphere of a night club. There is virtually no light except for candles and I thought this was a shame. It's an impressive lobby and I would have liked to enjoy this room.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: fly4fun2
Reviews.Content: I'd booked a deluxe room as I was hoping this would be away from the noise. I was offered an upgrade to a suite for $50. Great I thought until he told me it was $50 a night. I was there for 3 and we took the upgrade as we'd just stayed at the best hotel ever in Vegas (Thanks Tripadvisor!). This is an old hotel that has had a facelift (or two, this being LA and all!!) . The room was probably two rooms in a past life, but it was worth the extra money to have all that space. Half of it may have been too small. We had a great view of the Chinese Theatre and Hollywood sign. We were on the 9th floor. It was too cold and grey to use the pool, and we only saw it on our last day anyway. Looks like a great place to spend time. The lobby bar is pricey, but it is classy and funky. We could hear it from our room at night, the bass throbbing through the building. Thankfully earplugs and sleeping tablets helped hide that! As a first time tourist to LA its hard to find somewhere "central" to stay in a town that has no heart. For a location though this wasn't bad as the boulovard wasn't too unsafe at night, given the crowds outside. Loads of safe places in the Hollywood and Highlands complex next to the Kodak Theatre as well as the ones in the hotel - Note 21 degrees burgers - order one mixed portion of onion rings and fries for two as it's plenty! This isn't a cookie cutter hotel, so expect it to have a bit of "charm" and "character" for it's age. It's a funky place to stay and if you are looking for the different, then come here. If you want a standard type of hotel, then go to a Hitlon or Marriot etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fun & Glamorous”
Reviews.Author: roberta_nyc
Reviews.Content: Roosevelt Hotel Personally, I love this hotel – it’s fun & glamorous. I love the rooms, pool / pool scene, restaurants, staff, service, etc. I stayed in the Studio King w/Living Area room type. I found it to be quite spacious. The décor is modern, but warmer than what is traditionally thought of as minimal. It really appealed to me & I felt immediately at home in the room. The Lobby Bar is very relaxing & comfortable. The pool is beautiful & the Tropicana pool scene at night is quite fabulous. Teddy’s is also located here (note that staying at the hotel doesn’t guarantee access). 25 Degrees is a fun burger joint with a great veggie burger. There’s also a steakhouse, Dakota, though I didn’t go. Small details completed my experience – toiletries were from Fresh (mmnn!), in-room internet access was speedy, mini bar was stocked with everything that I could ever want from Dean & Deluca & some local brands, room service was prompt & great. Location is so-so. If you’re a tourist & want to do tourist-y things, then this is perfect for you! If you’re not interested in standard tourist activities, then you may prefer a different, calmer location. This is the equivalent of staying in Times Square in NYC. For the cons – a co-worker stayed here in a standard room & said it was awful – much, much smaller than the superior room that I’m raving about. Also, I understand that the valet parking charges are insane. If you are planning on driving or having guests over for dinner / pool party, you may want to look into alternate, less expensive parking options. & the bathroom is too dark to really get ready in. Darkness / ambiance shouldn’t carry over into the bathroom / vanity mirror area! & I had a minor problem with housekeeping, I would only say to make sure you call in to confirm any laundry / dry cleaning needs. I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated closet”
Reviews.Author: edo408
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location!! Those would be the only 3 reasons why you should consider the Roosevelt. Can't complain about the rate cos they tell you that before you hand over your credit card. However, they really should be more realistic in their room descriptions! I stayed in a traditional guest room for $299/night (and this was discounted). The room turned out to be dark, musty, and tiny with barely any artwork or furniture. Just a lumpy, platform bed with old sheets, a desk with office chair, an older model TV, a mini fridge and a wall mirror. I've stayed at the Sheraton for $199 with more luxurious amenities! My view?? I had a spectacular view of the Roosevelt's rooftop and air conditioning units! Lovely. I would love to go on about the bathroom but that would bring on a claustrophobic attack.

Reviews.Title: “OK experience”
Reviews.Author: tanja39
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great area within driving and walking to distances to just about anything. Just be warned...if you have a car you have to pay to park the car overnight for 23 bucks. The pool parties there are fun but hotel not very kid friendly. I would stay there again only not with my kid.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Cool Place”
Reviews.Author: coolgirlz1
Reviews.Content: My friends and I came to stay at the roosevelt for halloween weekend. We had a blast at the party, the rooms are pretty big, my only complaint is how small the bathrooms are. Everyone at the hotel is really nice, check in was a breeze, make sure you ask for ingrid . the y have an aewsome gift store thats kinda hard to find but it has great stuff, ask for tayler. Overall, its a cool place to party with your friends, but the halls are really poorly lit and its really dark, so its not for older people.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Cool, Cool - a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: bjpeart
Reviews.Content: As a traveling musician, I stayed at the Roosevelt while playing a show in Hollywood. My wife and I were issued a beautiful corner room overlooking the famed "Hollywood" sign and the Chinese theater out one window, and and the walk of fame, a great view of the city and other landmarks out the other window. The room was very modern, but homey, with a flat screen television, high speed internet, a very comfortable bed, and a great bathroom. Lots of storage space was nice as well. As great as the accomodations were, the service is what really knocked me off my feet. Everyone on staff, from the waiters and waitresses, the front desk personel, the cleaning staff, and even the valet staff were very courteous, friendly and - gasp - helpful! Much different from what I expected in Los Angeles of all places. (If you're into it, we also saw a number of Celebrities while staying at the Roosevelt. Not necessarily my thing, but still kinda cool.....) The restaurants in the hotel were top notch as well, especially 25 degrees, where I had one of the best gourment hamburgers I've ever tasted (at 4am in the morning, nonetheless). If you're in town to see the sights of Hollywood, there's probably no better place to stay. The price might be a deterrent to some, but if you want to truly experience the area, this is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Feel Like a Movie Star”
Reviews.Author: bratty3000
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for someone who wants to relax during the day, be close to tons of tourist attractions, and party at night. I stayed here on a business trip and was so sad when business got in the way. Great location, close to shopping, the chinese theatre, in and out burger, and everything LA. The pool is defintely amazing! The waitress service is a little slow but just relaxing in the sun on the comfy lounge chairs makes up for it. Great bar at the pool as well. The rooms were huge with tons of space. the bathrooms were a bit small but everything was extremely clean. The only issue we had with the hotel was that they lost our boxes for 12 hours. The staff decided to take a break and go watch the prince concert in the hotel and we were put behind our deadline by 12 hours. Make sure if you are shipping they check everywhere! Overall amazing experience and will defintely go back. Something is always happening at night and you are mixed in with the Hollywood A listers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Roosevelt!”
Reviews.Author: OCCouple2004
Reviews.Content: I highly reccomend this hotel. From the friendly staff to the comfortable beds- Its a great hotel. Everyone is very nice, not stuffy AT ALL!!! Stay Here!

Reviews.Title: “There's better in LA”
Reviews.Author: ChrisLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a good quality hotel with a lot of history. The location isn't the best with many homeless people lurching around outside. Handy for the Kodak theatre I guess though. The pool is lovely and the rooms are of a good size and are well equipped. The bar and retaurant are also very good, even if the lobby is extremly dark. It's not cheap though and for the money there are better located hotels of a smilar standard in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: KBTwinCities
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel for a short girls weekend to L.A (my friends and I are 30). The hotel is in a perfect location to many great restaurants and night clubs. The entire hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating, particularly the bellmen and concierge service. The hotel itself is very nice including the pool area, the weather was a little cool for us so we did not spend much time by the pool, if it had been warmer I think the pool area would have been great. The only time we actually ate at one of the hotel restaurants was for lunch by the pool, the food was excellent. The hotel rooms were very spacious, we had 4 girls in one room and did not have any issues with it feeling too crowded compared to other places we have stayed. We also were a little concerned with some of the reviews we had read but had no issues getting whatever we needed as far as room service/housekeeping and overall just very friendly service. I would definately reccommend this hotel to anyone. I would also strongly recommend that guests use the concierge service. They are absolutely wonderful here (Andrea and Ben) and were very helpful to us with getting reservations, recommendations on where to go, answering our questions, etc. We had a great time at the Roosevelt and will definately stay here again the next time we come to L.A.!

Reviews.Title: “Scarey neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: wanthelp
Reviews.Content: Roosevelt Hotel is nice with nice pool. Very dark interior. On a scarey street with many homeless. Many young people staying there. I'm only 43!?! Not for kids. The pool and bar turns into a really cool atmosophere at night with fireplaces, etc. Perfect to see Jimmy Kimmel show though.

Reviews.Title: “An 'OK' Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trippers123
Reviews.Content: I don't really have much good or bad to say about this hotel. The staff were friendly, the pool has nice. Didn't really like the location but that depends on what your looking for !! The room was small but thats what you expect in a city hotel. I did like the old hollywood feel to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Week in California”
Reviews.Author: sunny_ksgirl
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Roosevelt and enjoyed our time overall. The check in process was very smooth and the staff treated us very well and made us feel very welcome. When we arrived to our room it was very warm. Told the bell boy about it when he brought our luggage and house keeping was notified right away. Seems all you need to fix anything at the Roosevelt is a pair of pliers! Maintance opened up several boxes in the room and hit the air conditioner several times with the pliers and we had a comfortable room! Made us laugh very hard when they left. On our second day at the Roosevelt they had some sort of function going on in the lobby so it was closed to guest. The lobby elevator button was even disconnected so you could not get to that floor at all. The only way into the hotel was in the back where the valet was, I think the hotel staff should have told guests that the main entrances would be locked all day. We would stay at the Roosevelt again if we were ever in the area. Bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: BHA1
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. After reading some of the reviews on here i was a bit worried about going but as soon as we arrived we were treated really well.The Valet guys were really friendlly and the front desk girls were like supermodels (the 3 we saw anyway). The rooms are a bit dark and small but as we didn`t spend much time in them it was not a problem. The pool area is lovelly with a very big pool and plenty of sunbeds if you get down before noon.The food they serve at the pool is fantastic especially the salads and burgers.There are lots of gorgeous people parading around especially at weekends.The service we received and saw other people receive was fantastic so cant understand the people who compalin. The pool turns into a club at night and as long as you get your hand stamped by reception before 9 then all hotel guests are allowed access.We saw Mike Tyson the night we went there and the atmosphere was great with many people stripping off into their swimwear and swimming in the pool. Overall the hotel is great and would recommend but dont think it will be suitable for businessmen who want to get a good nights sleep or older couples as the hotel is a bit noisy and catered for people in their twenties.

Reviews.Title: “birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: juliaridgeley
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at the hotel for my birthday weekend. i live in Los Angeles, but thought it would be nice to lay by the pool by day with friends and party by the pool by night. we had a great time. every one at the front desk was very nice. the concierge was helpful in booking us a last minute dinner reservation. and the pool staff did their job in taking care of us with drinks all day long. in fact a few of my friends came late to join and they found a place for everyone to sit together. looks like the staff really has a good time, which makes the guests want to have a good time. my only recommendation is try to book a room in the tower since there are very dark hallways and no ice machines on the cabana floors.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: jsdCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I took a quick one-night trip to LA to see Wicked. Since we were only staying for one night, I used Priceline which came up with the Roosevelt Hotel. After reading many reviews of this hotel, I must admit that I had low expectations. The review comments that most stood out were small dark rooms and rude staff. I must say that my experience was very different. We arrived at noon, before check-in, but were treated very politely at the front desk. They advised that only one room with two beds was available, it was 'nice' and on the 8th floor, but was handicapped accessible. We decided to take the room and it was lovely. It had views of the Hollywood sign, the Chinese Theater and the Magic Castle. It was also quite large and bright. When we got to the room, we noticed that the shower had been used, a bathmat was on the floor and a towel was in the sink. I called housekeeping, they were very apologetic, and said it would be taken care of. We were not really bothered by this, and assume the room was cleaned while the previous guest was at the pool. (This happened to us once when we were at the pool and our room was cleaned early - we did tell the front desk upon checkout, but have no idea if they relayed the message to the housekeeping staff.) We left to do some shopping and have lunch, when we returned the room had been re-cleaned. The poolside bar/restaurant was really nice and since it was extremely hot, the staff was very obliging and moved an umbrella over to our table to provide shade. About the only negative comment is that there are no ice machines, and ice must be ordered from room service. After returning from the theater we really wanted ice water, so I called room service to ask how long it would take. I was assured that it would only be about 10 minutes, but after 45 minutes, we gave up and went to sleep. Next time, I would just go to the 24 hr. restaurant and ask for a glass of ice. Breakfast in the restaurant was also very good. Other comments on this site have mentioned that the pool area and bar are sometimes closed for private parties, but since we had no intention of using the pool at night, or going to the bar (since my daughter is too young) it was not an issue. All in all, it was a very wonderful experience and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoCalCanucks
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, incredible location, Rooms and Housekeeping service is excellent. But make sure you get to the pool early in the morning if you want a lounger, there seems to be some kind of hierarchy as most are reserved for somebody other than the normal hotel guest. Also food and drinks are good once you can flag down the many servers that are about.

Reviews.Title: “Chic but really loud at night”
Reviews.Author: havanahipster
Reviews.Content: This is a very chic hotel (consistent with the Thompson hotel properties in NYC). The rooms are elegantly understated with hardwood floors, platform bed, and miminalist design. I had a cabana room that overlooked the pool. During the day you will see many locals hanging around the pool or a production company shooting a commercial. Celebrity sightings are common here. At night, this pool area is quite the party scene. If you have any plans to sleep at night, don't stay at this hotel. Seriously. I am a heavy sleeper, but the noise was so loud, and it went on until at least 1 am, and this was on a Wednesday night!! So, if you are here on a business trip and need to be awake for an early morning meeting or to get to the airport, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Yes - The Best - Do you have STAR quality ?”
Reviews.Author: starstatus
Reviews.Content: Yes - Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel. Ambiance of the hotel makes the guest feel like "STAR", if you have passion to spend to enjoy the star status, appreciate luxury, comfort ... This is the best hotel with Excellent service in the area, country. Valet service and staff is excellent with a beautiful lobby. Staff, management, ownership appears to be caring for all conveniences of the guest, Thank You everyone for the efforts. Excellent High Speed Internet both wired and wireless all over the hotel. Guest services, Front desk staff is excellent to help with any needs. Every staff member is well informed, just need to get in touch with someone, call the Front desk or security to get connected to have the best experience and the stay to come back. Convenience and all the services are highly appreciable. Whenever in the area I stay here and is always better experience than the previous. I recommend highly to all my friends, associates and others who read here. I don't want to keep writing too much good as I'm not part of management or ownership but wanted to share positive about this heritage, we are proud of. Color black, furniture, paintings, design, layout is the great symbol of great heritage. Yes some people have negative but did they try to think, why ? and did they even try to contact someone from the hotel staff. You got to try it, give someone chance to help you and will know Yes its the best. Sure if you want to complain without talking to anyone what to say... post a bad review, does it matter for anyone who reads that... It all makes a difference, how to enjoy star status, luxury, comfort, beauty, elegance ...

Reviews.Title: “good for the experience”
Reviews.Author: jamsgurl
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous about staying here after reading some of the reviews on here, however our stay was great. I guess those with the loudest voices are complainers. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Free coffee was available by the pool from 8am - 10am, and it was wonderful sitting by the pool in the sun. The hotel is not outdated, it's a beautiful historic buidling...if you want a white box with windows, go stay at a chain hotel. It was a great Hollywood experience and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: tim1966
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned after booking this hotel through Priceline that I had made a big mistake! Small rooms, poor service and noise seemed to be the general feeling coming from many reviewers. I was considering walking away from the reservation but in the end decided to 'chance' it. I was so glad I did, check in staff where friendly and efficient and after discovering it was our first time staying at the Roosevelt spent a good few minutes going through all the facilities that were on offer. After expecting a tiny room I was delighted with the corner room I was given on the 7th floor. It had two twin beds with very comfortable linens, very effective air conditioning and a great view towards downtown LA. The bathroom was not huge, however, it was fine for 1 night, there was also plenty of storage space in the closets in the small corridor as you entered the room. The mini-bar was well stocked however, the prices were extremely expensive. It was good to see that it wasn't one of those mini-bars were the slightest movement of an item causes a charge to be made. This meant it was possible to store a few beers and other items in there with no problem. The historic lobby is dark as had been stated previously however, it was like a calm oasis after battling through the heat and crowds on Hollywood Boulevard. It was also a great place to enjoy a few drinks before retiring as the pool bar is closed on Sunday evenings. I only had a brief opportunity to see the pool area on the Sunday afternoon of my stay, however it definitely had a 'vibe' about the place and was certainly full of 'beautiful' people. All in all it was a great 'Hollywood' experience for the end of my vacation and if people get the same treatment as I and my partner did I can whole-heartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “People watching at its best”
Reviews.Author: LVNative50
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location. If you arrive via union station the red line subway (yes subway in LA) takes you to the intersection of Highland & Hollywood for $1.25. This beats the $28 parking fee. Rooms are remodeled & include coffee pot, hair dryer and irons. Beds & showers are good. My pet peeve is the $3.50 the hotel charges you for coffee packets (to make coffee in the room). But, there is free coffee poolside from 8-10 a.m.. The pool is heated. When we were there all of the unoccupied lounges were "reserved" and the pool guy told us we needed to make "pool reservations" like you do dinner reservations at a restaurant. Management de bunked this myth stating the lounges were available to guests on a first come first serve basis. The antic's of the pool crowd (average age is about 24) is well worth the effort of getting a seat. We set by valet from 11:30 - mid-night watching people come and go from the pool bar on a Saturday night. This was highly a entertaining activity. I will stay here again. I don't know where you get a bigger entertainment bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hollywood Meets Luxurious Fun”
Reviews.Author: PegLar
Reviews.Content: Even if you live in Southern California, you shouldn't miss a chance to stay at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel. The ambiance of the hotel makes the guest feel like a "star" - if only for the night. Every detail in our renovated room was perfect - the modern but comfortable furniture, the marble-clad bath, the view of Grauman's Chinese Theatre across the street. The room included great (and stylish) lighting for working at the desk or reading in bed. I loved the photos of movie stars lining the hallways and the sense of historic Hollywood. If only the walls could talk! The interiors of the hotel public rooms are amazing. You can sit in the library bar and marvel at all the intricate details in the woodwork, textiles and tile. It's a marvelous mix of different styles that echo the historic past and current scene that is the Hollywood. Best of all, and in spite of it's celebrity power, it isn't fussy. Check-in was professional yet friendly. You'll wait for your car at valet parking just like any popular spot but this doesn't diminish the fun of staying here. You are so distracted by the lux autos and the people driving them that it doesn't matter. Highly recommended for a true taste of Hollywood glamour!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the most part”
Reviews.Author: lboasis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel mostly because of the buzz and the history of the place and found it to be nice, friendly if not occasionaly loud and busy. The dark of the lobby that others mention we didn't mind because of the hustle bustle of Hollywood Blvd and the L.A. heat...it was actually calming. Staff and front desk were attentive and friendly. Room was fine but certainly not "historical". Pool area is beautiful but noisy and crazy on weekends...go mid week if you want to properly enjoy it. The location is the best so outside of a little noise and wait for your car, it is a good hotel for what it does. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: fun4uinbshore
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay in Hollywood. I read some scathing reviews and was prepared to walk if all was not in order (actually had a back up reservation across the street). We booked a pool view cabana room. We got a very nice sized room with an awesome king bed with great sheets. The room was dark but not uncomfortably so. The view of the pool and immediate access to the pool was nice. I can't imagine being in the tower rooms since so much of this hotel revolves around the pool and the Tropicana. When we arrived the valet was courteous, check in efficient and the bellman superb giving us some hints. This was my girlfriend's birthday and all was in order. Oh yeah, we are not in our 20's, but late 40's, and we did not feel out of place at the pool. We made contact with a pool attendant Greg immediately, and made arrangements for specific lounge chairs by Hollywood's most popular pool. It helps if you are wiling to tip to get prime real estate by the pool, and want to sleep in. While the drinks and pool snacks are a little pricey hey it's a vacation relax and go with it. The pool becomes a nightclub at night with a line, but as a cabana guest you have access with no questions. it can be loud until about 1:20am, so be warned. Well worth stopping here for a drink on the way to your room The Library lobby bar is beautiful and serves up drinks in a more sedate atmosphere. While there you really should try Dakota for a high end steak dining experience. Excellent service and corkage for $20.00. Also try the killer hamburger and breakfast bar open 24 hours it is called 25 Degrees. The hotel walking distance to all the great places in Hollywood. We did the Magic Castle and Pantages (Wicked). The only bummer is we did not have time for Musso and Frank Grill. I am already thinking about booking another weekend here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: anyasall
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to go down to LA for a girls long weekend getaway. I had heard that the Roosevelt was a fun hotel providing a true "LA experience", so we booked it. Worst hotel choice I have ever made. The nicest people at the hotel are those who don't actually work for the hotel -- i.e., the security and valet parking staff who are contracted out. We had booked our room through a very reputable travel website. After schlepping my suitcase down the stairs to the reception area with travel confirmation in hand, the front desk staff told us that the travel website had sent them different room preferences (we wanted 2 double beds, they had 1 king own for us) than those printed on my confirmation directly from the travel website. They told us it was not their fault and that they may change rooms for us "as a favor". The room itself was decent except, for a very poorly designed half glass door fo the shower (saturating the bathroom floor) and the very VERY bright light outside the building that shined right into our room ALL NIGHT. This light was intended to light up the hotel, I guess. Very poor design and poor consideration for guests trying to sleep in those rooms. We didn't actually get moved until our last night. We also never received a bottle of wine or a call from the manager, as promised. The hotel staff and the concierge made us feel like we were lucky to even be allowed to stay at the hotel and that we were very low on the totum pole. I HAVE NEVER BEEN SO DISRESPECTED AS HOTEL GUEST IN MY LIFE. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY... YOU'LL PROBABLY GET BETTER TREATMENT AT A 2-STAR HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “don't make the same mistake we did...”
Reviews.Author: gordongecko45
Reviews.Content: Where shall I begin... This hotel has the darkest, gloomiest hallways I've ever come across. We had to navigate our way through the maze of hallways to reach our sorry excuse of a room. Upon opening the door, we could barely fit our suitcases and when we looked up we were disturbed to find what seemed to be a painting of two serial killer women on acid. We immediately had to use our limited towel supply to cover up this monstrosity. From there, my girlfriend decided to take a shower and was pleased to find half of a glass shower door that left our floor sopping wet. Other than that, the bathroom resembled any typical shanty motel bathroom. Back to the room itself, it was as small as a closet AND this was a deluxe size room. The pool area itself was very nice and the highlight of the hotel. Had we only spent $100 a nite, we wouldn't have been as upset as we were. However, If you think you're going to get value for your dollar, think again. Please don't be fooled by the pictures because you'll be in for a rude awakening.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else to stay”
Reviews.Author: giraffesinspace
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt in January for business, because I wanted something "historic". This was honestly the worst hotel experience I have ever had. Once I actually got to the hotel (which is no small feat with all the traffic from the Kodak), I realized that I had to go downstairs (dragging suitcase) into a dark reception area. They told me to come back in about a half an hour to check in because they had no clean rooms (at their normal check in time). I eventually checked in and found the room to be small and the entire hotel to be dark and unwelcoming. My shower also leaked all over the floor, due to poor design, as opposed to a need for maintenance. On the second night I was there (a Tuesday, mind you), there was some sort of event going on. Parking was a major issue. Once I returned to the hotel, I realized the bass from whatever music was playing was so loud I could barely talk to the other people I was traveling with. My room was on the 4th floor and things in the room literally SHOOK from the vibrations from the music. I think I finally fell asleep out of sheer exhaustion at around 2 am. I tried changing hotels for the final 2 nights of my stay, but couldn't find anything....

Reviews.Title: “hip trendy hotel suprisingly child friendly”
Reviews.Author: natalieb271
Reviews.Content: we arrived at this hotel with our 8 year old late at night just as a party for richard branson was finishing and immediatly thought our 8 year old would not be welcome at a such a trendy hotel,we were so wrong. upon check in we were given an upgrade as the reception thought we would need a bigger room as we were traveling with a child.this hotel is fab great looking and trendy and the staff are so friendly and welcoming .the location is fantastic located on the walk of fame ( two stars down from samuel l jackson) and opposite the chinese theatre. it has a great pool with a david hockney painting at the bottom and the food and restaurants are very good and well priced just like the hotel. the rooms are big have cd players and flat screen tv and plenty of famouse people lounging by the pool. i cannot recomend this hotel enough to everyone families teenagers older couples and honeymooners a fantastic great priced trendy child friendly hotel deffinatly deserves 5 stars and will make your trip to la the formal restaurant is fab and they did there best to accomadate are child.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: techsan04
Reviews.Content: Let me start with a positive, the room was very clean and the bedding comfortable. However, the "standard room was very very small, a queen bed barely fit into the room.
