The staff was just okay...not very helpful or kind. The morning of checkout, I realized I had left something in the room. The hotel staff made no attempt to looking for it or returning our phone calls. Also, the pool has very strange hours...don't expect to relax and layout during the day. Lastly, Whats with the pill bottle decor on the nightstand??...weird! see pic.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: geribeau
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop before our honeymoon in Hawaii started. We stayed there three nights, just enough time to get used to West Coast/US time. The hotel was great, the staff very helpful, the food and drinks delicious. BUT, it was very, very noisy. You could hear everything in the rooms around you and we had the feeling a jazz band was playing in our room on our last night. Other than that, very entertaining stay.

Reviews.Title: “ikea knockoff heaven”
Reviews.Author: Jahney
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to take my husband to this Hotel selected by bid on Priceline for Father's Day. I read the negative reviews , but kept hope that a four star hotel would be great , especially for one night. The room is sparcely decorated with Ikea look low flat peeling painted dark mahogany (mostly just brown) furniture (including the King bed). The rooms are quite dreary & the hallways very dark. The small TV is located on a small painted stand too far away from the bed for the size of the screen. The concrete bathroom floor is in need of much repair & black stain removal. The shower door covers only half of the tub, making for a very wet floor when you get out of the shower. I wondered why such an old ( supposedly historic) hotel would remodel the rooms and hallways as it did. Modern day bad Ikea. The main lobby & check in floor (they are seperate) give the impression of great & elegant things to come. The main lobby is extremely dark. The 24 hour eatery , too, is dark. You are greeted by a glued on menu on a table that indicates that this is just a burger joint with no prices listed except for "$1.50 for extra cheese". There is no self parking, so don't forget anything & have to run back to your room. You will have to turn your keys over to the Valet & wait for your car to be returned after the few minutes it took for you to get what you wanted. You must pay for overnight parking too @$28.00. I apologized to my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful, awful!!”
Reviews.Author: Elysium73
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights - final stop on a great honeymoon, on the way back to the UK from Fiji. Chose the hotel because we were expecting a little bit of Old-Hollywood chic, and because of it's central location. Room was tiny by American standards. Particularly the bathroom which more closely resembled one from a Japanese capsule hotel. Room was decorated with a frankly disgusting large canvas photograph. Walls were paper-thin (we could hear conversations in the room next door), bed and pillows weren't particularly comfortable (and my partner swears there was bed bugs due to the mysterious bites she kept waking up with), though the TV had a good selection of channels. The hotel istself is so dark and dingy. Even with blazing sunshine outside, it's very gloomy in the lobby. It's also very noisy and busy; there always seemed to be something happening. The doors are also patrolled by angry doorman, who on more than one occasion prevented me entrance into my own hotel! It felt like tryng to get into a trendy nightclub at times. Worst experience by far was on our last night (hoping to get a good night's sleep in preperation for an 11 hour flight!). Having played host to a high-school prom, the hotel obviously allowed a load of the recent graduates to rent rooms. Cue a night of screaming, banging, singing, running around corridors, etc. I've stayed in numerous hotels around the world, and never experienced noise like it. Even my university halls were quieter. At 3am, I finally caved and rang the front-desk. The phone rang for 5 minutes before finally being picked up - "We'll send someone right up sir" - which of course they didn't. It got to 4am when I eventually went out into the corridor myself to try and reason with them. In fairness, they did start to quiten down, but it was a draining and restless night to say the least. Ironically, despite the dark gloom of the main hotel, the rooms are suprisingly and dissapointingly bright at night. A combination of the cheap curtains, and the fact a spotlight shines directly at the windows... used to highlight a 50-foot high fashion advetrtisment emblazoned on the side of the building. That, in itself sums up the general cheap and tacky feel of this hotel. A hotel with a great legacy destroyed by pretentious owners. Avoid like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel & Nice pool”
Reviews.Author: GreatDaneDanmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt for 2 days while on a vacation in CA. I booked our room online at Expedia.com in the morning before leaving S.Barbara, and had no problems checking in. We got a nice room on the 10th floor (see pictures & video). The room was spacious and clean, with a confortable bed, very quiet ( can be very noisy around the pool) and with a great view. We had no problems finding a nice spot at the pool and the service was ok... had no problems getting drinks from the bar. Around 7PM they shut down the pool for a private party. We tried to have dinner at the hotel restaurant, but they could only offer us a table at around 10 PM so we decided to eat elsewhere. Valet parking worked fine every time we needed our car ( waited about 5-10 minutes) , but the night they had the pool party was total chaos !!! Internet connection was speedy and although there was no WI-FI at our room, they provided an ethernet cable at the reception free of charge which was a nice touch. I would not have any problem to come back again, and can recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrlLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: You can't even go to the hotel pool bar if you are guest. They kick you out of the swimming pool for private parties. They tell you all the bars are not associated with the hotel although they are listed as "amenities" on their website. the make reservations and don't hold them. TERRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!!! TERRIBLE DOOR MEN!!!!!!! TERRIBLE EXCUSES and ABSOLUTELY NO CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! Aren't hotels supposed to make you feel WELCOMED?”
Reviews.Author: bleeee
Reviews.Content: The Reader's Digest version: BAD SERVICE, DARK, OBNOXIOUS, PRETENTIOUS. JUST HEAD TO THE VICEROY SANTA MONICA FOR A BETTER TAKE ON HIP LUXURY. The long, whiny version: I live in Laurel Canyon and booked the Roosevelt for a girl's night out at Teddy's and a hotel stay while my friend was visiting from Seattle. I even called to make sure that Teddy's would be open and that we, as hotel guests, would be able to get in to the famously hard-to-get-into club. After being downgraded to a dumpy dark room with a view of the airconditioners upon check-in (the $350 room we booked a month prior was no longer available because we were trying to check in after 3:00 PM -- it was 3:30), we found out Teddy's wasn't even open that night, there was a really obnoxious, frat-style 20-something party going on at the pool (which required a neon green wristband) we could attend up until 6:00, but then even the front desk people could not tell us if we'd be able to get into our own hotel pool after 6:00 PM that night. None of this was ever communicated when I booked it. Let's just say the Roosevelt is all about making you feel excluded. We were there one hour and checked out and headed to the Viceroy in Santa Monica. So happy we did. THE VICEROY WAS PERFECT! Hip for people over 25. Gorgeous, fresh, bright, fun decor and great service! Great margies, too.

Reviews.Title: “Young and trendy vibe combined with historic ambience”
Reviews.Author: PopArtist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in mid-May with a couple of other gals, I won this on a Priceline bid at a great price. I was excited about staying here but also had a little trepidation because of its young and trendy reputation, and we were neither that young and maybe only slightly trendy. While it does live up to that reputation, my trepidation turned out to be unfounded, fortunately. We arrived at the valet parking and the valets did everything valets should do - open doors, unload the luggage - and did it cordially. I went to the check in desk - the two gals there seemed cooly efficient but without much friendliness. The guy that checked me was more pleasant, a brief credit card glitch was handled quickly and without fuss. We needed, and got a deluxe two queen bed room on the 4th floor of the main building (the only two bed rooms are deluxe queens in the main building), but were told there wasn't room for a rollaway. I think we could have squeezed one in but it would have been tight. The room was a decent size, not very large or small. It had a desk with vase and (fake) flower, a TV stand/cabinet, nightstand, and a mini-bar refrigerator. Fortunately the mini bar didn't have those motion sensors so we could put other stuff in it. Although we didn't consume anything from the mini-bar, the prices were pretty decent for a hotel. The nightstand was a little beat up but otherwise the furnishings were in good shape. There was also a CD player which was good for us as it was kind of a musical trip and we had CDs with us to get in the mood. The room's color scheme was in chocolate brown/ grey/light beige, cooly stylish. The room came with a pill bottle on the nightstand filled with beige and white M&Ms. There were two phones in the room, but one didn't work. I liked the bathroom a lot - while it wasn't very large (about the size of one in an old city apartment) I liked its style, and it had nice toiletries. The view from our room wasn't much, but at least there was somewhat of one - I wasn't expecting much of one because I'd Priceline'd it. Service was good - they handled getting our luggage from car to room and requests for things such as extra towels and glasses (there were only two of each) were handled promptly. One thing that didn't work (or barely did) - the in-room wireless internet. I don't know if we were in a dead spot or if it's like that throughout the hotel. However, there are two countertop laptops connected to a printer in the check-in lobby, use is complimentary. Would've been nice to have had stools to sit on while using them, rather than stand. The common areas of the hotel are dark - very dark, particularly the main lounge/restaurant area. A bit of a pity as it was harder to see the classic old details in the interior architecture. We did eat a late lunch at the hotel's gourmet burger restaurant, 25 Degrees, and I must say that was a delicious, messy burger and great chocolate milkshake. The pool area was very nice - while we didn't swim in it, we went to the pool bar on a quiet Monday night, which made for a mellow time relaxing poolside on the chaises having a couple of (pricey) drinks. The bar hostess was very nice as well. In all, it was a nice experience staying here, feeling somewhat pampered - I'd do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much Evrything that You Read About this Place is True”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasFan007
Reviews.Content: I booked this place through quikbook and got a great deal. We arrived at around 10 PM on a Saturday Night! I too was going to cancel my reservations after reading some of the negative comments. Here are the facts; If you are a guest, you will always be able to have your car parked here whether or not the lot is closed for non-guests. The staff here is very friendly and accomodating, (with no attitude). Since it was a warm Satuturday Evening, the Pool party was in full swing. The pool area was busy but not rowdy. We had a cabana room with a King Sized Bed that was facing the street so it was quiet. You need a key card to access the hallways of the hotel, so the room areas were very quiet, (even near the cabana). The rooms of the hotel are very dark. I needed a flashlight to see the thermostat! My room was decent sized but only had one small bench to sit on. I also did not like the fact that I needed to call room service if I wanted some ice because there are no ice machines for guests of this hotel. To be honest, this is not my kind of hotel, (I later stayed at the Century City Intercontinental) but I have no major complaints. If I got a good deal, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hurry Up and Wait at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: SFGuy35
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is known for being a bit of a Hollywood scene (or at least it was a year ago) which does not interest me, so I wouldn't have stayed there had it not been for a good deal through a business associate. But I was intrigued to see the property. First of all, arrival is a nightmare. The valets were so behind on a Saturday afternoon that traffic was backed up all the way down the side street next to the hotel. After waiting for a minute I swung around and parked on Hollywood Boulevard. The line at reception was 20 people long, and took forever -- one gets the feeling the young women working the desk were not hired for their brilliant interpersonal skills. Over to the elevator, and there's a crowd there as well. One of the two elevators is broken, and people are waiting up to a half hour for a lift. Finally making it to the room, and yes, it's nice -- due to a problem with the reservation I've had to get a nicer room (long story and not the hotel's fault), and it's quite the space -- two bathrooms, a sitting area, all very well designed, a step up from the cheese-modern Standard. But then I open up the laptop to get some work done and the complimentary WiFi is barely functional -- a website takes 5 or 10 minutes to load, if it loads at all. It was like that all weekend. I went to check out the fitness center, but even though it was mid-afternoon, it seemed closed, and very small. The party scene around the pool was amusing (if a little crowded for someone just interested in a swim). Every girl was a Hollywood proto-starlet, every guy was a steroid-enhanced dude in a baseball cap. Getting my car back, even though it was parked right there in the parking lot, was a nightmare -- a line for the valet window, then a giant crowd of angry people outside, and it took about 45 minutes. I learned quickly to avoid Hollywood Boulevard which was always snarled with traffic, and just walking to the Hollywood and Highland mall to buy a swimsuit was a challenge. Again, the room itself was lovely, with a large bed and a great shower with nice soaps and stuff. Rowdiness on lower floors (and especially around the pool) seemed like it would have been a nightmare for anyone wanting to sleep, but I didn't have a noise problem, other than the deafeningly loud fan that I couldn't figure out how to shut off until I called the front desk the next day (hint: it was the giant switch in the circuit breaker). So, if I was paying full price, I'd never, ever stay here again. While the infrastructure and design is nice, the service level is nonexistent, and every aspect of the hotel is geared towards a "scene" not a happy traveler.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Unique Place”
Reviews.Author: truprunbike
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed here May 14th-18, and loved just about everything about it. We pulled up in our rental car and saw there was a Ferrari and a Bently in front of us at the Valet. ($28 a day though) We tried to checkin at 3 which is their checkin time, but they werent ready. They offerred us a smaller room, but we waited till 4:30 by the pool for our room. (I usually would have asked to see the manager for an upgrade, but i argue for a living, and didnt feel like getting started on my vacation). The front desk was nice, but maybe a lil snobbish, but that could just be hollywood. The Valet, Doormen, Maids, and Bellboys always said hello and had a smile on their face. We stayed on the 10th floor and had a pretty nice room. The bed was very comfortable, but the TV was about 10 years old, but we werent there to watch TV. I think on alot of the rooms, they converted 2 rooms into one large one because it was a somewhat strange layout, but it was a large room. The location is absolutely perfect for everythig in hollywood, restaurants, shops, tours, bars. Its all right outside the frontdoor, or even inside the hotel. The pool was gorgeous. Never had a problem getting a lounge. Drinks were very expsnsive there, so we went to the store down the street and bought a 12 pack and brought that but we didnt see anyone else doing that because everyone else there seemed to have no budget. The Dakota restaurant inside was very good, a lil pricey but we enjoyed the experience. The burger place was also a lil pricey, but it was the best darn burger i have had at a restaurant. Teh hotel is a lil bit older, so we did hear quite of bit of hall noice in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staffs are bunch of posers”
Reviews.Author: NYSpiffy
Reviews.Content: It was the worst hotel experience we had. We traveled a lot and only stayed at great hotels. I thought for the amount of money they charged and the location, it can't go bad. So wrong! Hotel staffs were rude, unhelpful, had no idea of what they were doing. Concierge was too busy booking her own gigs and told us that she had no time to help us. Front desk missed our wake up calls and could not find a package that was sent to us. Cracks at the bathroom wall. Loud noises from the hallway at 3 am in the morning. Should I go on? Pelnty of nice hotels in the area, never stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but sleazy billing department...”
Reviews.Author: Angelina628
Reviews.Content: Check your bill!! We loved the hotel and took full advantage of the wonderful ambiance- lunches for four and numerous rounds of drinks by the fab pool, room service, etc.... so we were expecting quite a large bill. We didn't expect being double billed for the lovely room and while rushing to the airport, we hadn't noticed until reviewing the bill in the car. Numerous calls to the hotel to address the situation have resulted in no return phone calls. Great hotel, but not at twice the room rate that we were expecting and quite horrible customer service in our attempts to rectify it. It put a huge damper on an otherwise wonderful stay- and we were planning to return often, as our son has moved to LA. There are other hotels...we'll be finding them.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thinklinz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt in December 2005 for the first 3 days of our honeymoon. I can honestly say that i am quite shocked at some of the negative comments written about this hotel. We could not fault it in any way. We had a fab room which we were upgraded to, the reception staff were great, really friendly - once they knew we had just got married in Las Vegas they insisted on upgrading us! They were really friendly and helpful. The hotel itself was lovely, very trendy, and we really got the feeling that we chose the best hotel to stay in Hollywood. There was a real buzz about the place. The only thing that was a little dissapointing was the fact that for two days of our stay the pool area was closed off, because there was some celebrity resident - but hey we were in LA baby!!! It all added to the atmosphere of this wonderful hotel, right in the heart of Hollywood! Please stay here... FAB!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MillerCorona
Reviews.Content: We were scared when we read all the reviews of the Roosevelt - this hotel is defintely a party hotel - but we liked it overall -we stayed in 2 Cabana rooms - one facing the Tropicana Bar and the other facing the street - the Tropicana bar is open daily until 2am and so if you do not like noise, do not stay in one of these! The Cabana room facing the street was fine in terms of noise.. Staff was really friendly and helpful. The concierge booked us a great tour of the hollywood homes and also got us into Spago's- which was AMAZING - Overall - the hotel has a really nice atmosphere- very dark - but the lobby is all lit up with candles - its very nice - the Cabana rooms were nice and the toiletries were amazing. The 25 degrees restaurant was actually very good - we didn't eat burgers but we had grilled cheese and other things and it was good. Overall we were very hapy with the hotel - it was clean, people were friendly and we had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “loved this place”
Reviews.Author: sunline
Reviews.Content: my wife and I spent 5 nights at the Roosevelt in match 2007.We were worried because we had read some negative comments, but wondered what the hell the people were on about when we got there. Check in went smoothly and the staff were very friendly and helpfull, from check in, to the concierge, to getting an iron delivered to our room. Room was on 13th floor, was agreat size with a great bathroom and the most comfy bed we have ever slept in. Had great view from our room looking over chinese theatre and the hollywood sign. Everything is on your doorstep, from in and out burgers, yum, to a myriad great restaurants, and the best discount shoe shop in LA just one block behind the hotel. would recommend staying here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but not a World beater”
Reviews.Author: SignorSummer
Reviews.Content: I just spent five nights in a Studio Suite on the tenth floor of the Roosevelt. It cost around $370 per night. I was there on business, so the first thing I wanted to do was go online, but the wi-fi in the room wasn't particularly dependable. So I settled into what was a fairly well-appointed room. Two bathrooms, a very comfartable bed, lounge space with a sofa separated from the bed by a wooden screen. The room was quiet, but luckily the poolside bar was buzzy, if pricey. I've partied at the Standard on the Sunset Strip before, but the Roosevelt apparently now rivals it as one of the spots to head for in Hollywood. Paris and Lindsay weren't about, but there was a decent atmosphere and a smattering of poseurs. Because of that, don't stay in one of the surrounding Cabana rooms if you want to get any sleep. Room service was prompt, friendly and efficient, as were the front desk staff. Taxis wait on the street so you don't have to and I can't comment on the restaurants as I didn't use them.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here a while ago... was a little bit disapointed”
Reviews.Author: jetlagnow
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed here in a while, but I did a couple years ago and was sort of disappointed. The hotel itself has an incredible history (with the Academy Awards having been here for many years) and its fun to just drop by the hotel lobby and walk around or get a cocktail at the lobby bar and soak up the atmosphere. But when I stayed here one night, I was given a room out by the pool. The room was not very clean and the pool area was noisy (partiers walking out there late into the night). It is a beautiful hotel on the exterior, but I was underwhelmed by this bare bones hotel room. The sheets were "itchy". Don't know why. Didn't sleep well. I expected a romantic, old fashioned Hollywood Inn that had that 30s-40s retro feel with very clean rooms. Instead it was more of the kind of "party" room you would get in Palm Springs near the pool area of a small to midsize hotel during Spring Break. I'm sure the hotel probably has other rooms that are more what I was thinking of. But I was slightly disappointed anyway. The hotel restaurant has ugly decor that looks like something someone's grandmother picked out. Not retro and not period style, like it should have. Food was over-priced and mediocre. They need to develop the lobby bar area into a more user-friendly part of the hotel. It's too small. They should spritz up the outside of the hotel with fresh paint and some cool old-style awnings. Class it up a bit. And retro-fy the rooms back to the old style.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaSheba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for nights and loved it. We got the Cabana Room Balcony which overlooked the pool and Tropicana Bar. We booked directly and paid $259 + valet. Unsure if it is a good deal but after staying in New York hotels, we were happy with the price. We found the room modern and tastefully decorated. It was large too. Plasma tv was small but suffice. Toiletries from Fresh (Paris) and cookies on the turndown service was a nice touch. The hotel lounge and lobby dark but adds to the seductive and sophisticted atmosphere. Beautiful Chesterfield chairs and lounges, and leather papasan chairs! We loved the decor even though other reviewers have found it depressing. The staff were really friendly and helpful in a waiter in the dining rooms in particular, was charming! We had a wonderful breakfast one morning. A bit pricey but you have to treat yourself sometimes! The servings are generous anyway. I recommend the pineapple roasted french toast! Tropicana Bar was dead and perhaps is so on weekdays. Too bad the weather was not warm enough to have a swim as they have a fantastic pool. While we were there, CSI Miami was being filmed in the pool area. We snuck a peek and was tempted to run down and ask for autographs! Could not ask for a better location! The Chinese Mann's Theater is right accross the street and there is a shopping mall with several restaurants. The pharmacy around the corner (to the left and across the street) has some groceries. If you want a cheap meal, we went to across the street one morning to Shelly's Diner for breakfast, where they shot Million Dollar Baby.

Reviews.Title: “Party here, but don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mrwolfinca
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an overnight trip to LA to see Wicked at the Pantages. Luckily the play and theater were great, because the hotel was NOT. To sum it up --- the Hollywood Roosevelt is a 4 star location to hang out, drink at the bars, eat at the restaurants, and do some celebrity sighting, but it is a 2 star hotel when it comes to room quality. Our room was TINY! The rooms I stayed at in hotels in Europe were MUCH larger. They need to bite the bullet, and half the number of rooms at the hotel, but knocking down walls and combining two rooms into one. They had to shave the bathroom door down to get it to swing past the toilet. There were no sheets on the bed. The carpet in the hallways was musty and wet. The decor in the room was depressing and strange. I don't really enjoy looking at a huge fisheye view of an androgenous 70's glam rocker staring at me when I'm supposed to be on a romantic night out. The dark look in the lobby, restaurant, etc.. works. It doesn't work in the room. This place needs a serious makeover. I got my room on priceline, but I still think I overpaid. I would not pay over $100 a night for this place. It IS in a great location though. Across the street from Mann's Chinese theater and the Kodak Theater and shopping centers. You can walk out the front door onto the Hollywood walk of fame and other Hollywood tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: coolchickie76
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights Feb 20-22. Price awesome on Priceline!The hotel staff were all very nice and soooo helpful. The girls at the front desk were very pleasant which was a nice change from other hotels. Andrea, the concierge, was also great and she actually seemed to want to help and was always smiling. She recommended a restaurant Bella's which was down the road from the Roosevelt. It was Italian and me being Italian I was a little nervous b/c it was right on Hollywood Boulevard, I was thinking tourist trap. But it was really good and the prices were reasonable. So thanks Andrea on that call. The lobby and the halls were very dark like other reviewers have stated but it wasn't bad, it just seemed swanky to me. The elevators sucked though, they took forever (but no big deal, we were on vacation). One night all the keys didn't work in the whole hotel but the staff were very helpful and apologetic so it wasn't that big a deal. They had a glitch in their electronic system. Rooms were fine, no complaints other then sink leaking in bathroom. Beds comfy and rooms were big enough for us. Wi-Fi fine from where we were in our room (408). Not much to talk about, just a normal room, nothing over the top! No ghost stories here, even though I was freaked out before we went from reading other stories. I just was scared a little when I heard any noise. But my son (who we didn't tell that it was "haunted") told me that in the middle of the night, on his way back from the bathroom he thought I was standing by the tv but then realized I wasn't standing there. That freaked me out just a bit so who knows!!! Bars at the hotel were okay but VERY expensive---2 drinks $27.00 (and they were not big at all, a couple sips you're done)!!!! We tried to get into Teddy's (where the celebs go) and the girl at the door was verrrrrryyyyyyyy mean and just looked at us like we weren't there. The guy said it was for Guests and reservations only! We asked about reservations and he said they need to be made 2 weeks in advance which I'm sure is a lie. The fact is if you are not a celeb or millionaire you aren't getting in! Tropicana Bar was dead, not too many people there but I hear it becomes one of the hot spots during the summer. It was pretty nice there with the pool and some fire pits (I suggest bringing your own drinks in if you could, because atmosphere was cool and no one where you walk in so you can save yourself a buck making the drink in your hotel room first then just hanging out there).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieCincinnati
Reviews.Content: Great Location! Would definitely stay again! My husband and I were very pleased with this hotel. The best part about it was definitely the location. It’s right on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. As soon as you walk out the front door you see the stars on the sidewalk. It’s also steps away from the Chinese Theatre and the Kodak Theatre, where you can see a great view of the Hollywood sign. There’s a lot of good shopping and restaurants nearby too. If the main point of your trip is to see Hollywood, you probably wouldn’t even need a car (and could avoid the steep price for valet). Jimmy Kimmel Live is filmed right down the street and they give away free tickets when you walk by. The hotel itself is obviously very old, but has undergone several renovations. The rooms are decorated very modern with unique artwork. I guess because the hotel was built so long ago the layout was a little strange – you had to walk through the closet to get to the bathroom. The bathroom was very small but was sufficient. There was little furniture in the actual room – you either sat on the bed or on the one desk chair. There were two big windows which made the room look bright and cheery. One small annoyance was that our room faced Hollywood high school and the band was practicing on our first night, but it wasn’t too bothersome. The only thing I would say needed improvement in the room was the bed linens or actually lack of linens. It might sound petty to some but there was no top sheet on the bed and the comforter had a couple stains. Apparently there are several stories of ghosts at this hotel but luckily (or unluckily depending on your viewpoint) we didn’t run into any! The lobby is extremely dim with candles lit all around giving it a somewhat spooky feeling (especially if you read the ghost stories before you go!). I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Hollywood who wants to be in the heart of it all! We booked our room on a name your own price website and got a great deal (I was shocked it was accepted!). I’m not sure the rooms are worth the actual prices I’ve seen on other websites ($200-$250) so I would check around for the best price before booking!

Reviews.Title: “awful celebrity flophouse”
Reviews.Author: rsq
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Roosevelt with great anticipation. I was staying there on business and was promised that it was THE place to stay in Hollywood. I guess if you're a 21-year-old celebrity wannabe, the numerous discomforts wouldn't deter you. In no particular order, here are my complaints: *hard-to-navigate entrance with numerous steps to the reception desk *completely inept "posers" at the reception desk *waited hours after the normal check-in time for our rooms *common areas so dark you think you're in a cave--even in daytime *run-down room with worn-out, unglued carpeting, sloppily dripped paint on the walls, cheap furnishings, and zero charm *scary back hallway in room (my coworker had this too, and he's a large, generally fearless guy) that made me feel as if I had to check all the hiding places every time I returned to the room *drunk person asleep in front of my door at 1 am

Reviews.Title: “Billy Bargain”
Reviews.Author: flygirl1304
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, booked on priceline "Name your price" for only $70, it was everything and more. Couldn't have got a better bargain. Great Location, just opposite Mann's. Near Melrose for shopping. Great atmosphere, history, dark lighting, Marilyn's mirror, the lobby area's huge leather couches. Staff were really helpful, have nothing bad to say at all!!! Would recommend to anyone, as long as dark lighting doesn't bother you................

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel, lots of history, prefer the pool-area rooms”
Reviews.Author: FreddieBSeattle
Reviews.Content: Overall, I loved this place - for the decor and ambiance - and I loved being here. I found the front desk folks a little snobby, but the bar staff both in the big room and by the pool was really nice. You can't beat the main, candle-lit room with its big, comfy leather couches as a place to hang out with someone else (however, you can beat the drink prices!). I love the history of the hotel (1st Academy Awards held here, etc). My room by the pool (room 121) was cool, slightly dark but moody, with a Sharp flat-screen TV with pay-per-view movies, comfy bed and bedding, good toiletry products, Bose CD player/alarm clock, and the New York Times brought to the room each morning. The chairs by the pools are very comfy, with the oversized fitted towels on each one. The pool is amazing looking. Valet parking is $23/day and includes unlimited in-out priveledges. That's your only hotel parking option. TIPS: 1. Stay in a pool-area room. The hotel rooms in the main tower aren't as interesting in their design. Staying by the pool makes you feel like you're in a small, trendy boutique hotel, plus gives you access to the pool bar if it's really hopping. If you need the space, you can stay in a big suite in the main tower, but then it has the "big hotel " feel. 2. I stayed in a room that didn't face the pool. This was cheaper, and would be much quieter in the heat when the bar is hopping. 3. Eat a (expensive) burger at 25 degrees, but split the fries (and you could easily split the huge burger, too). Otherwise, you're in for a huge check. For cheaper eats, Mel's Diner is close by. 4. Have a drink by the pool! So swanky. 5. Book directly with the hotel. They had access to room options that weren't on any travel websites, and my rate was cheaper than the rate a friend paid on Orbitz (PLUS they didn't have my friend's room). I'm sure some have good web-booking experience, but in my experience the only way to really know they'll have your room is to book directly. I buy plane tickets on Orbitz, but book hotels directly for the piece-of-mind. 6. There's a liquor store one block away, which will give you drinks in your room much cheaper than the minibar! GRIPES: 1. I had trouble connecting to the hotel's free wifi, but I was able to get onto someone else's open wifi, so all wasn't lost. The front desk did offer to give me a cable so I could plug into the wall for internet access. 2. VERY small hang-up closet. Four full-sized drawers, but maybe enough space to hang up 12 shirts (the hang-up closet is about 18 inches wide - so if I wasn't travelling alone...) 3. No hooks on backs of doors or on walls for quick hangup of clothes, etc. 4. Desk chair is modern looking, but not soft to sit on. It needs a cool cushion on top of it. 5. My friend's mini-bar wasn't restocked quickly, even after we requested it. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Cool place”
Reviews.Author: aostevenson
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Los Angeles is not your typical American style chain hotel. Dark and mysterious. My room on the third floor was a little depressing but I promptly upgraded to a room on the 11th floor with a nice city view. The staff was extremely friendly and attractive. There is a similar, less expensive hotel in downtown Los Angeles called The Figueroa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Poor Staff”
Reviews.Author: emmalouise76
Reviews.Content: Checked in on the 30th for 3 nights. We really excited about celebrating the NYE here as we had received information from the Hotel the party would be massive. Anyway, upon check in we had to change room as the twin room was tiny - small enough you could not swing a cat and there was mould in the bathroom. They showed us another room which again was very small and again complained. We later received an upgraded room which was an extra $75.00 a night, and considering the bigger room etc we did not mind paying this. We then thought as we had not booked direct with the hotel and had paid vast cheaper rates that are why they tried to fob us off with a small, dingy dark room. Anyway, the staff was very relaxed and like most state on here are only there to help the real celebrities. However, the bar staff at the Tropicana Bar were lovely and this is where we spent most of our time. Drinks are a little over priced, but you are in the middle of Hollywood and the view from our room could not be better. As we opened the curtains what do we look at - nothing but the Hollywood sign. I had also been advised that the tickets for the NYE party were going to be $50.00 we nearly got charged $100 but got that down to $75.00 and since I have sent them the email confirming we would be charged $50.00 and since had the refund. Check your bill throughly upon departure. Due to the downs there were all the ups too and we did spot a celebrity or 2 here, but don't expect to get near to Teddy's - A listers only and you would be lucky even to find the entrance. One last thing, it is true that there are the ghosts of the Roosevelt Hotel, try standing in the Blossom Room in the dark on your own - you will soon realise it is true!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pool party views are amazing”
Reviews.Author: MutleyDog
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a sunday and our room wasn’t ready so we were told to go sit by the pool and have a drink … oh my god … Each Sunday there is a ‘pool party’ which basically involves the best looking and richest teenagers / 20 somethings from LA getting drunk and throwing each other in the pool … I tell you, some of the ladies looked outstanding in their bikinis ….. anyway … I digress … … the hotel was fabulous … very modern, great décor, fantastic location .. our room overlooked the Hollywood sign and the Chinese theatre and we walked out directly on the Hollywood walk of fame. LA is so big you need to stay in a couple of hotels really …. We ate in Beverly Hills most evenings, which is about a 20 min cab ride away …. Valet parking was great. Pool was great. Drinks were ‘city’ prices, but still great Overall ..pretty damn good.

Reviews.Title: “Embarassingly horrible experience.”
Reviews.Author: mf90210
Reviews.Content: Went to the Hollywood Roosevelt for New Year's at the Dakota restaurant. They advertized a spectacular prix fixed dinner on New Year's Eve and we were told that the price was $100.00 per person. When we arrived, we were warned by the parking valet that 1000 people were expected to show for the huge party and that the night might not be as expected since we were a couple in our fifties. We explained that we had to access our dinner reservations and gave up the car. The "spectacular" dinner was a tiny appetizer that could easily fit on one forkful. The waitress said it was foie gras but I am very familar with foie gras and the appetizer I ate was only pate'. My date had soup which was the only decent appetizer on the menu. For the main course, the menu said that one choice was a 2 1/2 half pound lobster out of the shell. Again, the portion was only 2 or 3 forkfuls with no vegetable or potatoe or salad. My date's dinner was 2 tiny lamb chops undercooked with no sides. We were both very hungry when dinner was over and ate the desert which we normally pass on. We each ordered only one glass of wine during dinner and when the bill was presented, it was $550.00. We questioned the manager on such a gross discrepancy of what we expected and we were told that there must have been a "miscommunication" as dinner was $200.00 per person and an $85.00 gratuity was included in the total cost. I was so embarrassed for my date who was visibly upset but being the gentleman he is, paid the bill without contest. He did tell the manager that the dinner was certainly not worthy of 200.00 but she just shrugged her shoulders. We then went to the "party" at the pool. Amazingly, the door man let us in but for the dozens of young people in line behind us who paid $100.00 just to get into the party (that offerred a fee for service bar), the dorrman told all of them that the party was filled to capacity and he couldn't allow any more bodies in there. People began to loudly protest, but the doorman just shrugged and said, "Sue me." The blatant disregard for custormer service, the grossly unacceptable dinner, and the exhorbitant fees connected with this evening should be a warning to anyone who is even considering dining, visiting, or staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smitten by the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: bryncellen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt in a Cabana room for five evenings in late November. Generally, a very jolly experience -- our room had a patio which opened onto a lushly landscaped pool area which has (at least for a New Yorker) a snazzy Hollywood kind of atmosphere. The historic rooms on the main floor are architecturally striking -- and for us, at least, the dark lighting enhanced the hotel's overall

Reviews.Title: “are you kidding”
Reviews.Author: nytro1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so dark and dreary--they should be paying you to stay there. I am a travel agent and recently stayed here for one evening to see the Lion King down the street. First, you arrive by the back door because the front door is normally blocked off because something or someone is across the street at the Kodak (Jay-Z) on my trip. You had to walk down into a real dark reception area to get signed in. The employees are okay but not so smart--I was told that Sunset Blvd was blocked off for the Hollywood Christmas Parade (Five days later). The rooms are also dark. Sink cracked, no top sheet, and in the Honor Bar they sell something called the "Shag Bag"-contains condoms and wipes--that pretty much sums up this hotel--

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill fast”
Reviews.Author: jeckle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2005 and although the pool was closed for renovations, we had a nice room overlooking the theatre and felt the ambiance of Hollywood and the price was ok. So we went back again in 2006. We love Hollywood. Or did. Even paid for a Cabana room with a garden view thinking it would be even nicer.Much higher prices too. What a total disaster. The Cabana room was like the black hole of Calcutta. Drab, dark and musty. And the so called Garden had 3 plant pots and a lounger in a 10' x 10' area. The whole place had changed due to new owners. No Charlie Chaplin sitting at the entrance. The restaurant had changed also. The breakfast ho hum. The only thing we enjoyed was the hospitality of the Kiwi girl. I feel sorry for anyone who goes to the Roosevelt expecting to feel like a film star. If you want to stroll across the road to the theatre and Highland on Hollywood then where else can you stay so close. But if you want to enjoy everything about your trip stay somewhere else. We will.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly different.”
Reviews.Author: roo15
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! I stayed for business and found the trendy decor and large plush rooms a pleasure to come back to after a long day. This is not your cookie cutter hotel . It offers cosy duvet's on the bed and W style decor but rooms that are double the size. High service touches included gourmet cookies provided with turndown and each morning providing an East Coast paper for this East Coast Resident (the New York Times). I was reluctant to stay at the hotel given some negative reviews but had no choice as other hotels were booked out. I'm so glad I stayed and shall definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at the Roosevelt!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: waskom2
Reviews.Content: The bell person, Elmo, who was the best part of the stay because of his courtesy, assured me that the hotel had spent in excess of $30M on renovations. I could not understand where this money had been spent. I have stayed in better Motel 6 rooms. I may have been spoiled after just spending several nights at the Westgate in San Diego before checking into this hotel. By the way, when in San Diego, stay at the Westgate--very classy with very courteous and attentive staff. Back to the Roosevelt--save your money and time. There are numerous other hotels within walking distance that appear to be much better. I was completely disappointed and disillusioned by my stay. Stay away!!!! The Roosevelt is a dump!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: glamourpuss1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as a friend recommended it, we found a great deal on a website and paid for the basic room. On arrival we were upgraded to a Cabana Room, I can only describe it as fabulous. You are given a typed sheet of instructions to tell you the dress code for the Tropicana Bar and the admittance policy and the dates during your stay when certain areas of the hotel are closed eg lobby closed for MTV party, that sort of thing. Also on returning at night we had to go past about 5 security people to get to our room but such security is commendable in this day and age. The staff are all very pleasant, the pool is beautiful, they serve complimentary coffee there in the mornings. The restaurant and burger bar look great but as we were in Hollywood we wanted to eat out and about and particularly in the Hamburger Hamlet , only a few doors away, which if you sit in the window is the best location for people watching. Toiletries in the hotel are by Fresh, and the mini bar has great stuff. Given the fact it was $28 for 2 glasses of wine in the Tropicana Bar we tended to use our minibar as a fridge rather than consume its contents. We were erroneously charged for something from the minibar and queried it at checkout but it was immediately removed, no problem at all. Plasma TVs, comfortable beds, the location cannot be beaten. I can't see how it could be improved upon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would stay again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: soleil17
Reviews.Content: We were very hesitant to stay here given the plethora of bad reviews, but we were more than pleased with our stay. We found a booking code on Travelzoo for 119 per night. While this got us the cheapest tower room, the check-in clerk upgraded us to a Cabana Pool Room! The desk and concierge were all very nice and helpful to us. The room was huge and clean with a very comfortable bed and great bathroom. The clerk made it clear upon check-in that as a hotel guest we were permitted to bring up to three guests to the Tropicana Bar. The policy was clearly stated by them and upheld by the Tropicana staff. We decided to go have a drink at the bar and we found all of the staff very nice and courteous. We really don't understand all of the bad reviews about the rude service. We also ate at the in-house Dakota restaurant and absolutely loved it! We each had a Kobe steak and it was one of the tastiest steaks we've ever had in our lives (and we've had Kobe steak in Kobe). The restaurant staff were also friendly. Yes, the lobby of the hotel is dark - but it's massive and Moorish architecture. It's true to its past. It is what it is and we felt it would have been a shame to turn the lights up and ruin the atmosphere and architecture. The hotel has two laptops with free internet connections in the check-in area which we thought was a great nice touch. The hotel is also only about a block from the Hollywood/Highland center and the metro stop there. For all of those who say don't take the metro we disagree! We thought it was great! We took the FlyAway bus from LAX to Union Station and the metro the rest of the way to the hotel. It only cost us $4.50! Two weeks later we stayed at the Hotel Mosaic in Beverly Hills which uniformly receives good reviews on TripAdvisor. We agree that it is a great hotel, but we liked the Hollywood Roosevelt more! All in all we loved it. Maybe the management has gotten the message, or maybe everyone who stays there hoping to see a celebrity and doesn't writes bad reviews. Whatever the reason, we disagree with the bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy!”
Reviews.Author: fatboyonadiet
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but definately aimed at the people with money and young (!). I liked the decor and staff were friendly and nice, the manager incharge of the valet could maybe do with some 'people' skills but all other staff were nice. Room was small but nice and very clean. Be warned mini-bar charges for everything. Location is excellent and the pool area is very very nice. Got a bargain of a price so can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the hotel, location, and the room.”
Reviews.Author: shourick
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite pleasant. The rooms are clean and well appointed. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: larneman
Reviews.Content: I agree 100% with the writer from Ottowa Canada I only wish I had read the review before booking this hotel. The swimming pool is used on Sundays for a private party, hotel guests have to wear an armband and it's impossible to get a seat or a bed, the staff are more interested in the party guests than the hotel guests. Had to wear earplugs because of the air conditioning noise, reported the excessive noise to 3 seperate members of staff, nothing happened. Would not stay again

Reviews.Title: “Quite Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: 2006travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a two night stay in a Garden Cabana room. I was a bit hesitant about our accomodations due to prior reviews, but I was pleasantly surprised. Yes, the hotel is dark and the layout a bit confusing, but afterall this is a modern hotel. This sort of styling isn't for everyone. Our room was clean and had a lovely balcony. Housekeeping and room service answered our requests in no time at all. We had a lovely dinner at Dakota's and easily gained entrance into the Tropicana for after dinner drinks. The drinks are expensive, but it is fun nontheless to peak into the lives of those who want to make it. Whatever that means. Overall, we'd stay at the Roosevelt again. The staff was quite friendly and attentive. Plus the location can't be beat if you are coming into the city for some exploration.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Donohill
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night here and it was fantastic. The rooms , bed linen , bathroom were spotless. The hotel staff were extremely helpful, chatty and polite. The receptionst helped us plan our trip to San Diego and gave us good advice on the drive there. The hotel is centrally located in the centre of the Hollywood and very kiddy friendly !

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: howarth
Reviews.Content: Was looking forward to staying here. When I checked in the room was very dirty. The bathroom had not been cleaned at all. The carpeting looked 10 years old and had not been vacumed. The drinks at the bar average 8 to 10 dollars plus. My two day stay was over a thousand dollar bill. The computer system for the hotel was down the entire stay. Very poorly managed!! The downstairs restaurant and lounge are nice but other than that this hotel is not worth it. You can stay at much nicer Hotels for alot less.

Reviews.Title: “Last 2 reviews got it SO right!”
Reviews.Author: jupio23
Reviews.Content: I can't even begin to tell you how right the last 2 reviews of this hotel are! My husband and I kept saying that something was missing in this uber-trendy hotel and it was the customer service. (And we were trying to figure out what cost us $7 at the mini bar. Thanks Papa for letting us know you get charged for the coffee! I had NO idea!!) The concierge, the front desk and even the bartenders and cocktail waitresses really gave the impression they couldn't be bothered with you. The waitresses will make you wait for your $15 drinks while they finish talking and talking...and talking to each other. I asked the front desk for turn down service when I found out a colleague was getting it with free VOSS water AND cookies and I'll I got was a blank stare and a stammer that they don't do that. After more questioning I finally had someone come up to take care of it. And the staff does not hesitate to tell you when they don't agree with management about the decor (not the best idea to vent to guests about your boss's sense of style!) To be fair though, anyone who does manual labor at the hotel is great! Maids, parking attendants, repair guys were super nice. Don't believe the hype of the brightness of the halls in the website pictures either. It's as dark as can be and for a woman who even thinks to wear heels on the super slippery tile floors, be prepared to walk with caution! If you're not in the "basement" as the prior reviewer called it, you feel like there are very few people around. Hotel floor plan is really off, odd and uninviting. Do yourself a favor, stay at the Renaissance Hotel around the corner next door to the Kodak Theater. You'll get more for your $$

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as you would think”
Reviews.Author: needavaykay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt for 4 nights. Although there are good and not so good things about this hotel it was worth the 150.00 a night that I paid. I was satisified with my stay. The good: Location. Right in the middle of the action. Never got refused admittance to the tropicana bar or pool. Party going on Sat. and Sun. nights and we got in even though we stayed in the tower rooms. Some B list celebs were there. Staff was very nice and never made us feel unwelcome like other reviewers have said. Beds were very comfortable. Air conditioning worked well in our room. Did not hear all the noise everyone else complained about either.Our room also did have a tub. The Bad: Rooms are very small and dark. No room for luggage and we kept banging our legs on the bed frames as we tried to move around. The bathroom is tiny with no room to put your supplies. The shower only had half a door and the water kept soaking the floor. I would stay here again and recommend it to everyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: CaBusinessTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt on business. It was really a grand dissapointment. The room was not clean and the bed noisy and uncomfortable. Parking is a real problem since the hotel valets accept anyone. Expect to wait an hour or two to park at your own hotel during the early to late evening!! The staff did not provide very good customer service. They charged me for a night I did not stay and never returned repeated calls to solve the problem. The quality of food in the restaurant was very low. There are so many better places to stay and eat in LA. Will never stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Non-stop 100% party hotel”
Reviews.Author: www.teamblackout.net
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is run as a nightclub on the weekends. The party features celebrities and LA socialites. For this reason the staff has less interest in the normal guests. I love it.

Reviews.Title: “Papa can you see me?”
Reviews.Author: redinsf
Reviews.Content: $350 and up to stay here? Ridiculous. While checking me in (and out!), front desk staff talked on the phone the entire time as they ran our paperwork. The staff is Beyond snobby. I was given an eye roll when told that I did not have wireless and needed a DSL connection. I was given another eye roll when told I could carry my own luggage (I had a Duffel Bag, okay?). I was beginning to think that the eye roll was an accepted form of Roosevelt communication as written in their handbook. The front desk is somewhat in a basement-ish area. Everything is indeed very dark. Walls are painted black, carpet is grey, and staff wears varying shades of black. Our room was tiny and had an o-so-hip picture of screaming cult women above our bed. I actually thought that was cool, my husband was otherwise spooked. This hotel charges for Everything. Those little packages of coffee next to your coffee maker? Look out for the $3.50 charge (for Each Package!!) on your bill for the seemingly complimentary condiments. Parking will go for $23 a night and will take you half and hour to get your car out. The apologetic parking staff was probably the nicest part of the experience. Shop around, you can get a much better, and much more pleasant, deal for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Place continues to go downhill”
Reviews.Author: MikeGeee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt a couple of times before the renovation and several times after. The renovation was badly needed and even though the rooms are on the small side and kind of spartan, it was a fun place to stay up until about a 18 months ago when the Tropicana (pool bar) got to be the hip place to party. The pool and bar were beutifully renovated, but the majority of the time it's off limits to guests due to various parties and events unless you pay $500-700 for a cabana room. Even then you have to go through the security gauntlet to just get to your room. Many people at the pool as of late are non guests and many lounge chairs are now "reserved". The service has gotten worse and the staff seems to care more about it being a nightclub rather than a hotel. Front desk stafff is hit and miss. Elevators take forever. Parking and entrance is jammed on weekend nights. It's a wannabe W. Better bet is the Rennaisance for a Hollywood stay; good service, nice rooms & staff I recently discovered the Westood area and now stay regularly at the W there instead. The Hollywood W scheduled to open in 2008 will give the Roosevelt a serious run for it's money....

Reviews.Title: “Horrible atmosphere-great location”
Reviews.Author: Hilaire
Reviews.Content: Chose this for its location at the heart of Hollywood and that was ideal for us with a short visit and a teenage son keen to do all the Walk of Fame, Kodak Theatre and El Capitan cinema all on the doorstep. But for all the hype of Oscars etc this hotel totally lacks any sense of style or glamour..The main reception area is fascinating in a gloomy gothic sort of way. A most unwelcoming hotel-gloomy airport style lobby in the basement-we had to ask the huge security guy how to find it. Reception staff very nice but its not an easy hotel to navigate-not least because its so dark everywhere. Confusing layout and anonymous characterless dark grey corridors, with scary unfriendly security men everywhere. A lot of the old character has been "refurbished" away in a dull grey brown minimalist kind of way. however the bed was gorgeous and the pillows and sheets lovely. The bathroom was horrid-poky and dark with a cracked washbasin and hairdryer handle broken. So over priced and disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: PURP
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautifully decorated. It had great restaurants that served great food at reasonable prices. It was in the heart of Hollywood as the stars were right outside the door. The room were lovely and very inviting. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The pool and the pool bar were also up to a high standard. There is not much more I can say but if you are going to Los Angeles this is the hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: MTNZLONDON
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying in the most expensive room at this hotel: a Cabana Room which is near the famed Tropicana Pool and costs $500 a night. What did this mean? This meant that it was an ordeal to get to my room every day, as different 'events' were being held every afternoon. I'm talking NY Bungalow 8 level of bouncer action - they did everything but frisk me. They prevented my partner bringing her friend in to pick up a present from our room. They made me produce ID and my key to walk down the corridor at 2 in the afternoon! Remember - I'm only going from Reception to my room. This would be understandable if Tom Cruise and Katie Holmes were poolside with Paris Hilton and Simon Cowell, but these 'events' seemed to be made up of a crowd of wannabes desperately hoping the next person to walk in was famous on any level whatsoever. The Cabana rooms are small, pokey and dark, with laughable 'patios' and the level of service (apart from the sparkling car valets) is surly at best. Did I mention the rolling hotel power test that meant I had to shower in the dark? A blackout they announced via a note delivered at 5am? And upon my complaint suggested I might like to shave by flashlight? We all know what to expect from hip hotels (poor service, dark rooms, happening bar action), but this place makes the Hudson in NY look like the Four Seasons. And because of its proximity to Hollywood's tourist ground zero it never really manages the full conversion to style hotel. I tried it because I had read good things in various style bibles in the UK, and all the good hotels in West Hollywood were full. Don't make this mistake! Unless you're a REALLY desperate Hollywood wannabe, or you've got a fetish for being near Mann's Chinese and the select audience that brings.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time! But everyone is not equal at the Roosevelt...”
Reviews.Author: Chachagal
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Roosevelt and will definitely come again. The location is perfect, all the cheesy action of Hollywood Bd at your doorstep, and yet inside, a little paradise. The interior design is GREAT! I read some reviews saying it’s very dark, but get over your Hilton, this is a designer hotel and a legendary place! It’s just really lame that the concierge desk is located in the basement and not in the superb historical lobby, which remains empty all the time. We had a standard room and were happy with it, although it was small and not exactly luxurious. Decoration was modern & low-key, Debbie Harry picture above the bed, tiny bathroom, but everything good taste, recent and in good shape. We had a view on the Chinese Theater and never had a noise problem as other guests pointed out on this site. The poolside is exquisite! Lovely food and nice service, excellent music (from Bloc Party to Bob Marley), the perfect oasis after long days of shopping and walking. We particularly appreciated the sophisticated crowd with NO KIDS, this is definitely not a family hotel and we liked that! About the Tropicana Pool Bar (which is basically the poolside after 9pm): there’s an access to the club in the lobby, BUT : If you’re not staying in a cabana pool room but in the tower (understand : the ghetto!), you won’t get in from there. You’ll have to go to the outside entrance and queue just like anyone else! Although we were infuriated by those stupid rules, we decided not to make a fuss about it (because we were on holidays and because getting in a club has never been a problem to us), so we went to that outside entrance and got in without a problem, the host at the door was actually very nice! I guess they have it this way so that the people who rule the club (not the hotel itself but independant promoters) get to approve anyone who gets in. Things were always easy for us because we are young and good-looking, but I understand that other guests that throw a lot of money in this hotel and do not match the sophistication criterias of the club could be turned down, which is unacceptable. Must be young and beautiful to be treated well at the Roosevelt, just like in any trendy and expensive place anywhere in the world! If you know that and fit in, you’ll have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “I quite enjoyed it...”
Reviews.Author: lagunadallas
Reviews.Content: Despite some shaky reviews here, I booked the Hollywood Roosevelt because I wanted something fun for a quick 1-night stay and didn't want to spend $400 on one of the 5-star hotels. It definitely served its purpose well. The location is excellent, though quite the mobbed tourist scene on a summer weekend (as expected). The lobby area might be dark, but it has been very attractively renovated and captures the older feel of the building with a contemporary twist. The service throughout was friendly enough, never rude or snobby, though not of Four Seasons caliber. My room was as expected --- small, rather dark, though clean and nicely renovated. The bathroom was absolutely tiny, which is often the case with hotels in older buildings, and water leaked from a gap between the glass partition at top of the tub and flooded the floor after a brief shower. I had plans all evening and wasn't around to spend time at the Tropicana bar, pool ,or restaurants, though they all looked like a lot of fun. The Roosevelt isn't the best hotel in L.A., but for the $179 I spent, I thought it represented a relatively good value compared to other options on the Westside. I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Only for the Brave!”
Reviews.Author: davsyd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in July. I had the previou reviews, so I was prepared for snooty staff and a very basic room. Upon arrival the doorman offered to take our cases and we told him it was ok, as we did not have that much and he offered again, and one of his fellow staff told him ' They do not want it' , well that started a shouting match between them, I kid not. Very strange, i have never seen anything like it! The check in staff were very friendly, with another check-in counter who was not serving me even asking how I was. Maybe cause I am young in my 20's I fit in with the clique!! The rooms are different from a normal hotel but they were perfectly fine. The beds are EXTRA comfortable!!! The bathroom does have a unusual red light but there is a normal light you can use as well. It is true the lobby is very dark but all we did was walk through it to exit so I do not see the big deal! The pool area has been re-done and looks good. The day we checked out and were waiting to go to airport, they were dozens of young hip guys and girls exiting in their swimwear and receiving their cars from Valet parking, so I presume that there are many people at the pool area not staying at the hotel. Which to me is not right, for as a guest of the hotel you should be able to use the pool when you want and not have it domiated with non-guests. This hotel is definately catered for a younger crowd, as I am 25 I did not mind it. The location is great for Hollywood. I would return to Roosevelt but as for LA, this is my 8th time there and I must say it seems to get dirtier every time. Being from Sydney which is very clean, it is a shock and something that I do not think you can get used to.

Reviews.Title: “loved the atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed here on a recent trip to Hollywood, the atmosphere was great and soooo hollywood... I like the old style Hollywood glam. I felt like a Movie Queen...

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What have they done to this hotel with so much history? I have stayed at this hotel twice before and have always had a nice comfortable time. When I had a short business trip recently, it was logical to stay at a place that I knew I could trust. Big mistake, the moment I walked in, I could tell something drastically had changed. To start of everything was black, the walls, the floor and the staff dressed in black. Felt like I was in a Dracula film with all the gothic furniture. This darkness seems to be a growing trend with some hotels across the States. I could not find my card key in my bag the lobby was so poorly lit and people were almost walking into each other, I kid you not. My room was frightening. The room was black, the bathroom light was red and to top of it. A huge photo of a man with bright blonde hair in a black jumper was above my bed looking down at me. My friend had to cover it for me with a towel, so I couldn’t see it. They charge to for coffee and teas in you’re room too, that’s the first time for me! The only advantages are the great locations near by; if you’re tourist it’s all at your doorstep. None of the staff were rude to me, that’s a plus, but I will never stay here again. It’s a shame because I had a big group of us going next year, but it’s safe to say I will be taking our business somewhere else. It is a shame the hotel has been taken over, it has lost all its glamour and famous history.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, dark, dark”
Reviews.Author: johngie
Reviews.Content: The lobby and main areas of the hotel are unbelievably dark, I mean you can hardly see - I am not sure what ambience they are going for but it would be ok to have darkened sections without turing the entrance hall into such a dreary place. Rooms are very modern and minimalist and quite boring - they are pretty small and don't give you a feeling of comfort. Front desk staff were great, the location is good if you want to explore the Hollywood area. Overall not my type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevelt Hotel is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: AvantGarden
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed 3 nights in the Roosevelt Hotel. It was very clean. The beds were incredibly comfortable. We loved the 'look' and style of the hotel and everything about it. The staff was courteous and friendly. The food was incredible. It is right there on the Walk of Fame. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As other posters have stated, the hotel is very dark. Our room was a dark brown and with hardly any decorations in the room it seemed depressing. Upon arriving, we were told our room wasn't ready and to check back in an hour. We left our luggage with the bell hop and returned an hour later only to be put off again. We waited over 2 hours for our room. While we were standing in the lobby, we overheard another gentlemen tell the desk clerk that he had just checked in, got his key card, and when he went to his room, there were other guests still in it!!! I do not know how his situation turned out. The beds do not have top sheets, but the comforter was nice. There are hardly any plugs, which means tieing up the bathroom while you do your hair. Please be aware that if you use the coffee provided in the room, it is charged to you in ADDITION to the regular room rate. The coffee is NOT included and is considered part of the bar. On one of the nights we stayed, the BET awards after-party was held at the hotel. While that was impressive, it made it impossible for us to leave without breaking through the tight security and standing out like a sore thumb. We tried to leave without walking through the middle of the black-tie event, but they had all the entrances and exits blocked. I even heard someone say, "No, this is not going to happen," when she saw our family standing there trying to find a way out. Her reference was to the fact that other hotel guests like ourselves were not going to be tolerated walking around when all we wanted to do was leave our room and do some shopping. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay at Roosevelt Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I frequently stay in hotels for weekend getaways and I must admit this is the first time I have stayed in a room where I just did not want to be in the room. Generally I enjoy breakfast in bed, but at the Roosevelt I could not wait to get out of the hotel in the morning. To be fair I think whether or not someone likes the Roosevelt depends on what you are looking for in a hotel. So I will list the positives and the negatives. Positives- 1. The front desk was very nice and we were upgraded to the Cabana section of the hotel so we had access to the Tropicana during our stay. I'm not sure what is so great about the Tropicana, but if you are looking for $14 drinks then I guess this is a perk. 2. We had dinner in the restaurant, the food and service were excellent. I ate the veal 2 ways and it was incredible. Negaitves- 1. The airconditioner did not work properly and our room stayed a consistent 79 even though we set the thermostat lower. We were told engineering was working on this, but during our 3 day stay nothing ever changed. 2. The room is very, very, dark. The walls are painted chocolate brown and the lighting is very bad. The unscreened window opens to the street so we did not open the windows. There was not enough light in the room for me to comfortably read a book. 3. You can easily hear you neighbors talking, listening to the radio, or watching TV. 4. The bathroom more closely resembled a jail cell than a luxury bathroom. The room is concrete, the shower is concrete. There is no tub or any hint of luxury. 5. The concierge was not very helpful and insisted that he must make us reservations at restaurants rather than given us some options and letting us make our own decisions. In summary, I would not stay at the Roosevelt again. When getting away with my husband I look for a luxury room and amenitities. It appears this hotel is for people who want to be seen at the pool and the Tropicana bar. The pool is nice, but it does not make up for the lack of quality in the rooms. I would so say the rooms are lower in quality than the rooms in any lower priced chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews posted, I was somewhat skeptical about this hotel. After my stay, I should have listened to my gut instincts. I understand this is considered a "botique hotel." Painting a few walls black and using minimal lighting does not constitute "botique" to me. Rather, the hotel was a glorified Days Inn. The attempts to be "trendy" were silly. A bottle of "M&Ms" by the bed in a prescription bottle to mimic prescription pills was tacky. The room had no chair, only a bed in it. The AC was loud and didn't work well and the room in general was dirty. The pool was quite nice - if you are 23. Overall, the hotel caters to a 20something crowd that does not need/want any comfort during their stay. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Roosevelt Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: bodijeep75
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Roosevelt Hotel. Upon checking into the hotel, we were upgraded to a deluxe room. Pleasant surprise! The room had a nice view of the Mann's Chinese theatre and all the action down below. Room service was prompt and very good. We didn't hear any strange noises this time, but we did capture some interesting orbs on camera. The Tropicana bar by the pool is a must, good people watching spot. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great but expensive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel as I understand it was the venue for the first Academy Awards. Very stately, with beautifully appointed rooms. After a slight hiccup on checkin (they misplaced our reservation) we were appeased with a few drink vouchers redeemable at the Tropicana Bar. Our meal in the restaurant was very expensive with very small portions, something we found very unusual for restaurants in the USA. The location was prime, metro across the road, one stop to Universal Studios. Situated right on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and Chinese Theatre across the road. The staff were very courteous and our concierge Andrea was extremely helpful with tour bookings. Our stay was very comfortable and enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: benducci
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights in May 2006. Initial reception not very good. Could not use air conditioner -very noisy. Clean but small. Good location. First hotel/motel I have stayed in that I had to pay for "coffee in room"-discovered this at check out at extortion prices. Similarly discovered coffee not included in buffet breakfast. Minor issues but irritating to say the least. Valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: choward1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights, the location is fantastic, everything is on your doorstep, couldn't get better. However the hotel is very impersonal, dark (bring a torch for the dining area), the reception staff are distant, not unhelpful but not helpful either!!! The hotel is quiet and really just a place to sleep rather than to relax and people watch. The room was a good size and comfortable but on our last morning we found a cockroach in the bathroom and we were glad we were leaving. The reception sent a member of staff up immediately but were not apologetic, even when we checked out 20 minutes later there was no mention of it even though it was 4.30am when they knew we had rang them about it. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jake029
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in November. Requested a room on a higher floor and after being offered a larger room on the 4th floor, we were eventually found a room on the 11th floor. View was away from the main sights of Hollywood Blvd but still very nice. Room was of a decent size with 2 large beds, TV, CD player, minibar (reasonable prices), tea/coffee making facilities (which you get charged for), safe, plenty of storage space. Bathroom was nice and clean. Plenty of hot water. Only minor complaint was the colours - very dark in the corridor and the lighting did not make it very bright. The room itself was brighter. Excellent location on Hollywood Blvd, close to all the main attractions. Could see pool from room and it looked very nice but never had time to investigate. Would definately stay here again if we wanted to be close to Holywood Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “short on good and long on bad....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went with another couple to the Roosevelt recently. Our suite was pretty nice - a large room with some design-junky furniture overlooking the hills. It had a white leather banquette and a spray-lamp and a lot of interesting art. It was quite a nice room. Got room service once and it was actually very nice and prompt. But the fun kind of ended there; first of all, the other couple booked and paid for a junior suite on expedia.
