Reviews.Content: Myself and three friends stayed at the Hollywood Roosevelt for 3 nights in late September. Due to the previous reviews I wasn't quite sure what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised! On arrival, we went to the lobby (which was around the back of the hotel) which was small, but tastefully decorated. It was kind of annoying having to drag the luggage down stairs to go to the desk however! I was told by the guy on Reception that they were going to give it all an overhaul, as the steps caused a lot of problems. Anyway, my friends and I had booked just a standard room (the cheapest available) and were upgraded by the super-nice front desk staff to a Suite on the top floor! As far as Suite's go, I have had bigger at other hotels but it was still lovely to be upgraded! The room had a living area with a big comfy sofa and armchair, divided bedroom with two Queen Size beds, and two bathrooms. Having two bathrooms between four girls was definately a bonus! One interesting thing I noticed though, is the bathtub in one of the bathrooms appeared to be original despite new tiling and decor. The bathtub was made out of proper tough porcelain, not plastic, and the shape and strength of it, made me think it had a lot of age to it. This said, there was cracks in the porcelain around the plug hole. No big deal. The bathtub still did the job, and I figure it would cost a fortune to get fixed- and it's still better than modern junky plastic ones! The location of the hotel is superb if you want a Hollywood experience. Right in the middle of Hollywood Blvd, across the road from Manns Chinese Theatre and a shopping mall! Seemingly, Hollywood has started cleaning up it's act in the past few years. It isn't as glamorous as it once was, but is making vast improvements. Like I said earlier, the front desk staff were superb, we had some problems with a cab company overcharging us, and the hotel employees helped us out! They were always so friendly, and always remembered us! We dined at Theodores, the restaurant, for Breakfast one morning- and admittedly the waiter was rather pathetic. He tried to overcharge us (the account was added up incorrectly) and I asked to speak to the Restaurant Manager, who apologised and gladly rectified the situation. All in all, the rooms were clean, tastefully (if minimally) decorated, and the service and location was superb. I would definately stay here again! Additionally, when we were staying at the hotel, STING was staying there as well! We never saw him, but knowing we were under the same roof was definately an added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_and_Wendy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt for two days in September 2004 and found it to be a pleasant hotel in a good location. Check-in was efficient and I was offered a choice of rooms. Being from way out of town (8,000 miles out of town), the lady was very helpful and suggested a room on the eighth floor (quieter up there) with a view across Hollywood Boulevard. The room was bright, spacious, modern and comfortable, with plenty of storage space, walk-through dressing room, safe, and nice touches like a coffee percolator. It felt clean and was serviced unobtrusively. My travel agent who booked the room in June told me in July about the renovations and closure of the pool, and they were not a problem. If I'd wanted to use a pool they offered an alternative hotel nearby. I had dinner one evening in the restaurant and, apart from the standard American propensity for rushed meals, it was a pleasant experience - interesting food, friendly and helpful service, a good wine list, and the historic ambience. The only negative experience was on the final day. I'd had my bags collected and stored in the morning, spent a great day at Universal City, then returned to the hotel to pick up my bags and get a taxi to LAX. I think the desk man must have had a deal going with a company on another planet because once he'd phoned for the taxi he made no effort to get my bags, told me there was no hurry, and got on with his work. Meanwhile I watched plenty of empty taxis cruise past the hotel while I waited 40 minutes for mine to arrive. When we got to LAX the driver seemed lost and had no idea where to find the correct terminal. an unfortunate end to an otherwise pleasant stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “oh how it has changed!”
Reviews.Author: iluvla
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at the Roosevelt many times over the years and last year will probably be the last time unless there is a change in ownership.We have seen this once beautiful old hotel,loose all it's character as it was gutted in the name of modernisation.Gone are the comfortable furniture to be replaced by hard,plain and ugly chinese style stuff.We lost count how many times we banged our shins on the awful bed,whose mattress was too small for the frame,and oh so low.The wonderful art deco was replaced by bamboo sticks,but worst of all the lobby was cleared of seating for the guests and hired out to private functions,while guests were driven into what once was the basement and is now the reception area,small and like sitting in a pit,we sat and watched the complaints from other guests fall on deaf ears.It was impossible to sit in the evening and have a drink at the small bar as there were only a few chairs or high bar stools.Front doors were locked every time a private party took over the old lobby so we had to walk around to the back door and dodge cars as we crossed the carpark.The mezzanine,which had once had a display of pictures showing the history of hollywood,was reduced to a drafty open gutted space,said to be a bar one day.. All the friendly staff who had been there for years left,to be replaced by others who seemed more and more stretched to service the private functions rather than the guests actually staying in the hotel. This is a hotel that has completely lost it's way..is it a hotel or a collection of function rooms? What really has angered us is the fact the hotel's website is SO misleading,not a word about the still ongoing building work...it's been at least 3 years now since it started and still isnt completed.We doubt it ever will be.It is sad as we really loved the old Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Mutton dressed as lamb!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 night whilst on our honeymoon and our first impressions were very good, however after a long check in with rude staff we arrived on 4 floor which looked like prison cells, the room was ok apart from the maids trying to get in at 8 in the morning!! Location was good however stayed there 5 days too long.

Reviews.Title: “SUMMER IN HOLLYWOOD”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel on August 1-7. I too was informed at the last minute (when I registered) that the pool & cabana area was under renovation. I booked this package (Summer in Hollywood) a month before getting there. No one mentioned to me that the pool was under renovation. What idiot in hotel management decides to do a pool renovation in August, and then sell a package called, summer in Hollywood. Then I was told that travel websites were sent this information. Funny how the hotel's own website doesn't mention the renovation. And they issued a letter (placed in everyone's room) to all guest apologizing for the inconvience. And no compensation was offered. The least they could have done is offered the guest free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Photo with Charlie is a must”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location was fantastic, opposite the Chinese theatre and Kodak Cinema. The hotel had been updated, but our room which was by the poolside was a bit grubby to say the least. It was supposed to be non smoking but we could smell smoke, perhaps it was the maid! Staff on the whole were friendly and helpful however, do not book trips with them, you'll get a better deal across the road at the Chinese theatre. LA, well worth a visit and this hotel was in the heart of Hollywood, when its refurbishment is complete it may well be worth a revisit or perhaps ask for a room thats not by the pool. The history of the hotel was brilliant, you can imagine those stars of the past walking through it and I think everyone probably has a photo with Charlie Chaplin in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here July 2003. I am a bit concerned about all the bad reviews on this website as we thought the hotel was fantastic!! This hotel was our first stop on a tour of california and nevada and we were waking very early in the mornings from Jet lag. We had a cabana room and were right next to the jacuzzi. It was great to get up at 6am and open the patio door straight into the jacuzzi when noone was around. The breakfast was fantastic and we had the time of our lives.

Reviews.Title: “historic hotel,great location, but:”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed June 17,2004 through June 22 and this hotel was in a great location in hollywood,and it was very historic and interesting place,however the pool area was closed along with the cabana bar area that we were looking foward to that was advertised on all web sites and they put us in a small room at first with a small bed,however they did let us change rooms. some one from the hotel came into our room at 2:30a.m. and scared the crap out of us while we were asleep. also they had NO DRINK MACHINES!!!!!! Everyone there was very nice and courtious,especially the valet people even though it cost $18 a day. I would probably stay there again when the pool is finished.

Reviews.Title: “ha!, what a joke!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: well, i checked in around 4.30 pm into one of the "cabana" rooms, and was told it would be private and quiet, around 10 o'clock that evening the neighbors were rock musicians so i was told they would move me, which they did around midnight., it was so disturbing, these guys next door were on my balcony!!!, they hotel should have comped me, or something, they did nothing except move me into a closet sized room., terrible hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “awful place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel at midnight after a flight from Alaska. Hoped that what I had read up about this hotel it would be so interesting to see where all the famous people and the Oscars were first presented and history. What a disappointment, the staff were non-chalant and uncaring. The first room they showed us was so small we asked for an upgrade which we got. We only stayed a night as we were to carry on with our journey, which was good. The staff were not very helpful at all when we asked for brochures about what to see and places of interest. They gave us a tatty photocopied map and a list of things. Other places we stayed had at least a free book of all the attractions. We heard after we had booked here that it was in a dirty area and tried to change but were unfortunately locked in to the itinerary. We placed our luggage in the bell boy's locker when we vacated the room and went to explore. When we got back to the hotel to catch the shuttle back to the airport we could not find the bell boy and it took several minutes to find someone to get our luggage. The shuttle was late to pick us up also and it was a rush to the airport. At the airport it was terrible, with the checking of the luggage as everything had to go through xray machines, unlocked. We booked out luggage in and then had to take it back to this xray machine. We stood at least for half an hour even more to get through this. We had not much time to get onto the plane for our next destination. I think that the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel is a bit of a dump, even though it is being refurbished. All the things that I had read up on that should have been there had been removed somewhere else. What a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great history”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here in late May very much. The rooms have been remodeled and are very nice, with a sort of funky Asian look. The bathrooms are especially neat. The rest of the building has a wonderful retro feel--they have done a nice job restoring the original decor. The location can't be beat if you are a Hollywood tourist and the history of the place makes your stay so much more interesting than staying in a chain hotel. My only complaint would be the $18 a day charge for parking, although the valet service was very quick and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was comfortable and neat without all the frills. I was a little nervous about booking because it was the only hotel left with rooms on a busy LA weekend. But, I was pleased to find helpful staff, a clean and stylish room, and a great view of Hollywood. The location is perfect if you are looking to walk to dinner or a movie, or just check out the walk of stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nonmanaged”
Reviews.Author: svbur
Reviews.Content: It is a shame that this potentially great structure has a management that does not do the work needed to run a hotel. We stayed there on a Saturday night in May 2004- anticipating that there might be a lot of noise on Hollywood Blvd we stayed in the cabana (pool) area at the back of the hotel. The pool and surrounding area supposedly closed at 10p.m. A loud group around the pool continued until 4a.m. and kept everyone in that area awake. Our call to the desk which should have been unnecessary - especially with the "security" personnel constantly patrolling - was received politely but the noise continued. We do not recommend this hotel and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All I can say about this hotel is fantastic! The location is great, right on the walk of fame. The room was spacious and very clean. There was even a premier party there one night! we did have a problem with an overflow in the toilet, but it was cleared up quickly and we had a complimentary breakfast for our trouble. (which was delicious) I recommend this hotel to anyone, it was beautiful, with an excellent view and lovely pool. The staff were helpful and polite and I enjoyed my stay so much, I didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JACKIEMCCANDLESS
Reviews.Content: I would like to tell people that if it is their first time in hollywood this hotel is excellent. Yes I do agree that this area can be quite dangerous at night but during the day what better place to stay. There are so many attractions, you can go acrosss to the chinese theatre, walk the walk of fame, get a tour from outside the chinese theatre(strongly reccommend ask for the tour guide Brian i think.) go shopping, and all the other attractions that this area has. At night get a taxi to the places where you would like to eat. As for the hotel we thought it was excellent. We were lucky enough to stay in Marlyin Monroe's old cabana room, which hasn't changed from she stayed there. Yes a lot of the furniture was from the 1950's but if it was good enough for her it was good enough for me???? The staff were excellent they were very helpful when we needed directions and places to go to a night. Try this hotel for yourself..

HotelInfo.Name: Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel - A Thompson Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 7000 Hollywood Boulevard, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90028
